Product: AMD Ryzen 7 5800X 8-core, 16-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor
Reviews: ['Good', 'Bought from Amazon JP. Came intact without any damages to the box or the CPU itself. Installed it and it worked perfectly. Benchmarked and it performed as expected vs other Ryzen 7 5800X on the market.', 'It comes in a box and in good condition. Installation is straightforward.', "Undervolted this with Ryzen Master and it runs all my games easily at 60 degrees C. Doesn't come with a cooler so you'll need to buy your own.", "Received in perfect condition,well packaged in box with airbag padding, no fins bent, thermal paste intact, preinstalled with AMD brackets but Intel brackets are also provided. I don't know why the other reviewers received theirs packages badly and damaged or with missing parts, maybe they got an irresponsible/dishonest packer?", 'As other comments have mentioned, Amazon sends all these Ryzen CPU boxes in a PADDED ENVELOPE which have a almost 100% chance to get crushed. They need to send this in their usual cardboard boxes, why they did not - puzzles me.Anyhow, mine was still working despite the box showing some signs of being crushed. A luck of the draw.The Ryzen 7 5800X at MSRP is still the best choice for production people who games, the 5900X is never found MSRP anyways so that upsell is not even a choice for the moment. While the 5600X is not as significant jump core number wise as I was using an intel quad core previously.', 'Arrived quite slow as it came from Japan. But packaging and item were flawless. Great price too..', 'The performance was expected as I did enough research pairing it with my 3070, bought from Amazon US no damage to the product and everything was good', 'Working fine and good. Came with good packaging', 'Fast cpu but gets hot to 90 degrees under moderately heavy load. Frequently crashes once it has hit the temperature limit for a while.']

Product: 3M CS100MB Adjustable CPU Stand
Reviews: ['Do the job', "Fist of all, it's not bad! It holds the a mid tower well. Based on it's sturdiness, I can't believe it handles up to 50lb.It does the job and for a not DIY option, I think it's the best option at the price range.I appreciate the space it leaves for the power supply fan and the distance it keeps the tower from the floor.", "Nice for the price and nice design, fold it up when you aren't using it.  I had another trolly but it had tall sides on it that blocked at least one of my fans, I like this one because it will not block your fans and it also is more or less open on the bottom so bottom fans should not be blocked either.  Easy to setup the upright things on the end of the arms simply twist into place and there is a wing nut on the bottom to tighten it up should it become loose, it will still move a bit even if the wingnut is tightened all the way down.  I looked a lot before I decided on this one, for the price it's a good deal the max weight is around 40 pounds which should be fine even on a supertower case unless you have tons of crap installed in the case.  This is the best design I've seen for these things, my only request would be a sturdier version using either sturdier plastic or even metal so it would support more weight it could also be a little bit wider back to front but I have no fear of the case tipping off this unit the way it is.", 'I have a new small form factor PC to replace the mid tower I am currently using.  The stand for the mid tower would not go small enough to hold the new computer.  I discovered that almost all stands only adjust down to around 6".  I was about to give up when I discover this stand which claimed to go down to 3.75".  My new computer is 4" wide, so I ordered this unit.  It does in fact hold my 4" wide PC, but there is one problem, as another reviewer mentioned, if the depth of the computer is less than 15" then all four pillars will not make contact with the computer.  That being said, the stand seems to work fine for me with just the front pillars holding the computer.  The stand is sturdy, and I do not see any danger of the computer tipping over.  Rolls ok on my laminate flooring.  I would have given 5 stars except for the depth issue.  Good stand...', 'Works out well for me in the end, but it was close! My gaming rig is wider than I thought it was and I was barely able to get the case in place without modifying something.On carpet, medium pile, I really cannot move this easily without the legs wanting to collapse in. Now it cannot collapse far as there is barely enough room for it to go far but it is worth mentioning.Quality of the plastic material is pretty hefty and I believe this will stand the test of time. Overall value is measured for me by what other options were available for the equated money ratio and it was pretty good here.Very good thing to keep your pc off the ground so that the fans do not suck in dirt, debris and other contaminants that will clog the fans.', 'This stand is lightweight and compact in size, and yet capable of expanding in width, to accommodate computer cases of varying sizes. The front wheels lock, to keep your computer securely in place. Being equipped with wheels, this stand can be rolled forward, when necessary, to access the cables at the rear of the computer. Thick and/or plush carpet may, however, pose a problem when rolling this, and other such CPU stands, across a carpeted floor. Importantly, the stand keeps my computer case elevated, up off the floor. Living outside the continental United States the weight, and therefore the shipping cost, of any CPU stand I purchased was a factor in my purchasing decision. Despite the low height profile of this CPU stand, I am quite happy with this product. Being a 3M product, it has been performing well for some years now. This product has met, and continues to meet my needs and expectations.', 'Easy to assemble and easy to move with your computer tower not being compromised.', "I was leary about ordering this stand from all the negative reviews, but I am happy I went with my gut feeling that a 3M product would be of good quality. This stand most certainly meets all my expectations.The stand raises the CPU 3.5 inches off the floor. If the stand and computer are positioned flush, right next to a wall, the side of the tower ends up being 1.5 inches away from the wall, sufficient for decent air circulation.There is a wing nut on the bottom of the stand to help hold the adjustable side pieces in position, but I found that the sides tended to expand somewhat even with it tightened.  I was afraid to overtighten, so perhaps if I hadn't been chicken, I could have gotten a firmer hold.I have the computer stand sitting on ceramic tile and have been able to move it easily with the sides staying in position.  The four upright side supports are well clad with a non-marring material.  The computer is safely nested.All in all, I feel that this is a well made, reasonably priced computer stand, and I definitely recommend it.", 'The stand is sturdy but CPU slides off the stand very easily when on carpet. You can only roll the computer by pulling or pushing the stand itself. If you try to move the computer case, is simply slides off the stand. The stand has 3" high padded posts on all 4 corners.  I used a load strap and wrapped it around the outside of all 4 posts with the computer box in the stand, cinched it down snug until the computer no longer slipped off the stand. With it strapped in, it works great.  I suspect it may work on bare floors but if it were me I would put some padding between the computer case bottom and the stand to provide some resistance so the it will not slide out of the stand so easily.', 'The stand works perfectly for our Aurora R9 and R11. They are now mobile, off the ground, and not subject to budging or tipping within the stand. Also, no added setup/build was needed, stand was ready to go right out of the box.']

Product: AMD Ryzen™ 5 7600X 6-Core, 12-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor
Reviews: ['Best way to get into the AM5 platform. Managed to OC to 5.5', 'Acheté pour "monter" un ordinateur plus récent pour en remplacer un vieillisant (12 ans) qui n\'était pas éligible à l\'installation de W11. L\'ensemble des composants choisis avec minutie me conforte dans l\'idée que j\'ai fais les bons choix. Tout est bien compatible, les performances sont au rendez-vous et après test du processeur via un benchmark, le résultat est très bon. Je ne l\'ai pas acheté pour jouer, mais pour faire du montage (photo et 3D). Il rempli parfaitement son rôle, pour un prix pas bon marché, mais honnête (payé 239€ en juillet 2023), franchement. Ce n\'est pas faute d\'avoir comparé. Pour moi, c\'est top. Tout à fait ce que je recherchais.', "Hade en processor från några år tillbaka, en Intel i5:a. Det är som natt och dag. Denna ligger på 7% load när den andra processorn låg på 80% :'DSamma sak med flera spel, har inte lyckats komma över att 15% .  Riktigt monster till processor. Det har verkligen gått framåt i utvecklingen denna generation.Om jag har något att klaga på så är det att den kan gå upp i höga temperaturer väldigt kort ibland, vilket gör att fläktarna spinner på bra en kort stund om man har en fläkt-kurva. Men i idle så ligger den på 41-44 grader, i spela något högre runt 49-59..Jag använder en Cooler Master ML240L V2 på den.", 'E\' il mio secondo acquisto di AMD dopo una lunga militanza con Intel. Devo dire che secondo la mia esperienza sono dei prodotti davvero molto validi. Nessuna instabilità con la build che possiedo attualmente che è visibile nella foto. Anche le temperature pur essendo in estate sono nella norma. Ovviamente dipende anche dal dissipatore che viene montato che nel mio caso è un Cooler Master MasterLiquid ML240L V2 RGB. Ci sono sicuramente dissipatori migliori. Uso il pc principalmente per giocare e al momento mi ritengo molto soddisfatto del rapporto qualità prezzo pur essendo consapevole che esistono processori migliori. Nel momento in cui scrivo ho da pochi minuti finito una sessione su StarCitizen. E nella stanza in cui è collocato il pc ci sono circa 29 gradi.  Ah dimenticato attualmente il processore ha un over clock fatto automaticamente con il software di AMD. Senza le temperature scendono intorno ai 38 gradi. In foto allego anche la velocità delle ventole che, a questi RPM, non danno nessun fastidio perché il "rumore" è minimo. Chiaramente si possono ottimizzare per farle essere ancora più silenziose ma nel mio caso ritengo di aver trovato il giusto compromesso. Se vi sono stato utile, fatemelo sapere con un "click" qui in basso. Buon acquisto!', 'I got this to pair up with a 7900 XTX for 4K gaming. This is a fantastic CPU, however there are a few things to know. I did pair this with 6000 CL36 RAM and a MSI B650 Tomahawk board. It ran EXPO with no issues, however the processor was running at a higher clock than factory and was causing some stability issues. To fix this issue I ran the CPU at a negative .15 offset. This brought stability to the system and also increased performance in games and in cinabench R23. Also to note this is a chip that runs hot, but that it is designed to run hot by AMD. To keep it cool I ran a EK 360 AIO and set the package temperature limit to 85 degrees. Even with the negative .15 offset and 85 degrees limit this chip benchmarked higher that most review I have seen for the 7600X. I did attempt a undervolt with PBO and it would not accept any, however with the setting I have previously mentioned this chip ran cool with awesome performance, still exceeding the factory 5.3 boost speeds. After settings were in place it was running games at 50-60c, with no bottlenecks on the 79000XTX at 1440p or 4K. Overall I am very pleased with my choice to get the 7600X as I only use it for gaming and no productivity. For anyone that is wanting a fast gaming CPU, this one will accomplish that at a very good price!', "Coming from an OCed 2700 I didn't expect this to be so hot.I have undervolted, lowered the throttle temp and put a cooler in that's 100w more powerful than needed. Still whilst gaming I get the occasion 80c spoke.OC this CPU is out of the question without a custom cooling loop or a very high quality AIO.That said it's quick, really quick. You very rarely see it operate at more than 50% even on big tasks.", 'Looked at several CPU’s for an update to a gaming pc before I decided on this one having spoken to a friend who builds high end gaming pc’s about a full build for around £500 without graphics card, he advised this is just about the best AMD for what I was looking for.Easy install just follow instruction you literally cannot go wrong. Processing speed & power seem great, not been completed long so still a few power hungry games to load & tryout.Tom', 'Principalmente en un uso para gaming o edición es lo mejor calidad/precio. Velocidad sobrada para todo y no vas a tener cuellos de botella en 2023 en cualquier juego ni programa. Como punto negativo encuentro la temperatura que puede alcanzar hasta poniendo un disipador de media calidad. Si decides que éste procesador es el que mas te cuadra vas a tener que invertir en una refrigeración bastante decente para que el procesador no pase calor.Muy buen producto si tienes en cuenta ese punto.', 'Awesome CPU, originally had a r5 2600 which was struggling with MSFS. Upgrading to the 7600x gave me a huge performance boost and could run MSFS with zero issues and zero stuttering and etc.', 'Was soll ich sagen, ich bin einfach zufrieden.Die CPU ist der beste einstieg wenn man in die neuere Generation eintauchen will. Preis/Leistung top.Wurde schnell und sicher geliefert, musste an der Tür dem Boten extra ein Code sagen.Hatte vorher den Ryzen 5 5600g mit AM4 sockel um es gab einen deutlichen Leistungsschub den man auch merkt.Also für den Preis kann man echt nicht Falsch machen, wenn man von AM4 aussteigen will.Klare kauf Empfehlung.']

Product: AMD Ryzen 5 5500 6-Core, 12-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor with Wraith Stealth Cooler, Ceramic Gray
Reviews: ["For me CPUs like this, which are budget CPUs are mostly about the price.  For $100 USD or less this is an excellent buy.  If it's more than that, uhhhh.  I'll take the 5600 for $130 Bob.While this is a Zen 3 CPU, it's not PCIe gen4 and you should be aware of this before buying.  It's not the same line of CPU that most Zen 3 CPUs which are Vermeer.  This is Cezanne.  There are 3 Cezanne CPUs, the other two are OEM only, meaning they only come in a PC you buy from a company that makes PCs like Dell, etc........  For the most part this isn't a problem because it's a budget CPU, however if you pair this with something like an AMD Radeon 6500 XT which only uses 4 PCIe lanes to connect to the CPU, you'll get bad performance.  So don't do that.Otherwise as long as you pair this with at least an 8 PCIe lane GPU it works fine.  You take a tiny hit in GPU performance but not enough to worry about.The bigger hit comes with the NVMe drives, especially in 2023 and going forward.  There are now MANY NVMe disks that are a lot faster than 4GB/s, and to give as simple explanation as I can, a PCIe lane is a serial data line.  The way a PCIe device/bus works is by grouping a certain amount of lanes so that you get the speed of a single PCIe lane times the number of lanes you have.  Any NVMe disk has 4 lanes.  It also means the port you plug it into along with what it connects to (CPU, motherboard chipset) has 4 PCIe lanes that it will connect with.  So, you get 4 PCIe lanes. So now you need to know the data speed for each lane.  For PCIe gen3, the speed of each lane is 1GB/s.  For PCIe gen4 the speed of each lane is 2GB/s.  So, with this CPU, the best you can get is a data transfer rate of 4GB/s to an NVMe disk.  That's it.  The newest disks coming out the end of 2022, and 2023 can hit speeds near 9GB/s.  Now, most data transfers to/from NVMe disks can't run at that speed.  However many disks can run many data transfers faster than 4GB/s, so that means a CPU that runs PCIe gen3 is slowing down modern NVMe disks that can run gen4 or now gen5 speeds.  But that's not a statement that has a clear meaning, because just because a disk is called gen4, it doesn't mean most of the data transfers to/from that disk will run at the full bandwidth of PCIe gen4 x4 lanes = 8GB/s.  Most gen4 disks rarely hit that speed if ever.  Only the most expensive ones do.  BUT once again many will run different types of transfers above 4GB/s.So that's the description of what it means to have PCIe gen3 when dealing with modern NVMe disks.  You're going to slow down some of the data transfers, not all, depending on how fast (which also means more expensive) the disk is.Yes for a general purpose PC build this is good enough and it's a low cost option that's really good at $100 USD or less.  However if the price of this starts to get closer to the Ryzen 5600, I'd rather buy the 5600 because that's PCIe gen4 which is as good as it gets with an AMD AM4 motherboard.", "This is a great CPU for general use and budget/mid-range gaming! It's able to keep up with all my computing tasks and when gaming with my AMD RX6700XT. Seriously I am very impressed. I will say that when I first installed it, the CPU was running a little warm, but nothing too bad and after a few days it seemed to settle down and now typically sits around 55-65 degrees even while gaming/computing in this hot SoCal summer. I generally see about 20% to 30% usage while playing pretty recent games on 1440p and ultra quality. Would I prefer a 5600x, 5700x or 5800x? Of course, but for the price, nothing beats the value of this CPU and I'm just not willing to spend double the price on relatively limited performance increases. As long as you're not planning to do some extremely CPU-heavy tasks or overclocking, this CPU should fit your needs perfectly. The Wraith Stealth cooler is a nice free add-on as well, although I would suggest if you're looking for ultimate performance, you might want to contemplate a tower air cooler or AIO. However, the Wraith is more than adequate by itself. Anyway, I can't recommend this CPU enough. Keep in mind though, if you're used to Intel CPUs which typically come with integrated graphics, this CPU does not (only G series AMD CPUs like the 5600G for example include integrated graphics although they don't perform as CPUs as well as non G series), so you'll have to buy a graphics card. Also keep in mind X series CPUs like the 5600x are for extreme overclocking (I would go easy on overclocking non-X CPUs and for a lower ranged CPU like this one I would not recommend any overclocking at all). Hope that helps with your decision! Thanks for reading", "Processore mid range ottimo, per il prezzo che costa io lo ho preso a 95 euro, riesce a dare delle ottime performance per giocare, editare e registrare, lo ho accoppiato con una RX 6650xt e 32gb di RAM a 3200mhz, mai avuto il computer così veloce, riesco a gestire tutte le mie applicazioni anche con giochi abbastanza pesanti e importanti aperti come GTA V e Destiny 2 con qualità al massimo e fare tranquillamente 100+ FPS, veramente consigliato per chi deve fare upgrade da un ryzen 3 e si trova ancora su piattaforma AM4, se invece volete un po' più di performance vi consiglio di cambiare scheda madre e passare ad AM5 per avere anche spazio per futuri upgrade da parte di AMD", 'Estoy sumamente satisfecho con el rendimiento de este procesador, tanto en juegos como en programas relativamente exigentes que se requieren en la universidad. Prácticamente puedo ejecutar cualquier tarea sin problemas y a un precio muy asequible, desde mi punto de vista. Cabe destacar que he pasado de utilizar un Athlon 3000G, por lo que los resultados para mí son extremadamente notables. Sin embargo, es importante mencionar que no juego títulos exigentes ni nada por el estilo, ya que prefiero los juegos casuales. Por lo tanto, no puedo ofrecer mi perspectiva en cuanto a esos juegos más demandantes.Dicho esto, considero que este procesador es una excelente opción para aquellos que buscan un rendimiento sólido tanto en juegos como en aplicaciones de uso diario. Su precio asequible lo convierte en una opción atractiva para estudiantes y usuarios que no requieren un alto nivel de exigencia en sus tareas informáticas. En resumen, recomendaría este procesador para aquellos que buscan una mejora significativa en el rendimiento de su sistema sin tener que invertir grandes sumas de dinero.', 'Très bon processeur même si je l’ai acheté quand il était encore un peu plus cher je l’ai acheter avec une rx 6700xt et personnellement le combo est parfait en hd très stable même à haute fréquence et jamais j’ai eu un bug peut être parce que j’ai une bonne config avec un bon ssd et une bonne ram mais j’ai jamais eu un problème et l’a température est très bonne le ventilateur suffit à lui même', "Le ventilateur qui viens avec le processeur fait genre, beaucoup de bruit. Je pensais que bouger le ventilateur en mode PWD au lieu de DC allait aider le problème mais non, même problème. Mais il fait quand même son travail et à l'intérieur d'une case, le bruit est quand même pas mal assimilé.", 'Chegou tudo certinho, dentro do prazo e muito bem embalado. O que me chamou a atenção foi que mesmo meu pedido ter ficado dias na alfândega em Curitiba chegou tudo bem embalado, certinho, sem danos e dentro do prazo. Não vou poder fazer o teste pois o que falta para minha configuração é somente a fonte de alimentação (que já realizei a compra) más, quando eu puder testar, mais pra frente venho e edito direitinho este comentário e coloco a performace e testes desta CPU.', 'Habe mir die 5500 gekauft um eine 2200G zu ersetzen da diese bei etwas moderneren Spielen an ihre Grenzen kommt. Ich habe diese jetzt in Kombination mit einer GeForce 1060 mit 6GB im Einsatz und kann bspw. Witcher 3 oder Tropico 6 ohne Probleme spielen (habe lediglich einen Full HD Monitor mit 60Hz, da läuft alles ohne Einschränkungen - Richtige Gamer werden natürlich für aktuelle Games nicht damit glücklich werden, aber da ich nie die neusten Spiele kaufe und auch keinen 4k Monitor habe, ist der 5500 absolut ausreichend. Für gewöhnliche Anwendungen wie Office, Internet oder Streamen ist der Prozessor ohnehin weit unterfordert, da reicht ein 3200G/3300G. Wichtig für Leute die wie ich von einem Ryzen mit integrierter Vega Grafik zum 5500er welchseln: Zu diesem Prozessor benötigt man eine eigene Grafikkarte (vl ist diese Info ja für irgendjemanden hilfreich).Preislich absolut zu empfehlen (habe unter 100eur bezahlt), für dieses Geld wird man schwer eine bessere CPU finden.', 'Ya lo he comentado anteriormente. Le han montado un ordenador a mi hija comprando todos los componentes de Amazon de buena calidad.  Increíble. Precio comparando con uno de tienda un 25% de su precio.', 'Al momento de llegar la caja venia intacta un punto de confianza, por el momento el procesador se comporta de rechupete y su uso no pasa del 10% haciendo un uso normal como navegar y usar programas sencillos, en gaming el uso sube pero se comporta muy bien!! Te recomiendo este procesador si buscas algo económico y excelente para gaming y uso cotidiano B)']

Product: AMD 7000 Series Ryzen 7 7800X 3D Desktop Processor 8 cores 16 Threads 104 MB Cache 4.2 GHz Upto 5.6 GHz Socket AM5 (100-100000910WOF)
Reviews: ['The build I paired this CPU with is as follows:CPU: 7800x3dMotherboard: Gigabyte Aorus Master X670ERAM: G.Skill Trident Z5 NEO RGB Series (AMD Expo) 32GB (2 x 16GB) 288-Pin SDRAM DDR5 6000 CL30-38-38-96 1.35V Dual Channel Desktop Memory F5-6000J3038F16GX2-TZ5NR (Matte Black)Cooler: Artic Liquid Freezer II 360Case: Cooler Master Cosmos II (From previous builds, I never change cases)Storage: Primary/boot is a Crucial T700 PCIE 5.0, with 3 other nvme drives and about 100tb of platter storage.PSU: EVGA 1600w G+GPU: Gigabyte Gaming OC RTX 4090This is my first AMD CPU ever, in fact I upgraded from an Intel-based build, an i9-12900k. Normally I do not upgrade so soon, I usually upgrade platforms in 4 year increments but the performance gains with 3dvCache in my games were too much to pass up.This CPU excels in strategy games such as games by Paradox Interactive (Europa Universalis IV, Stellaris, etc) and is no slouch with other genres either, FPS, RPG, you-name-it. I was getting terrible lag late game in Stellaris in particular on my 12900k and this 7800x3d made a hugely noticeable difference, with 10,000 pops and a 1,000 star galaxy and hundreds of millions of fleetpower with many mods.Rimworld is another example where this CPU shines. I was trying to conquer the world in one of my Rimworld playthroughs and the late game lag on the 12900k was too much to bear, it killed the run - was unplayable. This CPU turned the stutter into smoothness even with close to 50 colonists, many mods, many robots, and so on.Overall a very good CPU I expect to last me at least 4 years playing AAA and strategy games.', 'I have gotten this paired with a 6600xt from my old prebuilt and 32gb 6000mhz ram, and it runs really well on games like fortnite i get around 400-700fps or a stable 360 capped game with occasional stutters and frame drops but that’s fortnite and the 6600xt Amd cards aren’t very good on it but the cpu was being almost fully utilized and the gpu was about 20%, I’ve tried mw2 it gets like 130fps but I don’t play it much and don’t have very many other games I tested gta 5 with mods and graphics mods and was getting like 188fps with just 1080p but I don’t know how to uncap fps on gta for some reason it’s specifically 188, maybe it was my gpu idk, unfortunately still feels like my 5600g on non game applications, not great, but still plan on upgrading my gpu to something like a 4070 or 4080. And I still hear the odd ticking or buzzing / malfunctioning sounding noise from the cpu running games I’m not sure if that’s normal it’s the same with my 5600g so I guess it’s a Amd thing.But it’s pretty good for games, especially if your not able to upgrade your gpu yet and the cpu will pretty much do all the work your gpu can’t with fps.', "I've always been an Intel guy, but there is no denying right now that AMD are making the fastest gaming chips. If you care about gaming performance, you cannot currently do better than this chip.The main competitive game I play is Warzone 2. I have the water-cooled version of the 3080ti (it has its own pump and exhaust fans) and I had previously been running an i9 10900k. It was cooled by a Noctua NHD15 on Windows 11 at 1440p. No matter how low I put the graphics settings, I could only ever average about 120-130 FPS with very frequent drops to 100-110FPS and some occasional drops to the high 80's and low 90's. This held true even if I used DLSS Performance mode. Zero difference in average FPS.  It felt absolutely terrible to try to push an enemy team at close range with mortar strikes and smoke grenades going off and have a huge FPS drop. Felt equally as bad to stare off at a big cityscape horizon while trying to take long range precision shots and suddenly have to fight system performance.Long story short, I paired the 7800X3D with a Gigabyte x670 Aorus Elite AX motherboard and 32GB of DDR5 6000mhz Corsair Vengeance RAM, and my average FPS has exploded up to 190-210. Jumping out the plane I'm almost always above 200FPS, which is just absurd to me, and I'm frequently in the 210-220 range just running around Al Mazrah. My 1% lows are in the 165-180 range, which I can barely feel.I've tested this CPU as well in BF2042 and The Last of Us Part 1. Basically, I'm never CPU-bound anymore. When I lower my graphics settings, I get a lot of FPS back. That never used to happen. On my 3080ti + i9 10900k setup, it DIDN'T matter how low I dropped the graphics. There was minimal FPS difference between high and medium and even less difference between medium and low, because I was CPU bound.Now that I'm no longer CPU bound, I can drop graphics settings and get a LOT of FPS back or settle on a nice mix of medium & high for a story-driven game like TLOU and still get fantastic FPS with almost zero noticeable drops.Back when I was getting frustrated with WZ2 FPS drops, I had seriously considered that I might need to upgrade my GPU to a 4090 and I've very glad I held off on that decision. 4090 MSRP right now is $1600 without tax and I can't find any on Amazon below $1700. With tax you're looking at a pretty penny, and my FPS issues still would have continued unabated because I'd have been addressing the wrong problem.This CPU + mobo + RAM altogether came out to $972.98 with tax. So I basically saved at least $700 and probably more while massively increasing the performance scaling of the games I play and unlocking the full potential of my watercooled 3080ti.I did have to order an AM5 mounting bracket for my Noctua cooler, but that was only like 7 bucks and it was easy to install.When it comes to CPU's, I can officially be counted as a member of team red. I've been building PC's since 2006 and every single one of them up until now has had an Intel chip in it, but there is no denying the raw performance of 3D v cache in certain games, particularly in the battle royale genre.", "J'ai toujours été Intel , mais la sur un coup de tete j'ai acheter ce processeur pour mon ordi , il faut bien ce faire une idée propre et pas ce méfier de ce que les autres dissent , ça va faire 1 semaine , et ce processeur ne chauffe pas il est refroidi par un AIO watercooling de chez Be Quiet , presque sur tous les jeux il depasse pas les 65°.", "Pros:- Gaming performance is unmatched.- AMD finally grows up with the AM5 socket and ditches CPU pins.  This was probably the easiest computer build I've ever done, in part due to this.- Way more power efficient under load than the competition.Cons:- It's cheaper than the top tier, but $449 still isn't cheap, especially for only 8 cores.- Performance for everything besides gaming is, at best, middle of the road.  This is a gaming CPU through and through; if you care about performance for anything else, don't get it.This CPU choice was a bit of a departure for me.  I usually just get the most expensive consumer processor available.  But, with GPU prices and motherboard prices the way they are (this was the first time I've paid more for the motherboard than the CPU), plus the off-the-charts power and thermals for some of the more expensive options, I had to settle for some compromises.  But, one thing I didn't want to compromise on was gaming performance, and with the 7800X3D, I don't have to!", "First off, this is an amazing CPU. Paired with an Nvidia 4090 at UltraWide 3440x1440, it crushes everything i throw it at on max settings.WARNING - THIS CPU RUNS HOT!!!!! Even with a Kracken Elite 360mm it idles around 40c and gets up to 60-65 while gaming....Now.. where the issues came in - and it's not the CPU's fault - was pairing it with a motherboard that would work. I initially paired this with an NZXT N7 650E, and no matter how many different BIOS I tried, or clearing CMOS, or trying RAM setsup... I couldn't get it to post. Thought it was a bad board, and even the 2nd board wouldn't work. Decided to switch to MSI b650 and it posted first try. No issues.Do your homework, and if this review is old by the time you read it, motherboards should have worked out the AM5 kinks and all mobos will be compatible.", "Processore dedicato al Gaming con prestazioni eccezionali paragonabili al 13900k di Intel ma costa 200 euro di meno. Super consigliato per i giocatori. Non velocissimo in produttivita' stando alle recensioni ma arrivo da un 10900K e non percepisco differenze quindi velocita' assolutamente accettabile anche in ambiente non video ludico. Super consigliato.", 'What can I say; im asbolutely speechless in the generational bump and upgrade I took.I went from a i7-4790k and im floored!This CPU exceed my expectations by far; and its extra 3D Cache designed for gaming is amazing!If your considering buying this Processor! You should do it!The value for performance is well worth it!Defintely reccommend.Just make sure you get an appropriate Cooler designed for this CPU; as it does run hot!', "Star Citizen is only in alpha, but it's a game of massive scope and is heavily CPU-bound. All but the best systems can struggle in some areas of dense geometry and textures, but this CPU is the best considering cost/benefit. The 7800X3D is even better for this game than the 7900 and 7950, but Google it to see why.All told, I did my research and found the best bang for the buck. Plus, AMD was and may still be running a promotion to receive Starfield free with purchase, though AMD has not sent me the code I need to complete the registration process, so there's that. Hopefully they fix this before Starfield releases.If you're a Star Citizen player, this is the CPU you want and should build a system around.", 'I just upgraded from a AM4 build with a Ryzen 9 5900x, 64 gigs of ram running at 3600mt, gigabyte x570 AORUS pro Wi-Fi and asus Strix RTX4090. I knew upgrading to the Ryzen 7800x3d would be a down grade in non game applications and not all games would see a boost. I didn’t want to spend the extra money on the 7950x3d only to have to turn off half the cores to take advantage of the extra cache without having issues in some games if you rely on Microsoft game bar to switch automatically. The 7900x3d has the same issue but your down to 6 cores when gaming to use the extra cache. Mine is running stable and cool running at 4944Mhz at idle and will boost to 5150Mhz for a short time then run 6 or 7 cores at 5150 MHz for as long as needed. Under heavy load the system will run at 79c. When gaming depending the game it will be in upper 50c range to 60c range. I’m using a EK 360 mm AIO to cool the cpu. The primary reason I went AMD AM5 vs intel 13th gen is the heat the system would generate running a Intel 13700 or 13900. My room the computer is in isn’t big and my AM4 system heated the room up pretty good, enough that I need to run ac in the summer to keep the room comfortable. The other plus is the AM5 system has an upgrade path in the future but the current intel socket doesn’t. This CPU does run some newer games that can utilize the extra up to about 20 percent at best which is a big boost but your not going to see huge gains across the board if your on high end AM4 system. Still worth it to me and I’ll be on this platform for a few CPU generations just like with AM4 if you started when it was new.']

Product: AMD Ryzen 5 5600 6-Core, 12-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor with Wraith Stealth Cooler, Ceramic Gray
Reviews: ["Don't expect much from a 5600", 'Got the CPU as a replacement for my old 1700 Ryzen. Put new life into my system, and now it feels like a brand new system again.', 'The CPU worked fantastic, the cooler looked pristine. However, the thermal paste on the stock cooler seemed very degraded and not a perfect solid circle. The cpu also looks used albeit the performance was impeccable', 'The 32MB of L3 cache on the 5600 and the strong single-core performance (I know, not cutting-edge single core perf. anymore in 2023, but still...) made this CPU a lifesaver for my framerate in modded Minecraft around the animal pens in my base (the kind of scenario where Minecraft proves to be the most CPU-bottlenecked experience of any PC game, in my experience).I upgraded to this from a Ryzen 7 1700, and noticed a drastic difference in performance with otherwise the same hardware.Here\'s the rundown of the performance difference I experienced from upgrading from Ryzen 7 1700 to Ryzen 5 5600 (see also the picture):[] ~30% improvement to 0.1% lows in Unigine Superposition @ 1080p Extreme (This means, much more stable framerate without stutters)[] ~12% improvement to 0.1% lows in MSI Kombustor MSI-01 OpenGL test 1080p (This means, more stable framerate without stutters)[] ~46% across-the-board improvement to average framerate, 1% lows, and 0.1% lows in Minecraft running what I call "The chicken test" (simulates lag around lots of active mobs)[] ~19% across-the-board improvement to average framerate, 1% lows, and 0.1% lows in Horizon Zero Dawn at 1080p Ultra Quality/Max settings[] ~51% single-core performance uplift in Cinebench R23[] ~23% multi-core performance uplift in Cinebench R23All in all the Ryzen 5 5600 is a fantastic budget upgrade if you have an older AM4 system. The motherboard being used here is an ASRock B450M A/C R-2.0.I have just upgraded the RAM now too and endeavor to see what the performance difference is with faster-clocked RAM versus the older RAM speeds on the 5600 that were same as what the Ryzen 7 1700 was running at.', 'Der AMD Ryzen 5 5600 hat meine Erwartungen übertroffen und sich als eine herausragende CPU erwiesen, die sowohl leistungsstark als auch äußerst effizient ist.Die Installation war ein Kinderspiel, und die Kompatibilität mit modernen Mainboards macht ihn zu einer vielseitigen Wahl für verschiedene PC-Builds.Die Leistung dieses Prozessors ist beeindruckend. Egal, ob es sich um anspruchsvolle Spiele, komplexe Aufgaben im Bereich der Videobearbeitung oder Multitasking handelt, der Ryzen 5 5600 bewältigt alles mühelos. Die Geschwindigkeit und Reaktionsfähigkeit sind wirklich bemerkenswert.Die Energieeffizienz dieses Prozessors ist ein großer Pluspunkt. Er liefert erstklassige Leistung bei niedrigem Stromverbrauch, was nicht nur die Umwelt schont, sondern auch die Stromrechnung reduziert.Die Kompatibilität mit den neuesten Technologien, einschließlich PCIe 4.0 und schnellem DDR4-Speicher, macht diesen Prozessor zukunftssicher und bietet Raum für Upgrades.Die Wärmeableitung und Kühlung sind ebenfalls bemerkenswert. Der Ryzen 5 5600 bleibt selbst unter Last kühl und leise.Insgesamt ist der AMD Ryzen 5 5600 eine beeindruckende CPU, die die Erwartungen in Bezug auf Leistung und Effizienz übertrifft. Egal, ob Sie ein Gamer, ein Content-Ersteller oder einfach nur auf der Suche nach einem leistungsstarken Prozessor für Ihren PC sind, der Ryzen 5 5600 ist die perfekte Wahl. Eine Investition, die sich wirklich auszahlt.', "L'AMD Ryzen 5 5600 è un processore di fascia media che offre prestazioni eccezionali in un pacchetto accessibile. Con una combinazione di potenza di calcolo e efficienza energetica, questo processore si distingue in una varietà di applicazioni.L'installazione è stata semplice e ho notato un notevole aumento delle prestazioni del mio sistema dopo l'upgrade. Le prestazioni in giochi, applicazioni multimediali e attività di produttività sono state eccezionali, grazie alla sua architettura Zen 3. La sua capacità di multitasking è notevole, e non ho riscontrato alcun problema nell'esecuzione di diverse attività simultaneamente.La gestione termica è buona, grazie al processo di produzione a 7nm e al dissipatore di calore incluso. Inoltre, il basso consumo energetico lo rende una scelta energetica efficiente.Tuttavia, è importante notare che è necessario disporre di una scheda madre compatibile con la serie Ryzen 5000 per sfruttare appieno le prestazioni di questo processore.In conclusione, l'AMD Ryzen 5 5600 è un processore di alta qualità che offre prestazioni all'avanguardia in un prezzo accessibile. È una scelta eccellente per chi cerca un aggiornamento del processore che migliorerà notevolmente le prestazioni del proprio sistema. Con una valutazione di 5 stelle, lo raccomando vivamente a chiunque cerchi un processore di fascia media di alta qualità.", 'PREMESSA: Questa recensione è un modo divertente di interpretare il prodotto. Le informazioni relativamente importanti sono contrassegnate da ">>".Acquistai questo prodotto nel lontano 2022, in una giornata piovosa di Ottobre.Ero seduto nella mia sedita a non fare una mazza, osservando ben bene il mio ormai obsoleto i3 8100 che ormai mi sopportava e chiedeva pietà dal lontanissimo 2018.Dopo essermi recato all\'ufficio postale più vicino a versare una somma di denaro pari al prezzo del prodotto sulla mia PosteItaliane® PostePay™ Evolution (Black) (Yellow outlines), tornai alla mia abitazione (con l\'ombrello perché mannaggia pioveva un botto).Dopo aver ordinato l\'articolo per una somma di denaro pari a euro 151.00, il mio i3 8100 ebbe finalmente un sospiro di sollievo (non sapendo che dopo sarebbe finito nel pc di mio padre lmao).Abbinai questo processo(re) alla fantomatica scheda madre Asrock® B550M Steel Legend™, che arrivò due settimane dopo perché ✨mannaggia a GLS✨.Dopo essermi reso conto che l\'intero insieme dell\'hardware a mia disposizione non sarebbe stato la migliore delle idee con questa nuova combo CPU e MOBO, decisi di acquistare altri 250 prodotti diversi (come solito al mondo del PC gaming), riuscendo infine ad arrivare ad una configurazione di mio gradimento (6700 XT goes brrrr).Possiamo parlare dell\'articolo (!).Sike.La scatola emana potenza. La scritta AMD è molto grande e visibile alle persone con problemi visivi.Il processore è visibile al lato della scatola in tutta la sua MASSA.Aprendolo, avremo una sorpresa: una tecnologia talmente avanzata che risulta essere necessaria assieme al nostro processore: un dissipatore AMD® Wraith™ Stealth, consigliabile per un utilizzo non paragonabile al mio. Tale dissipatore deve sopportare il mio PBO a 105W. (Sono povero) (Amazon Vine pls take me in I need a new CPU cooler thx).Il dissipatore AMD® Wraith™ Stealth risulta essere un discreto prodotto capace di "dissipare" il nostro processore in carichi relativamente leggeri come il gaming. Generalmente, la CPU non andrà in thermal throttling sotto tale sistema di dissipazione, pur essendo leggermente rumoroso.(TL;DR: funziona fa casino lmao)Possiamo parlare dell\'articolo (!). PT2Not Sike.Il 5600 è un 5600X copypastato con 200MHz in meno di clock.Fine recensione.Another sike.Possiamo notare nella parte inferiore dell\'articolo la presenza di numerosi CHIODI METALLICI, comunemente chiamati pin, che permettono l\'interlacciamento tra il nostro amato processore e una scheda madre possibilmente AM4 compatibile (Highly recommended se non volete usarlo come fermacarte).>> Vi servirà un firmware UEFI con AGESA 1.2.0.7, altrimenti noterete il nulla cosmico nel vostro monitor (collegato possibilmente alla porta HDMI o DisplayPort della scheda video di vostra scelta) e avrete di conseguenza un fermacarte pur avendo una scheda madre compatibile.AGGIORNATEVI IL BIOS  !. Dovrebbe essere supportato su ogni scheda madre AM4. Tranne alcune B350 se il vostro produttore non risulta essere una brava persona.Nella parte superiore dell\'articolo troveremo la scritta Ryzen 5 5600 che ci conferma ancora una volta che purtroppo non avete ricevuto un 5800X3D. Nei lati è presente del metallo.>> Una volta montato il vostro PC e installato il sistema operativo di vostra scelta, è altamente consigliabile, nel caso usiate Windows, l\'installazione dei Chipset Drivers DAL SITO UFFICIALE AMD. Se avete una B550, vi basterà cercare "B550 Chipset Drivers".- A chi è adatto questo processore?A chi ha i soldi.A chi non ha troppi soldi.A chi ha abbastanza soldi e vuole giocare in grazia di Dio.Se avete un utilizzo mediamente intensivo, questo processore fa per voi:Non avrete problemi di bottleneck su qualsiasi scheda grafica dedicata al 1440P. Nel mio caso, con una 6700 XT risulta essere un ottimo abbinamento.Avete una 6800? Va beneAvete una 4090? Compratevi il 13900K e non state dietro alle CPU da 150€ (dopo averne speso 2500 di GPU).- Overclocking👍PBO2 funziona che una meraviglia: -20 sul Curve VCore e + 200MHz per me è stata una configurazione stabile. Arriva tranquillamente ai livelli del 5600X stock con un po\' di tuning.- Consumi, TDP, robeSenza overclocking, non consuma una mazza, 70W di picco forse al 100% di carico. In gaming 35 probabilmente.Con overclocking inizia a farsi sentire, 105W di picco massimo nel mio caso. Nulla di ingestibile in ogni caso dal dissipatore stock.Non avete soldi per un 7600X, B650 e DDR5? Fa assolutamente al caso vostro.Credo sia definitivamente best buy considerato il costo attuale della piattaforma AM4, aggiunto ai costi ormai insignificanti delle ram DDR4.', "As of this review I have already upgraded as planned to a 5800x3d with an aftermarket cooler and used those for a while but here is my review from memory.The 5600 and X variant DO NOT have on-board graphics if you are building with that in mind please look at the 5600g variant or a newer APU.This CPU was a massive upgrade for me in gaming and even more for productivity from a very old Intel CPU so take that with a grain of salt.In gaming this is a very powerful CPU for the vast majority of people. If you are gaming under 144hz and on a budget this is easily one of the best you can get from this generation.This is continually one of, if not the highest, value cpu's as it comes with a very beefy performance for its cost and a cooler all in one package.I had near-flawless performance when used on my 144hz 1440p monitor in most of my games. I generally reduce in-game settings to accommodate higher framerate which does often reduce CPU load as well but reducing max framerates to 120 and more-so 90 at comparable settings would be even more ideal if going for higher settings or a smoother 1% framerate experience for fast games.Productivity - I had two monitors and often I watch videos, streamers, chat with friends and browse(browsers can be quite CPU intensive at times due if not using hardware-encoding which in my case I did not due to compatibility issues with other software)All-in-all if you are building a new system, you may want to look at the newer AMD 7600 lineup as it is very similar, but if squeezing out a smaller budget with a very good sale or a used purchase, the 5600 will last you at minimum 4 years without issue.", "Le socket AM4 n'a pas encore tiré sa révérence et il reste un très bon choix pour les budgets serrés. Outre le prix du processeur, on économise également sur la carte mère et la mémoire (DDR4). Avec l'argent mis de coté, on peut investir dans la carte graphique... ou dans un ventirad un peu meilleur que celui fourni de base (un peu bruyant et limité en cas d'usage intensif type MSFS).", 'I got this CPU to replace my tired old Ryzen 3 1200. It was a major bottleneck to my GPU, an RTX 1050ti (soon to be replaced as well). I don’t play any serious games, unless you consider Division 2, WoWs, and Dying Light 2 serious. Regardless, those games suffered some serious chop and at times would freeze requiring me to restart the game.The only hiccup I ran into was of my own making. When trying to update BIOS on my motherboard (ASRock A320m-HDV R4), I didn’t download the correct drivers. After getting this problem fixed, install and booting up with the new CPU wasn’t according to plan. My only complaint is that the box the processor came in wasn’t in the best of shape.']

Product: Intel Core i3 (12th Gen) i3-12100 Quad-core (4 Core) 3.30 GHz Processor - Retail Pack, Blue
Reviews: ['Strong single core. Decent multicore. For day to day use like browsing and MS Office this is perfect. Very good in gaming too. Why spend more.', 'Came in early.. box damaged but luckily cpu was in good condition.. used to update bios on h670 board to finally use a 13th gen cpu.. worked well.. and now its on its own right.. no videocard for now but it works pretty well.. and didnt expect this to come with a fan.. thought it didnt have.. paired this with a b760m d3sh..Thanks seller!', 'Tengo un i7-10700K. En Single-Core gana al 10700k (Estoy flipao). En Aida64 en el apartado memorias funciona igual que el 10700k a 50000 MB mas o menos con memorias 12-100 3600mhz y i7-10700k 3900Mhz. En ciertas pruebas de Aida64 gana el 12100, y en las que demanda mas cpu los 8 cores del 10700K se imponen. Pero que este chiquitín le plante cara a mi 10700K no está nada mal.  Y todo un Mini-PC que me salió por 380€.Para mucha gente este micro es mas que suficiente. Tiene potencia.', "Bon processeur. L'avantage de l'entrée de gamme comme ça c'est qu'il consomme moins, quand il ne sera plus assez puissant je pourrai le recycler en serveur multimédia", "J'ai acheté ce processeur pour pouvoir le mettre dans un pc de bureau. Les performances sont au rendez-vous.Le partie graphique du processeur permet de mettre 2 écrans sans qu'il y ai de bug ou de ralentissement.Le processeur est vraiment un bon compromis, il peut aussi bien être performant en application bureautique que en jeux si vous le couplez avec un carte graphique.", 'Ótimo para aplicações simples como exibir video em múltiplas telas ou então executar programas leves', 'Comprei para uso domestico para ter muiot tempo de durabilidade, porém roda muitos programas pesados. vale a pena', 'Puede casi con todo... Es muy muy bueno... agosto 2023', 'Buen procesador lo recomiendo.!', 'very good product']

Product: Intel® Core™ i7-10700F Desktop Processor 8 Cores up to 4.8 GHz Without Processor Graphics LGA1200 (Intel® 400 Series chipset) 65W
Reviews: ['good', 'Llegó a tiempo y en Perfecto estado.', 'Otimo processador, roda qualquer coisa.', 'liked  good fit well', 'OK', "No on board gpu means a tad harder to build with. But that means more back end speed.Only 10th gen, if you can go 11. But price is good.Will likely buy again for low high end builds. Only draw back no pcie 4, as it's 10th gen.", 'Muy buena compra no me arrepiento para nada, este producto cumple totalmente las expectativas me gusto mucho la forma en la que lo enviaron, sin duda una compra de la cual no me arrepiento.', 'Syper rápida la entrega me dejo sorprendido y el p3oducto hasta el momento va bien', 'I went from a 10050 i3 to this i7.  My system is a beast!', "There is nothing wrong with this processor.  Depending on the motherboard you choose you will see a difference in performance.  I choose the AsRock  W480 Creator.  Anandtech.com has a great article on this processor.  Also Steve at Gamers Nexus has great information on the behavior of the 10700k with different motherboards.  With my board I have seen the power draw go to 183 watts  at 4.6mhz during cinebench r23 for around 50 seconds, then the processor's power draw drops to 95 watts and it slows to 3.6 mhz. When I actually encode a video it uses 82 watts at 4.6mhz.  So it depends on what you are doing.  I use a Noctua NH U 9s cooler with dual fans.  Temps average 68 c at the highest.  Browsing the internet or using Microsoft Word it idles at 29c and 30 watts. Not much a game player these days but it will use around 40 watts and temps are around 60c. I like it and would not hesitate to purchase another if needed."]

Product: AMD Ryzen™ 5 7600 6-Core, 12-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor
Reviews: ["I was going to build a streaming PC with the cheaper AM4 parts, then decided to go with AM5 so I could upgrade the CPU if I want to in the future.  I was going to order the Ryzen 7800x3D but the deliver date for that was a month away.  Was going to take the 7950x out of my gaming pc and swap it with the 7800x3d and put the 7950x in the stream pc, but I couldn't wait so I went with the 7600, non x, it saved me a good amount of money and came with a heatsink.  Was enough power for the 4K60 capture card and Intel A380 GPU to capture my gameplay in 4K60 AV1.  I think it's the wiser choice over AM4.", 'I bought this CPU for a new AMD5 based PC I was putting together, the main purpose of which is work, with also some gaming on the side. I have to say I am blown away how blazing fast this CPU is for both work (MS Office suite and engineering specific software). I have paired it with some 6000MHz memory and its a potent combo. I would recommend downloading the free AMD Ryzen Master software, with which you can single click do a safe overclock of this CPU and get even more performance out of it.For gaming, I have this paired with an overclocked AMD6800XT and the CPU keeps up with that with no issues.  I appreciate there are many more powerful CPUs in the AMD line up, but unless you are doing some heavy multi core works, I cant see why you would need to pay more.', 'No surprises here, the 7600 (non X) flat out stomps my old i7-8700k in every benchmark that matters and uses less juice to do it. The more expensive 7600X is only slightly faster and is $50 more so this is a no-brainer. AMD\'s Ryzen Master includes an automatic "curve optimizer" that scans your chip and determines the best combination of undervolting and clock boosts for each core which gave me a 6.5% increase in Cinebench 23 scores and runs 10 degrees cooler. Not bad for a free utility and clicking two buttons.The included cooler, on the other hand, is a useless lump of metal and plastic suitable only for paperweight duties. Whilst I applaud AMD for including one at all, you will need to buy an aftermarket cooler unless you enjoy ludicrously high CPU temps and listening to a jet engine every time you fire up Cyberpunk. Very happy with purchase and now that AM5 motherboards have come down in price and DDR5 memory is no longer a king\'s ransom this is a pretty good time to upgrade old hardware.', 'A entrega foi super rápida, principalmente que moro no extremo norte do país', "This is the centerpiece for my Mini ITX AM5 gaming pc. No complaints on the performance end (coming from an i7-11800h previously). However, even with an AIO cooler, it definitely seems to be running hotter than I anticipated. But, I haven't encountered any issues with stability and I can max out starfield at 1440p with a RX 6950XT so no complaints from the performance department.", 'Price on Amazon is wayy too much, I Got this on prime day for 17k so check price before you purchase.Coming to the CPU box was a little bit damaged but everything inside was intact and working well.It comes with cooler & thermal paste pre applied on cooler so no need to buy a separate thermal paste.Performance is excellent it works with 6000mhz ddr5 ramGetting this processor only makes sense if you want to future proof your computer on AM5 platform.', "L'ho appaiato ad un Noctua Redux, ennesima ottima CPU da parte di AMD", "I'm stuck with an old 4k60 monitor so this is perfect. Hardly reaches 50% usage or 75°C when locked at 60fps. There aren't many games out that can challenge this cpu. If you want to do 120+ fps on a demanding game then Idk.Matched with RX 7900 XT, MSI B650 Tomahawk, G.skill 32gb 5600 CL28, AK400 cooler", 'passt alles', "Un bon rapport qualité prix pour l'utilisation qui est la mienne. Dans quelques mois/années, à la faveur de la baisse des prix je changerai pour un processeur AMD Ryzen plus puissant."]

Product: Intel Core i5-13600K Desktop Processor 14 cores (6 P-cores + 8 E-cores) 24M Cache, up to 5.1 GHz
Reviews: ['i5 1X600Ks are always that sweet spot!Great thermals and excellent performance!Time to buy a 7900 XTX!', "There's really not much that needs to be said. If you're upgrading to 13th gen Intel, and don't require the additional non-gaming related benefits of 13700k or 13900k, you can't go wrong with the i5-13600k. Even with XMP enabled to 6000Mhz & a Noctua NH-U12A tower cooler on top, this beast never gets truly hot in any game. Granted, I have a very good case for airflow, but regardless it's extremely rare I ever see this CPU hitting the 70's when gaming (this includes 1440p gaming at basically maxed settings), with plenty of utilization headroom on top of that. I paired this beastly CPU with the Sapphire Nitro Plus Radeon 6950XT & have been having an amazing experience all around. If you're deeply considering 13th gen, & your main focus is gaming, then the 13600k will perform up there with the best without all the additional heat the higher end SKU's give off. Genuinely give this CPU a 10/10, never in my life did I ever anticipate an i5 to be this great, but just goes to show it's more about the generation and less about the number after the i. If you're considering the CPU but unsure as to its performance, I promise you wont be disappointed with it one bit. Including with its temperatures. No under-volting needed.", "The Intel Core i5-13600K (Latest Gen) Desktop Processor is a true powerhouse, delivering unparalleled performance with its 14 cores, consisting of 6 P-cores and 8 E-cores. This processor has far exceeded my expectations, providing seamless multitasking and blazing-fast performance for all my computing needs.The standout feature of the Intel Core i5-13600K is its 14 cores, making it one of the most powerful processors in its class. The 6 primary cores (P-cores) are designed for single-threaded tasks and applications, ensuring lightning-fast responsiveness and smooth user experience. Additionally, the 8 efficient cores (E-cores) cater to multithreaded workloads, providing exceptional multitasking capabilities and maximizing productivity.With the latest generation technology, the i5-13600K unleashes the true potential of Intel's cutting-edge processor architecture. Whether I'm gaming, streaming, video editing, or running intensive software applications, this processor handles it all with ease.The integrated graphics of the i5-13600K eliminate the need for a discrete graphics card for everyday tasks and light gaming, providing a cost-effective and space-saving solution for those who don't require dedicated graphics processing.The unlocked multiplier of this processor allows for easy overclocking, making it an excellent choice for enthusiasts and gamers who want to push their system's performance even further.I appreciate the low power consumption of the i5-13600K despite its impressive performance, contributing to energy efficiency and reduced operating costs.The Intel Core i5-13600K is compatible with the latest motherboard chipsets, ensuring seamless integration and future upgradability.Intel is a trusted brand known for producing high-quality processors, and the i5-13600K continues that legacy, providing a reliable and stable computing experience.In conclusion, the Intel Core i5-13600K (Latest Gen) Desktop Processor with its 14 cores is a performance beast, capable of handling the most demanding computing tasks with ease. Its balanced combination of P-cores and E-cores, unlocked multiplier, integrated graphics, and energy efficiency make it an ideal choice for power users and gamers alike. If you're looking to unleash the full potential of your desktop, the Intel Core i5-13600K is the ultimate processor that won't disappoint. I highly recommend this processor for its outstanding performance and the incredible multitasking capabilities it brings to my computing experience!", "I am extremally happy with this CPU. Blazing fast and very stable, runs supper cool. I am only running a dual fan cooler and it idles at 24c and when iRacing stays in hi 40's to low 50's. Only game/ Simulator I use is iRacing. I use some hi-tech 3d modeling programs. Both really stress the CPU. I love this unit, cheap but loads of features.", 'Llegó a tiempo y todo funcionando correctamente', '13600kと4070tiでstable diffusionのアスカベンチが15秒。ryzen5 1600と4070tiで24秒だったのを考えると生成AIでの快適さにはCPUも大事だと思う。DDR4 2400MHzからDDR5の6000MHzにしたのもレスポンスの良さに関係してるかな。生成しながらのマルチタスクも余裕だし思い切って買ってよかった。', 'Gostei, produto excelente.', 'Up to standards. Worried at the beginning since the processor was not set in place inside the box, but still works normally.', 'easy hookup for USB and external SATA drives.', 'cool.']

Product: Intel Core i7-13700K (Latest Gen) Gaming Desktop Processor 16 cores (8 P-cores + 8 E-cores) with Integrated Graphics - Unlocked
Reviews: ['It’s insane, the speed you get for its price is absolutely great. It’s granted me a 40+ fps increase on Baldur’s Gate and has helped me in development and lighting in 3D applications. It been stable at 5.4 ghz and is amazing for games. The die is larger than the older CPUs due to its newer lga1700 chipset, so I recommend getting the ThermalRight contact frame (also have a review for it). OVERALL worth it, better if you get it on discount.', 'This processor is absolutely incredible with no doubt’s… The only this you have to keep in mind that go for atleast 360 AIO for more better performance…', 'Fast, easy to use and a great buy for the money.', 'I Only use my pc for hardcore flight simming (commercial operations in airlines) in Microsoft flight sim. It’s one of the most demanding things ever but this cpu brought me from 40 fps on the 12400f to 50-60 fps with this new 13700k. Love it.', "After too many years of gaming on an old i7-6700K I finally decided to pull the upgrade trigger this year.  I purchased the most up to date CPU and other components with the hope this one will last me as long as the last one did. Overall I think this is a great CPU, however it is a bit frustrating when you try to cool these things. Intel just keeps pushing these CPUs harder and harder to try and beat the performance metrics of AMD, but in the process they are making CPUs that are anywhere from near impossible to difficult at best to keep cool. After a lot of tweaking in the BIOS I finally got this one to stay below the 90 degree Celsius threshold, but that doesn't account for how hot it still makes my room when I'm gaming. The extra heat was kind of nice during the winter months, but as summer is approaching I'm wondering how this is going to pan out...Anyway, the CPU is completely as advertised and worked flawlessly out of the box. I didn't run into any errors or issues with this CPU. Overall I 100% recommend it because Intel has never let me down. I've been building my own systems for more than 20 years now too, so that's a pretty long track record of CPUs that just worked and never died. Because of that I can easily recommend this CPU and I would definitely order it again.", 'The first time I see, the PC faster, than me.For the cooling I am using the -DeepCool GAMMAXX AG620 WH ARGB,which is the BEST solution for this processor and is not very expensive!', 'With enough cores, it is one of the best CPUs for gaming and working. E-cores are perfect for web browsing, and P-cores are good for gaming. It is very power efficient for such works.', "Really powerful cpu for sure, haven't even been able to find a game that limits it out, thermals are beautiful with the h150i elite under heavy loads staying in the 50s-60s. Perfect for 1080p-1440p and even could potentially run some 4k games with the right gpu paired. Overall very happy with the performance!", 'Great workstation CPU. Upgraded my aging Intel Haswell 4770k workstation to these new, e-core embedded Intel CPUs.Only negative drawback is that these newer Intel CPUs run hot and eat quite a bit of wattage.Should have picked an I5 instead but wanted to future proof my new workstation until 2030.Highly recommend!', 'pretty good price for what you get, the quality for gaming is working great so far, no issues']

Product: Intel® Core™ i5-11600K Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked LGA1200 (Intel® 500 Series & Select 400 Series Chipset) 125W
Reviews: ["Used on B560M Aorus Pro AX motherboard, so can't overclock. So, this is how 12400 or 5600 feels like.... nice.", 'This CPU is as good as i7 model.  It has a video output.', 'Buen producto', 'The i5 11600k is, at the time of this writing, really the best value in CPUs on the market. You have to pay a bunch more to get a couple more cores in an i7, while an i3 is only a bit cheaper for certainly less performance. Meanwhile, Ryzens are just too much extra money for frankly a little less performance. They may have a huge marketing cult, and they are very good processors to be sure, but if you\'re trying to maximize performance for the dollar, the Intel cores still have the edge. The i5 11600K is the strongest performing and most flexible of the gen 11 i5 variants and is plenty good enough for the casual to moderately serious gamer or workstation--especially if you dabble in overclocking, but also even if you don\'t, this is still a little stronger than the 65wtdp locked version.Keep in mind that the unlocked K version i5 is the full performance version and does not include a cooler like the locked i5s usually do. It\'s also rated to dissipate more heat which is surely why intel doesn\'t include one. I think the intel vs. ryzen people do entirely too much hand wringing over architecture and TDP differences between the brands. Guys, stop being silly. The truth is that unlocked intels and ryzens BOTH put out a ton of heat and both need coolers that exceed the rated TDP. For the 11600K I\'d recommend a cooler in the 150w-190w TDP range. I ended up finding a good price on a Be Quiet Shadow Rock 3 which is a very nice air cooler for the i5 and probably overkill unless you\'re playing with overclocking. I\'d also recommend the same for the congruent ryzen, by the way. The inconvenient truth is unlocked intel and ryzen both put out more heat than CPUs ought to be in this day and age and you need to spend some money on cooling any of them. At least with the 5s you can get away with upper mid-grade air cooling and definitely don\'t "have" to do water if you don\'t want to, especially if you\'re keeping to a budget.The 11600Ks generally support 3200 ram with no need for ram overclocking which is great, but check the capability of your particular motherboard. This is one of the improvements from 10th gen. I\'m running a couple 16gb sticks of 3200 cl 16-18-18-38 with excellent results and no funny business in the bios.The intel integrated graphics on the 11600K is what you\'d expect. It\'s fine for workstation/business use, can output 4k video content fine, and will get you by for light gaming, but serious gamers will obviously need discrete graphics. You can get the KF version of the 11600 if you don\'t want or need integrated graphics, but depending on the day, it may or may not actually be cheaper than the K.Overall, the i5 11600K really is the current value champion for mid to upper-mid grade PC builds in 2022 to date and will continue to be until the next big price drop on the 12th gen CPUs and motherboards. You get near-i7 performance for less money and you get a bit better than current ryzen 5 also for less money. Match this up with your favorite reasonably robust cooler and a good mid grade motherboard (I like Asus TUF, but you do you) for a really great bang for the buck PC build with some lasting power.', 'Product arrived fast in perfect condition, very happy!', 'para su precio es excelente.. si tu presupuesto  no te alcanza para mucho esta es una buena opción.', 'Muy buen Procesador, hiperRapido.', 'Perfecto.', "I upgraded from a 10600kf to the 11600k. Its an almost entirely pointless upgrade and I don't recommend anybody else take this route. If you do, here's some more info...Pros:*Pcie gen 4, babyyyy*Performance is pretty solid so far*Definitely has overclock potential. I got it to 4.9ghz all core with just a 2-fan water cooler. I couldn't run it as a daily driver with that cooling setup, but it DID work. Lol.Cons:*Gave me a hard time with setting ram speeds for some reason. 10600 allowed me to set ram at 3600 but the 11600 gets grumpy if I go over 3400*Price to performance didn't make any sense for me to upgrade...but I did it anyway. I guess this is kinda a neutral thing?If you're like me and you just want to have the highest gen you can get for your board, it's a nice chip.It doesn't come with any thermal paste anywhere in-box so just make sure you have some laying around. I recommend Noctua NT-H.It doesn't include a fan. If you're upgrading from 10th gen, you can use the same fan. If you're doing a new build just make sure you've got a fan. CoolerMaster makes good budget fans", 'pas de ventilateur pour refroidir cpu mais j ai utiliser mon ancien chauffe un peu plus que mn ancien i5 10400 mais en comparant les spec ca l air normal']

Product: AMD Ryzen 5 5600X 6-core, 12-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor with Wraith Stealth Cooler
Reviews: ["Comes with stock cooler, however it's always good to have a premium air cooler for longevity", "After suffering for more than 7 months of constant out-of-stocks and price gouges, we've finally entered a cooling phase that will probably only last for a short while and then go back to status quo and then come back here again.Although I'm not really gonna laugh my way to the bank, because it took more than 7 months to reach this low, and my friends had gotten theirs for a slightly higher price back then.", 'It increase overall performance of my gaming rig. Previously using 3600 but not is run more smooth with RX 6700 xt.Change due to previously CPU die and send for RMA and take opportunity to upgrade> :)', 'Runs quite hot with the cheap wraith stock cooler, recommend to buy a quality aftermarket cooler, everything else works pefect', "Similar single core performance as the higher Ryzen 5900x, which is important for many games and general productivity software. Worth the higher price from 3600, 6 cores is more than enough. Haven't had any game that maxes it out yet. PBO brings it to 4.8Ghz all-core with air cooling", "Works pretty decent, didn' encounter any problem at all.", 'item came in good condition, works as expected and is literally the best 6c/12t consumer cpu money can buy', '65 TDP a bit low with included cooler.', "The CPU I got was a dud that failed when above 70 degrees Celsius, on stock settings with the stock cooler, and I had to return it. Ideally AMD would have properly stress-tested the CPU. I had to get a 5800X to replace this without turnaround, which wasn't ideal considering its price-to-performance vis-a-vis the 5600X and 5900X, and the i7-11700K.", 'Ich habe mir den AMD 5600X Prozessor gekauft, um meinen alten AMD Ryzen 2600 Prozessor zu ersetzen, der schon einige Jahre auf dem Buckel hatte. Ich war sehr gespannt, wie sich der neue Prozessor in Sachen Leistung und Effizienz schlagen würde. Ich muss sagen, ich bin sehr zufrieden mit dem Ergebnis.Der Einbau des Prozessors war sehr einfach und unkompliziert. Ich musste nur den alten Prozessor aus dem Sockel lösen, den neuen einsetzen und den Kühler montieren. Der Prozessor passt perfekt in den AM4-Sockel meines Mainboards und wird von meinem BIOS problemlos erkannt. Ich musste keine Treiber oder Updates installieren, alles lief sofort reibungslos.Er ist deutlich schneller als mein alter Ryzen 2600, Der Unterschied ist vor allem bei anspruchsvollen Anwendungen wie Spielen oder Videobearbeitung spürbar. Der Prozessor kann alle Aufgaben flüssig und ohne Ruckler bewältigen.Der Prozessor ist auch sehr effizient und stromsparend. Er hat eine TDP von nur 65 Watt, was deutlich weniger ist als die 95 Watt meines alten Ryzen 2600. Er wird auch nicht zu heiß und bleibt unter Last bei angenehmen Temperaturen. Der mitgelieferte Kühler ist ausreichend, um den Prozessor kühl zu halten, aber ich habe mir trotzdem einen leiseren und leistungsstärkeren Kühler gekauft, um das Beste aus dem Prozessor herauszuholen.Ich bin sehr glücklich mit meinem Kauf und kann den AMD 5600X Prozessor jedem empfehlen, der seinen PC aufrüsten möchte. Er bietet eine hervorragende Leistung für einen fairen Preis und ist zukunftssicher für die nächsten Jahre. Er ist einer der beliebtesten Prozessoren auf dem Markt.']

Product: CPU AMD AM4 RYZEN 5 3600 6X4.2GHZ/32MB Box
Reviews: ['Reçu bien emballer va nickel supporte bien les jeu gourmand et vidéo prévoir un bon refroidisseur liquide ou vendirad 120 MM', "J'ai choisi ce processeur pour son prix ces bonnes performances, et que le PCI.E est un 4.0 et non un 3.0 comme pour le Ryzen 5 5500.Monté sur une MSI B550 Gaming plus, cela tourne parfaitement bien.", "Puissance et d'un prix raisonnable,  il contre parfaitement son conçurent voir le domine sur certains secteurs vectoriel !", "Its a pretty good budget cpu and i like that if you are upgrading and u have a cooler u don't have to pay extra money. The delivery came a day earlier than expected. Only down side is u have to buy thermal paste.", "Je recommande de prendre ce processeur pour du montage, du gaming... Mais pour de l'usage intensif je recommande pas car le processeur même en mettant un logiciel qui va le mettre a sont plein potentiel il ne dépasse pas les 4,13 mghz  sachant qu'il va au max a 4,2 mghz.", "I heard this was a great cpu for budget builds so I bought one. I mainly bought it to upgrade from an ryzen 7 1700 (non x) witch was bottleneck my rtx 2070 super, and needless to say very satisfied. Even though the x variant is better I couldn't beat the price of this cpu on sale though.", "Au part avant j'était plutôt intel, mais je suis surpris de la qualité de fonctionnement, la rapidité de cet AMD ryzen 5.je recommande", "C'est un très bon procsseur que j'utilise sur A320M pro, ainsi qu'avec une GTX 1650 de chez zotac. Elle fait largement le taff.", "A ce prix là vous n'aurez rien de mieux en neuf", 'Got this CPU without a heatsink brand new. Was nice to have an option that allowed me to use one of the 10 heatsinks I have laying around the house. Solid for gaming and working']

Product: AMD Ryzen 5 5600G 6-Core 12-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor with Radeon Graphics
Reviews: ['When replacing the cooler, the cooler was like super glued to the mobo. I had to yank it off using a scissor and almost broke the mobo. Amazingly the gigabyte mobo survived.', "Had no complain for budget entry gaming, can play most today's gaming and low to mid setting, doing productivity work seems great", 'Had no issues after install. Runs smoothly on the games I play without discrete graphics. Upgraded to Wraith Prism for better cooling over the Stealth.', 'I bought the 5600G to use while my CPU was being RMAed.  I ended up deciding to keep this instead and sell the RMAed CPU.  With a -0.2V offset and speed capped at 4 GHz, the CPU sips around 55W on full load and the heat output barely taxed my AIO.  The power efficiency was way better than expected.IF caps at 2000 MHz and the CPU worked with DDR-4000 without any problem.', 'Best', "I wanna list the Cons first:Cons:- If you're ordering from Singaoore, prepare to wait around 3 weeks for it to arrive- Packaging was slightly damaged (Dented), but the item itself was perfectly sealed and fine- Wasn't able to run Genshin Impact at 60fps awwwPros:- Everything is as expected, fully functional- Able to run non-competitive shooter games even at my overkill monitor (1440p 165hz)- Smooth experience in Windows 10 overall, it's just like having a below average GPU for the prize of just a great CPUEven though I'm kinda salty that the Ryzen 6000 series APUs with RDNA 2 graphics are gonna come out just half a year later, this 5600G will do me well for now. Overall, thanks AMD for giving me the stop-gap solution I needed, amazing processor.", 'Just build a HTPC with the Ryzen 5600g. Great APU for small form factor build. Got this CPU below retail price. I would recommend this APU if you are planning to run a PC without a graphics card. Shipping took only 6 days to arrive from USA to Singapore. That is pretty fast shipping.', 'If you want CPU with built-in graphics this this best solution, for me just use for normal gaming no request high quality resolution. My case is NZXT H1, use this save more space with ITX built, but if u prefer good graphics resolution u can swith to 5600X + graphics card will better, main different for G & X are the L3 cache 16MB vs 32MB', "good overclock of the FCLK and Dram that helps to close the gap between 5600x but the lower L3 and lack of pcie4 makes it a harder sell than 5600x. with 2100 flck and 4200 dram, it benchmark close to 5600xThe vega7 gpu do not have AV1 hardware makes it looks worse. That's why AMD should have shave $30 off their MSRP.", 'Smooth and fast boot-up from Window 11 and fast graphic display on the monitor. Good performance and quality for value compared to its competitor. I always enjoy AMD though I have had Intel before. This is really a good CPU as most put it!']

Product: AMD Ryzen™ 7 5800X3D 8-core, 16-Thread Desktop Processor with AMD 3D V-Cache™ Technology
Reviews: ['greatly increased FPS for games over 3600. Able to run 3600MT/s RAM no problem. recommend to set Curve Optimiser to -15 or below to reduce power and temp usage.', 'Bought for an upgrade. This is the last great CPU for the AM4 socket and it did work with my motherboard after a quick BIOS update.The box is mostly air from the factory. There is no cooler inside. Else, no too much complain except it runs a little bit more hot than my previous Rizen.', 'I upgraded from a 5600 to a 5800x3d and later bought an aftermarket CPU cooler to run lower temps during summer and for higher gaming performance.This upgrade was massive for me for gaming as that is my main focus and hobby on my desktop. With the AMD 5000x series drivers for my bios already installed this was plug-and-play for me.Gaming performance hit my target 144hz on my 1440p monitor in most games with reduced settings as framerate is my go-to in fast-paced games like FPS. I do occasionally reduce framerate in single-player games or games that are isometric to reduce gpu/cpu load and get more consistent frame-times when upping graphic settings. I would recommend this in most cases for the majority of gamers but this is still my preference.Performance is SMOOTH and I do mean buttery smooth for me. The change in the 1% lows was immediately felt by me, but take this with a grain of salt especially if you are less experienced with high framerates/stutters and not a major PC enthusiast. Most people will game at 1080p on lower refresh rates, but please try to take this CPU to at least 1440p 90-120hz for optimal experience.COOLER - I kept my wraith cooler from my older 5600 to start while I researched what cooler I wanted to go with but I did game on this cooler for over a month. The wraith cooler was more than sufficient in most scenarios but due to the summer heat, and more demanding games my CPU temps were going above 80C and causing my room to get hotter and some CPU throttling requiring more tampering with settings and research into curve optimization. Much of my room heat comes from my PC due to it being closed, but it is an older house, a lightly insulated wooden home, with 5 windows, along with a mini-fridge and a bathroom that seems to absorb heat from somewhere. This temp was not ideal for me due to my room often being above 80F and during the heatwaves and AC work done up to 88 or higher in my room.COOLER Pt 2 - To reduce my room heat and reduce CPU thermal throttling I purchased an aftermarket CPU cooler with 6 heat pipes. This dramatically reduced my CPU thermal throttling reducing my average temps by 10-20F which also reduced temps on my GPU. The cooler I bought was around 40-50 bucks so if you are interested that is more than enough to cool this CPU for its lifetime.Curve Optimizer(WARNING!!  this may void your warrant) - When using a curve optimizer with this CPU you will see a sizeable increase in performance and thermal temps. You can use a no-update manual optimizer like PBO2 Tuner or research into making it always optimized with bios settings.  Idle temps get the most benefit from this and second is when performing at medium-high load in my experience. Idle temps were 5-10F reduced and medium-high load temps were in a similar range and sometimes far better due to increased CPU performance as well.This CPU is an incredible value for anyone that is enthusiastic about gaming performance. Be aware that there is a newer generation of x3D cpus but the current dollar-to-dollar value for 7000x3d cpus is not close enough to consider for anyone that does not want a maxed-out expensive system.On sale, the 5800x3d CPU is an absolute NO-BRAINER for gaming, but please be aware you need to buy a cooler, and you may need a bios update PRIOR to installing your CPU if you do not already have an AMD 5000 series CPU.
