If the 7000x3d series goes on sale and you are building an entirely new system, you should be aware of RAM costs and Motherboard costs as well as this can be a dramatic price differential for cheaper system builds if you are not careful.', "AMD Ryzen 7 5800X3DIch hätte es nicht gedacht, aber auch 2023 noch spielt nicht nur die GPU bei der Spiele-Performance eine Rolle.Vorher war bei mir ein Ryzen 5 3600 verbaut.Grafikkarte: RTX 4070 TiRAM: G.Skill 32 GB 3200er DDR4-RAMAuflösung: 1440p, UWQHD (3.440 x 1.440)Nachdem die neue Grafikkarte verbaut war, sollte nun auch eine neue CPU her.Im Desktopbetrieb habe ich gefühlt nur einen geringen Geschwindigkeitsschub (vorher: pfeilschnell, jetzt: pfeilschnell+).Im Gaming-Betrieb kommt es auf das Spiel an... da gibt es Titel, die kaum oder nur etwas schneller laufen, etwa +10%, andere wieder, wo ich über +50% mehr FPS bekomme:Z.B. 120 FPS z.B. bei Horizon Zero Dawn bei 1440p und alles auf max. sind schon ne Hausnummer, wenn man vorher mit dem Ryzen 5 3600 bei 75 FPS war. Hammer!Was mich dabei erstaunte: Die neue CPU führt auch auch dann zu mehr FPS, wenn vorher wie nachher beim Gaming gar keine 100% CPU-Auslastung vorlag, wenn man also eher an eine Grafikkartenlimitierung denken würde.Von der Leistungsaufnahme her ist der Ryzen 7 5800X3D im Desktopbetrieb eher noch sparsamer als die alte CPU vorher, da läuft sie so etwa bei 35 W, das passt.Im Gaming-Betrieb unter Last zieht der 8-Kerner dann natürlich etwas mehr, etwa 100 W, damit etwa 30W mehr als die alte CPU, was aber den Kohl dann auch nicht mehr fett macht, wenn nebendran eine RTX 4070 Ti Strom zieht.Die CPU ist nicht ganz billig, aber ich bin's zufrieden und bereue den Kauf nicht.Auf der AM4-Plattform gibt es für den Gaming-Bereich nichts schnelleres (und wird es höchstwahrscheinlich auch nicht mehr geben).Ich denke allerdings, dass sich sowas (die Grafikkarte auch) nur dann lohnt, wenn man sein System mit höherer Auflösung als Full HD betreiben möchte und wenn man schon ein AM4-Mainboard hat, das man noch eine Weile behalten möchte.Wichtig bei der CPU:Eine performate CPU-Kühlung verbauen, sonst regelt die CPU ab, wenn sie zu heiß wird!Bei mir ist ein Thermalright Peerless Assassin 120 SE verbaut, was prima harmoniert.In dieser Kühler-Leistungsklasse sollte man schon arbeiten. Oder eine WaKü verbauen.", "Attention, avant toute chose, n'oubliez pas de mettre a jour votre BIOS avant d'installer le 5800X3D.Je vais essayé d'être le plus franc possible, alors oui le 5800X3D est le meilleur processeur GAMING sur la plateforme AM4 !J'ai bien dis GAMING, car en rendu 3D etc, il sera un peu moins performant qu'un 5800X normal par exemple. Si vous comptez jouer la plupart du temps, sans passer par une upgrade AM5 ou refaire une configuration neuve, je vous le conseil, ca donne un sacré coup de perf par rapport à tout les autres processeur AM4.En 2023, si vous partez sur une configuration neuve, je ne vous le conseil pas, il est destiné à ceux qui veulent rester sur AM4 pendant encore un moment.Il a des points positifs et négatifs.- Positifs => Gain de perfs en 1080P ET 1440P, oui même en 1440P, il donne plus de perf en général. Son 1%LOW est plus haut que mon ancien 3700X OC et de loin, par ex. Je joue en 1440P avec un 5800X3D et une 7900XT, autant vous dire que c'est un monstre de puissance (il reste, très proche d'un 12900KS en gaming !)Le plus flagrant, pour ma part, est sur Escape From tarkov, j'avais l'impression d'avoir un autre PC !=> Il fait le taf en rendu vidéo, 3D ect, mais il y a bien plus perf pour ce domaine la, mais ca reste un petit 8 coeurs / 16 threads=> Upgrade ultra facile, suffit juste de mettre son BIOS à jour et il a une faible consommationPoints négatifs => Ca chauffe ... Il chauffe vraiment in game, il faut un bon AIO/Ventirad. J'étais obligé de changer mon H100I 240MM (qui est un des meilleurs sur les ryzen 5000) parce que je frôlai, sur certains jeux gourmand en processeur, les 85 parfois presque 90 degrés ! (coucou BF2042).=> Il n'est pas destiné à être OverClocker !=>Son prix.Sinon, si vous avez un bon boitier avec un bon refroidissement, il n'y plus trop de problème de chauffe.Pour conclure, il donne plus de perfs, le 3D cache fonctionne vraiment, ca sera plus ou moins important selon les jeux. Il ne consomme pas trop, ca reste le best en AM4, MAIS ca chauffe. Il est destiné aux personnes sur AM4. Pour les nouvelles configurations, c'est non.", 'Ich möchte gerne meine äußerst positive Erfahrung mit dem AMD Ryzen 7 5800X3D auf Amazon teilen und betonen, wie sehr dieser Prozessor meinen alten Intel i7-9700K übertrifft. Als langjähriger Nutzer von Intel-Prozessoren war ich anfangs skeptisch, aber der Ryzen 7 5800X3D hat meine Erwartungen übertroffen.Die Leistung des AMD Ryzen 7 5800X3D ist beeindruckend. Mit seinen 8 Kernen und 16 Threads bietet er eine deutlich höhere Verarbeitungsgeschwindigkeit im Vergleich zu meinem alten Intel i7-9700K. Die Multitasking-Fähigkeiten des Ryzen 7 5800X3D sind ausgezeichnet und ermöglichen mir eine reibungslose Durchführung mehrerer anspruchsvoller Aufgaben gleichzeitig.Die Taktfrequenz des Ryzen 7 5800X3D ist spürbar höher und führt zu einer merklichen Steigerung der Leistung. Egal ob beim Gaming, beim Rendern von Videos oder bei anderen rechenintensiven Anwendungen - dieser Prozessor liefert eine beeindruckende Performance und sorgt für ein flüssiges Nutzererlebnis.Die verbesserte Zen 3-Architektur des Ryzen 7 5800X3D ermöglicht eine effizientere Verarbeitung und eine verbesserte Single-Core-Leistung. Dadurch werden Ladezeiten verkürzt und das System reagiert schneller. Ich war beeindruckt von der Geschwindigkeit und dem reibungslosen Ablauf meiner täglichen Aufgaben mit diesem Prozessor.Ein weiterer Pluspunkt des Ryzen 7 5800X3D ist seine Energieeffizienz. Im Vergleich zu meinem alten Intel i7-9700K hat der Ryzen 7 5800X3D eine niedrigere TDP (Thermal Design Power) und verbraucht weniger Strom. Dies führt zu einer kosteneffizienten Nutzung und einer reduzierten Umweltauswirkung.Die Kompatibilität des Ryzen 7 5800X3D ist ebenfalls bemerkenswert. Er ist mit dem AM4-Sockel kompatibel und kann mit einer Vielzahl von Mainboards verwendet werden. Dies ermöglicht eine einfache Anpassung des Systems nach individuellen Bedürfnissen.Alles in allem kann ich den AMD Ryzen 7 5800X3D auf Amazon wärmstens empfehlen. Mit seiner beeindruckenden Leistung, seiner Energieeffizienz und seiner verbesserten Architektur übertrifft er meinen alten Intel i7-9700K deutlich. Wenn Sie auf der Suche nach einem leistungsstarken und vielseitigen Prozessor sind, der alle Anforderungen moderner Anwendungen und Spiele erfüllt, dann ist der AMD Ryzen 7 5800X3D die richtige Wahl. Investieren Sie in diesen Prozessor und profitieren Sie von einer deutlichen Leistungssteigerung!', "I upgraded from a 2600 to this 5800X3D and it's truly amazing how much of a CPU bottleneck I didn't even realize I had. This makes my platform more stable and extends its life out by at least a couple years, hopefully longer. Overall performance is noticeably better, but in games it's day and night. I play in 1440p widescreen resolution, and the 2600 was struggling a bit. I didn't even realize it was my CPU (thought maybe I had an underperforming GPU) for a while. My frames were acceptable, but only just. Now with the same RX6750XT I was already using, I'm getting smooth framerates across every game I play. I was worried it would run too hot, but using the same cheap aftermarket air cooler I was using on the 2600, temperatures have not been an issue at all.If you can catch this CPU on sale especially, it's basically endgame for the AM4 platform.", "Star Citizen was stuttering with my 5600x, so I upgraded to the 5800x3D, which helped smooth frames out. You'll want the 5800x3D if your favorite games (especially the simulation ones) are CPU-bound. I've also seen performance improvements with Satisfactory, Factorio, Minecraft, MS Flight Simulator, and Elite Dangerous.Many online tech circles recommend this one due to the 96MB L3 cache, which is the most offered in the entire AM4 lineup. There's also a few more cores and threads than the 5600x, which is beneficial for multitasking. If you wanted to, this could potentially be run with a top-tier GPU like the RTX 4090, although right now I am content with my 6700XT.There's no heatsink/fan assembly included with the 5800x3D. I bought the $50 AIO cooler on Amazon and that works well enough. I wouldn't use the 5600x's stock heatsink on the 5800x3D, due to the higher TDP. It would have resulted in the fan running louder more often, and that's annoying.In terms of price-to-performance, this is probably the best sim-gaming CPU you can get on the AM4 slot. As an upgrade from the 5600x, the performance gains are noticeable in the right games.", 'El rendimiento de este procesador es simplemente impresionante. He estado usando este chip en uno de mis sistemas y ha superado todas mis expectativas. La velocidad de procesamiento y la capacidad de respuesta son sobresalientes, lo que me permite realizar múltiples tareas y ejecutar aplicaciones exigentes sin problemas.La eficiencia energética también es destacable. A pesar de su potencia, el consumo de energía se mantiene bajo, lo que es beneficioso para el medio ambiente y para aquellos que desean reducir su huella de carbono.Otra característica que realmente me ha impresionado es la arquitectura 3D. Esta tecnología ha mejorado significativamente la calidad visual y la precisión en los gráficos, brindando una experiencia visual más inmersiva y realista.El diseño sin ventilador también es un acierto. Gracias a esto, el procesador funciona de manera silenciosa y eficiente, sin generar ruido innecesario ni calor excesivo.En general, este procesador es una opción excepcional para aquellos que buscan un rendimiento de primera categoría en su sistema. La combinación de potencia, eficiencia energética y tecnología 3D lo convierten en una opción imprescindible para los entusiastas de la informática y los amantes de la tecnología.', "I heard this was good for VR or other unity titles with the huge L3 but also knew a upgrade from a 3600XT would net solid jump in performanceI was wrong... it was a massive jump, I didn't know how badly I was bottlenecking my 3080ti but seash, I have seen a drastic change in every game, beat saber scores increased across the board, I can actually see stuff smooth now, vrc like full 2x fps, and I went from being one weird person fortnite group with 3080ti but barely can run the game on medium, to running ultra full stable 144fpsSo yeah, mega hyped had upgraded, if anyone's running a older lower skew wondering if a cpu upgrade will do much, wellPs. This chip is a real tuff pup to keep cool, I thought I could just ease away with a e32 heat sink, NOPE, this was throttling back, like Frick, I went strait upto a liquid freezer ii 360 , decked out fans, and just barely got it under controllBe serious about the cooling on this one for sure"]

Product: AMD Ryzen 7 5700G with Wraith Stealth Cooler 3.8 GHz 8 Cores / 16 Threads 72MB 65W [Domestic Authorized Dealer] 100-10000263BOX
Reviews: ["I bought this for its top value/performance relative to other cpu's available. For its class it plays flight simulator extremely smoothly, never mind there are higher benchmarks out there. Besides it is very efficient and fast for my home movie making. Your experience may vary. I paired it to a Asus X570 plus wifi motherboard , and 16Gb Corsair ddr4 3200 ram and this combination is made in heaven. At 65W TDP this cpu runs about 37degrees to 40degrees celsius at normal usage.I wanted the Ryzen 5600G at first but as it is limited to pcie 3.0 i decided to get this Ryzen 5700X as it supports pcie 4.0.These cpu's are the last of the AM4 sockets  since new Ryzens have moved to AM5 sockets.Who cares? One cpu generation behind saves big money!Conclusion: i am very satisfied with this buy. Delivery was a mere 3 days and overall its unbeatable value for the performance i get. All goods came intact in good working order ( touch wood, as one or two people i read got lemons).Highly recommended (imo).", 'The high number of core and threads is more than enough to play AAA games and easy rendering works. Use it as is or paired it later with dedicated GPU down the road, hence provides good flexibility. The 65W tdp is also good for mini itx config. I put this in Deskmeet X300 and no need to worry about high temps.', "With the crazy price of GFX card and my ancient GTX650Ti Boost card is dying, I bought this to replace both CPU and GFX. Cinebench R20 shown 55xx points, faster than 3700X's 50xx, obviously not noticeable in real world but temperature is ~5℃ lower when I'm doing video transcoding. less heat output and lower noise from fans. I was expecting the VEGA iGPU to perform similarly as my 9 years old GFX card but sadly, it doesn't. For video decoding, It does able to hardware decode VP9 and HEVC(H.265) up to 8K, which the old nvidia couldn't. Then again, the 8c/16t 5700G is power enough to decode even the AV1 at 8K by itself. Maybe the VEGA can play popular game at lower resolution, I don't know. But even age old Age of Empire III DE have a hard time doing 30fps@1600p, I didn't bother trying others. I would say if you expect to replace the dedicated GFX card, don't bother. Other than that, this is still the best 8c/16t cpu with iGPU on the market.", 'Has been using for weeks, all stable, good value for money.', 'CPU works perfectly fine in my B450 board.Good ? 8 cores/16 threads at 65w with iGPU, with the only weak points like pcie 3.0 and 16mb L3 cache.Bad ? Disappointed Amazon CSO declined my request to match the price drop days after I placed the order.', "Sono rimasto sbalordito dalle prestazioni offerte dal processore AMD Ryzen 7 5700G. Ecco perché sono entusiasta di condividere la mia esperienza con questo gioiello di tecnologia:Potenza Bruta:Il Ryzen 7 5700G si è dimostrato un vero campione in termini di prestazioni. Con 8 core e 16 thread, offre un'accelerazione incredibile per qualsiasi tipo di compito, che si tratti di gaming, editing multimediale o multitasking intenso. Le applicazioni pesanti vengono gestite senza alcun problema, garantendo una fluidità senza compromessi.Grafica Integrata Impressionante:La GPU Vega integrata è una sorpresa molto gradita. Anche senza una scheda grafica discreta, ho potuto godere di un'esperienza di gioco straordinaria. Giochi meno esigenti possono essere eseguiti a dettagli elevati senza alcun problema. Questo lo rende una scelta perfetta per costruzioni di sistemi compatti o per coloro che desiderano risparmiare sul costo di una GPU dedicata.Efficienza Energetica:Sono rimasto sorpreso dalla gestione dell'energia di questo processore. Nonostante le prestazioni eccezionali, l'efficienza energetica è notevole. Il Ryzen 7 5700G è stato progettato per offrire potenza senza dover compromettere il consumo energetico.Facilità di Overclocking:Per gli appassionati, l'overclocking è un piacere con questo processore. Le prestazioni possono essere spinte ulteriormente, permettendo un controllo totale sulla potenza di elaborazione.Compatibilità e Aggiornamenti:La compatibilità con le schede madri AM4 è un punto a favore. Inoltre, la possibilità di aggiornare il BIOS per supportare le ultime tecnologie garantisce che il Ryzen 7 5700G sia una scelta futura-proof.In conclusione, il processore AMD Ryzen 7 5700G ha superato le mie aspettative in termini di prestazioni, efficienza energetica e versatilità. Se stai cercando un processore che offra prestazioni di alto livello e una grafica integrata degna di nota, questo è sicuramente la scelta giusta. Lo consiglio vivamente a tutti gli appassionati di gaming e creativi che cercano il massimo dalle loro macchine.", 'Questo 5700G è sostanzialmente equivalente ad un Ryzen 5700X con qualche limitazione da un lato e con qualche miglioria dall\'altro.La limitazione è data dal fatto che non supporta lo standard pci-e 4.0 ma solamente 3.0 (per quanto mi riguarda non è un problema). Il lato migliore è dato dal fatto che ha una GPU integrata (Radeon Vega) in grado di offrire un adeguato framerate anche ad alte risoluzioni con livelli di dettaglio medio. In più la presenza di una architettura 8 core /16 thread ne consente un suo utilizzo anche per supportare carichi di lavoro pesanti.Stiamo parlando quindi di un processore di fascia medio-alta pensato per configurazioni office con heavy workload, media center o gaming di fascia bassa (se usato con la GPU integrata, medio-alta se usato per supportare una GPU dedicata)Io personalmente ho acquistato questa APU per realizzare una postazione di lavoro tipo "workstation" dove sfrutto la potenza del processore per far girare qualche machina virtuale per la generazione/gestione di servizi home (quindi con un po\' di disco e tanta RAM). La configurazione è la seguente:- Asrock B450 Steel Legend (Bios Aggiornato)- 4x16GB Corsair LPX 3600 CL18- 2 x Crucial P2 1TB NVME,- Thermalright SI-100- Case SilverStone Grandia GD09- Corsair TX650W Modulare- 3 x 120 Arctic P12- 2 x 80 Arctic P8- 1 Fan Controller Lamptron FC5Per l\'utilizzo che ne faccio che dire ... ottimo ottimo ottimo!!!', "I upgraded from a 2700X which was really good, However I hated not having onboard graphics to troubleshoot. While the On-Board graphics is powerful enough to do light gaming and basic office work It's only a Radeon Graphics APU, Meaning anything released in the last 15 years is probably outside of it's capabilities  with exception to some online games (Runescape, League of Legends, ect). That's not really why you would want to buy this for a gaming computer, You could have a processor with more raw power and more L2/L3 Cache that would definitely do better, but... having onboard graphics is sort of like a spare tire. When a GPU inevitably breaks it's nice to be able to hop along and still use your computer until you get a replacement. It's for this reason I bought this processor, my GPU may break & I may or may not be able to buy another graphics card based on current prices (Things have gotten crazy on the GPU market.... most people can't afford mid-range GPU's anymore) I love my computer but I'm not that wealthy, having onboard graphics as a spare tire is infinitely more valuable than 5% increase in performance, Don't let that fool you though this APU is a powerhouse of AM4 Architecture and compared to my 2700x It's really fast, with higher turbo frequencies and a much lower TDP, It can still be overclocked (granted voiding your warranty in the process) for when you want to squeeze even more juice out of it. Overall it's a great CPU and I highly recommend it for anyone who can't upgrade to AM5 yet (All AM5's have built in graphics)", 'Ich habe den AMD Ryzen 7 5700G mit integrierter AMD Radeon Grafik gekauft und bin absolut begeistert von seiner Leistung. Dieser Prozessor verfügt über 8 Kerne und 16 Threads, was eine herausragende Rechenleistung ermöglicht. Egal, ob Sie intensive Aufgaben ausführen, wie Videobearbeitung, 3D-Modellierung oder natürlich Gaming - der Ryzen 7 5700G steht Ihnen zur Seite.Was mich besonders beeindruckt hat, ist die nahtlose Zusammenarbeit mit einer NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2080 Super in Full HD Gaming. Der Prozessor liefert eine solide Leistung und ermöglicht ein reibungsloses Spielerlebnis mit hohen Frameraten und einer beeindruckenden Grafikqualität. Sie werden in der Lage sein, die neuesten Spiele in voller Pracht zu genießen, ohne Kompromisse eingehen zu müssen.Die integrierte AMD Radeon Grafik ist eine großartige Ergänzung, die zusätzliche Leistung bietet, insbesondere für Benutzer, die nicht sofort eine dedizierte Grafikkarte kaufen möchten. Sie können Spiele spielen, Videos streamen und sogar leichte Bildbearbeitung durchführen, ohne eine separate GPU anschließen zu müssen. Die Grafikleistung ist bemerkenswert und übertrifft viele integrierte Lösungen anderer CPUs.Die Kühlleistung des Ryzen 7 5700G ist ebenfalls beeindruckend. Mit einem angemessenen Kühler bleibt die Temperatur auch unter hoher Belastung stabil, was die Langlebigkeit des Prozessors gewährleistet. Es ist jedoch zu beachten, dass ein leistungsstarker Luft- oder Wasserkühler empfehlenswert ist, um die Temperatur noch weiter zu senken und das volle Potenzial des Prozessors auszuschöpfen.Darüber hinaus ist der Ryzen 7 5700G auch energieeffizient. Dank der 7-nm-Fertigungstechnologie von AMD wird der Stromverbrauch auf einem niedrigen Niveau gehalten, ohne die Leistungsfähigkeit zu beeinträchtigen. Das ist besonders wichtig für umweltbewusste Benutzer, die ihren CO2-Fußabdruck reduzieren möchten.Alles in allem kann ich den AMD Ryzen 7 5700G mit AMD Radeon Grafik wärmstens empfehlen. Mit seinen 8 Kernen, 16 Threads und der beeindruckenden Zusammenarbeit mit einer NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2080 Super bietet er eine hervorragende Leistung für Full HD Gaming und andere anspruchsvolle Aufgaben. Wenn Sie auf der Suche nach einem Top-CPU sind, ist der Ryzen 7 5700G definitiv eine herausragende Wahl.', "Un APU (CPU + iGPU), convaincant de part sa consommation modérée (grand max 90W au total CPU + iGPU), et une chauffe maîtrisée (jusqu'à 65W de TDP max), malgré une puissance clairement présente (autant pour la partie graphique (le plus puissant des iGPU) que CPU).La rapidité d’exécution des calculs n'est pas dingue (légèrement inférieure à un 5600X, à cause du manque de cache...), il en résulte donc des performances gaming correctes, sans plus, mais sa puissance totale (8 cœurs 16 threads tout de même) est conséquente, et permettra une utilisation des logiciels gourmands sans aucun soucis, et un multitâche poussé.La partie graphique permet du gaming léger (1080p low autour de 40fps en moyenne), et d'afficher de la 4k 60fps sur maximum 3 écrans (même si les cartes mères n'ont que 2 ports vidéos max...).Cet iGPU est bien supérieur en terme de perfs à tout ceux de Intel (même le dernier UHD 770) d'environ 30%, et amplement suffisant pour toutes les tâches bureautiques.Attention, l'iGPU ne disposant pas de mémoire vidéo dédié mais partagée, je vous recommande fortement d'opter pour de la RAM de qualité (minimum 2x8 Go en DDR4 3200 MHz), pour que la puissance de calcul graphique ne soit pas bridée. PS : pensez à activer l'XMP.En revanche pour les petites config gaming (autour de 500 euros) sans carte graphique dédiée, j'aurai plutôt tendance à vous recommander le 5600G, dont les perfs graphiques et en jeu sont quasi similaires, seule la puissance brute varie (d'environ 30%), et de 60 euros en moyenne moins cher.Pour les grosses config (> à 1000 euros), partez plutôt sur un 5600X ou un 5700X (et pour des config gaming entre 600 et 1000 euros, le 5600 tout court est top !!!).Pour le refroidissement, le Wraith Sleath intégrée à cet version boxed est limite... on atteint les 85 degrés lors des grosses charges. Un ventirad doté de minimum 4 caloducs est donc recommandé pour ménager la durée de vie de cet APU.Côté carte mère, une B450 est recommandée, attention, il faudra mettre à jours le BIOS.Une B550 est également compatible avec MàJ du BIOS, mais celle-ci sont plus couteuses, et n'apportent rien de plus, cet APU se limitant à du PCIe 3.0, contre 4.0 pour les 5000 et 5000x (à prendre en compte si on veut faire du gaming).- Parenthèse overclocking -L'overclocking de cet APU est top. Il est facile, apporte beaucoup, et très stable ! Par contre ça chauffe et consomme plus du coup (Passé à 120w de conso pour +10% de perfs). Mais surtout le must, c'est l'overclocking de l'iGPU ! Je l'ai passé à 2400MHz, et j'ai gagné 15% de fps !De plus, l'iMC dans cet APU est excellent, la RAM tourne bien même overclockée, même sur 4 rank, et même sur une CM Daisy-Chain !Résumé :Les plus :  - puissance brute  - efficacité énergétique  - rapport perfs/prix (pour 230 euros environ)  - la partie graphique convaincante  - l'overclocking fantastique !Les moins :  - le ventirad  - le manque de cache (=> pas ouf pour du gaming)  - la concurrence avec le 5600G, et les 5000X*  - l'absence de PCIe 4.0 (que du 3.0)Recommandé pour :De la bureautique poussée.Déconseillé pour :Du gaming.Voili voilou fin du pavé ;)"]

Product: Intel® Core™ i5-11400F Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.4 GHz LGA1200 (Intel® 500 Series & Select 400 Series Chipset) 65W
Reviews: ['Wanted to upgrade my old 6-year old build. Salvaged most parts and put in this Core i5-11400F processor, reasonably priced at <$200.Everything works/booted fine, no issues  - you will need your own graphics card (salvaged mine) for better resolution and a fan cooler (again salvaged); intel coolers are not the best.  All in all a good processor for office work (not for gaming - get an Core i7 for that).', 'Noticed that the price of 11400(F) has dropped quite significantly since the launch of Alder Lake. For the price of quality B560M motherboard and the CPU, it is a value choice.', 'Sehr guter cpu für nen arbeits pc aber auch sein sehr guter gaming cpu keine frage', 'Super recomendable para ensamblar tu pc gama media', 'I bought this based on performance to price for my second PC. I was going to use a 10000 series CPU but discovered that using the 11400 utiilizes the features on my motherboard better. This one works very well with my motherboard.', "the cpu is great for gaming, I use it only for that but the stock coolers is really bad, when first installed got temps about 90-95 celsius while gaming and had to check online for help, it turned out to be a bios setting (dont remember the exact name of the option, but I understand most gaming high end motherboards come with it eneabled) that makes it always go boosted clocks and therefore hot temps, disabled it and got temps down to 70-75 while gaming wich is still hot for my likes but I guess it's acceptable for the stock cooler.soon getting it a liquid cooler, but mostly for aesthetics, a decent air cooler will do the job", 'Funciona muy bien y su desempeño espectacular en gamming al igual que profesiona,ensamble con una RTX 3060 y funciona sin problemas,este procesador saca todo el jugo a esta gráfica sin ningún cuello de botella hasta la 3060TI pero ya para gama 70 para arriba ya es recomendable una generación más actual o uno de esta pero serie K para levantarlo sin problemasEn pocas palabras buen procesador e incluso me llegó con unos audífonos razer de diadema de regalo 🎁 amarrados con este mismo ,muchísimas gracias al vendedor , excelente compra 😃✨', "For the price, this is a great CPU. Be aware that this chip does not have built in graphics, so you'll need one.This worked perfect for my budget build I did with my son for his first gaming PC. You can't overclock it, but it does max out at 4.4 GHz and the 6 cores makes it work faster than I expected. Paired with a decent GPU and this chip is more than enough for a decent system.", 'Aunque tengo que comprar otro disipador vale la pena total', 'Llegó al día siguiente y funciona como es esperado a un buen precio. Es la versión F, así que no soporta gráfico integrado (es normal), se requiere una tarjeta externa para entregar video.']

Product: AMD Ryzen 7 5700X 8-Core, 16-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor, Ceramic Gray
Reviews: ["This is a great processor which only runs at 23% during Steam's Insurgency game! So much so that it is bottlenecking my old 1070GTX by quite a mile until I upgrade my GPU! However this processor runs 6 degree celcius hotter than Ryzen 6 cores processors because of the extra 2 cores. Overall, this processor is highly recommended to be able to handle intensive tasks and heavy gaming!", 'Comes well packed with packed air unlike certain other online retailers like L**** and S****Product is genuine as far as I can tell and is working well with Ryzen Master and AMD Adrenalin. Definitely a good last upgrade from my 3600 and AM4 board', 'Works like a charm with my Mortax Max.', 'Running like a charm, no overheating anymore', 'Lo Positivo:💨 Potencia y Velocidad Impresionantes: El AMD Ryzen 7 5700X ofrece un rendimiento excepcional con su reloj base de 3,4 GHz y una potencia máxima de reloj de 4,6 GHz. Los 8 núcleos y 32 MB de caché L3 brindan una experiencia de procesamiento rápida y fluida.🔥 Rendimiento para Tareas Pesadas: Este procesador es ideal para tareas pesadas y multitarea intensiva, como edición de video, diseño gráfico y juegos exigentes. No se queda atrás incluso ante las cargas de trabajo más desafiantes.⚡ Tecnología AMD Ryzen: La arquitectura avanzada de AMD Ryzen proporciona un rendimiento optimizado y una eficiencia energética mejorada. Es ideal para aquellos que buscan un procesador de alto nivel en términos de potencia y eficacia.🌡️ Sin Enfriador Incluido: Aunque puede ser visto como un punto negativo por algunos, la falta de enfriador incluido permite a los usuarios elegir un sistema de enfriamiento que se ajuste a sus necesidades específicas, especialmente para aquellos que desean un enfriamiento personalizado.Lo Negativo:❌ Enfriador No Incluido: Para algunos usuarios, la ausencia de un enfriador puede ser una desventaja, ya que tendrían que invertir en un enfriador por separado para asegurar un funcionamiento óptimo.🌡️ Temperaturas Elevadas: Algunos usuarios pueden experimentar temperaturas más altas durante el uso intenso, especialmente sin un enfriador adecuado.🛒 Conclusión:Adquirí el procesador AMD Ryzen 7 5700X y estoy muy satisfecho con su rendimiento. Aunque tuve que comprar un enfriador adicional, la potencia y velocidad que ofrece valen la inversión.Es ideal para mis necesidades de diseño gráfico y juegos exigentes.', 'The AMD Ryzen 7 5700X processor is a perfect replacement for my 2017 vintage Ryzen 7 1700 model workhorse (which I would be quite content to keep using except for lack of some obscure feature that Microsoft deems necessary for u[grading from Windows 10 to 11).It has the same 8 cores with 16 threads. (see screenshot of my old processor shown with the nifty "All CPU Meter" gadget, the new CPU looks almost the same but with shorter core bars indicating far greater throughput).It is officially supported for Windows 11, and provides a distinctly zippier performance. It also offers the same cool and running (65 Watt TDP). Running Prime95 as a stress tester it barely reaches 65-70 degrees Celsius, which is way below AMD\'s specification of 95 Celsius maximum allowable.INSTALLATION TIP - If your system will not boot after you install the CPU, try rebooting with just a single RAM card, which seems to trigger the processor recognition procedure in the BIOS  You can then reboot with all the original RAM cards installed.', 'Actualice desde un ryzen 5 2400g que tenía desde hace 5 años y el rendimiento mejoró para juegos sin duda, sin embargo las temperaturas son altas, mientras que en uso normal va de 47-60 grados, en juegos se mantiene arriba de 60-70 incluso llega a los 80 por lo que recomiendo optar por una mejor disipación distinta a la stock.Aún falta ver su rendimiento en otros programas pero de momento me ha solucionado mi problema de los tirones, ya que tenía un cuello de botella con mi rtx 2060. Si estás corto de dinero el R5 5600x estaría mejor, pero si puedes optar preferir este procesador que te vendra bien para futuras actualizaciones de tu PC.', 'Ich habe den 5700x als Ersatz für meinen 2700X gekauft und bin sehr zufrieden. Der geringere Stromverbrauch (immerhin 40 Watt weniger) bei deutlich besserer Leistung, ist ein echter Mehrwert für mich, da der Rechner bei mir 24/7 läuft.Auch ist der 5700X sehr kühl im Betrieb und daher stehen die Lüfter im Idle fast still - das war beim 2700x ganz anders. Im Stresstest komme ich bei 100% Auslastung auf gerade mal 52° Celsius (NZXT Kraken 360 Wasserkühlung). Da der Stresstest natürlich nicht mit meiner täglichen Nutzung zu vergleichen ist und ich selten über 20% Last komme, ist das System tatsächlich unhörbar leise bei rund 35° Celsius.Ich wollte eigentlich den 5800x kaufen, allerdings ist der mit 105 Watt im Stromverbrauch auf dem gleichen Niveau wie mein alter 2700x und was die Temperatur angeht ebenso. Auf die geringe Mehrleistung verzichte ich daher gerne und wenn ich sie bräuchte, dann wäre der 5700x auch sehr einfach zu übertakten, was aber für mich nicht in Frage kommt.Den 5800x hingegen müsste ich im Eco-Modus laufen lassen, damit er kühl und sparsam bleibt (dann wäre allerdings die Mehrleistung auch verpufft). Preislich tut sich bei beiden Prozessoren nicht viel, daher ist es nachher wirklich nur eine "Glaubensfrage".Ich bin mit dem Kauf sehr zufrieden.', 'I`ve created this review for people, like myself, considering updating an older Ryzen CPU for this end phase of the Ryzen 4 chipset.I pondered doing this for quite some time, read reviews researched etc, but I did have some doubts, even at a great price (£163) its still a lot of cash for something that may not make a huge difference.Well, no worries on that front at all, as you can see from the pictured CPUBenchmark results, the upgrade in performance is significant.The whole machine feels a lot snappier than before, more so than I expected. Software I run (Ableton + Games) are all more responsive, most games I`m getting noticeable increase in framerates.Fitting this was a easy, I also bought a Wraith Prism CPU cooler, as I was unsure if my stock 3600 cooler would do the job, plus its got lights on it!! As it goes, temps are actually better than the older 3600 so I think the older stock cooler would have done the job.For anyone with an older Ryzen looking to extend the life of their kit, I would recommend this CPU. I avoided the 5800x as the performance to price increase is not so good, additionally, it consumes more power and thus generates more heat.Super chuffed with this, reckon I`ve got another 4-5 years on this build now, probably longer!', "The AMD Ryzen™ 7 5700X desktop processor may belong to the last generation, but it still packs quite a punch and delivers an impressive performance that doesn't disappoint.Unleashing Power with 8 Cores and 16 Threads:With its 8-core, 16-thread configuration, the Ryzen™ 7 5700X is a true multitasking powerhouse. It effortlessly handles demanding tasks, making it ideal for gamers and content creators alike.Seamless Gaming Experience:When it comes to gaming, this processor is a force to be reckoned with. It delivers smooth and lag-free gameplay, and the 8 cores ensure that modern games run like a dream, even with demanding graphics.Editing Videos Like a Pro:For content creators and video editors, the Ryzen™ 7 5700X is a reliable companion. Its multithreaded performance shines during video editing tasks, reducing rendering times and enhancing overall productivity.Unlocked for Overclocking:Enthusiasts will appreciate the unlocked nature of this processor, allowing for easy overclocking to squeeze out even more performance when needed.Compatible with AM4 Socket:The Ryzen™ 7 5700X fits the AM4 socket, making it compatible with a wide range of motherboards. This ensures future upgradability and versatility in building your dream system.Reliable Cooling Solutions:The processor comes with a capable stock cooler that does a commendable job at keeping temperatures in check during regular use.Great Value for Performance:Though it's from the last generation, the Ryzen™ 7 5700X continues to offer excellent value for its performance. It competes admirably with newer counterparts in its price range.Future-Proof for Everyday Tasks:For everyday computing tasks, this processor is future-proof. It's more than capable of handling web browsing, office work, and other day-to-day activities with ease.Final Verdict:In conclusion, the AMD Ryzen™ 7 5700X 8-Core, 16-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor is a testament to AMD's commitment to delivering powerful and efficient processors. While it may belong to the last generation, its performance is nothing short of impressive. Gamers, content creators, and everyday users will find a lot to love in this processor, thanks to its multitasking capabilities and smooth gaming experience. If you're looking for a cost-effective option that can handle both gaming and productivity tasks without breaking the bank, the Ryzen™ 7 5700X is undoubtedly worth considering. It's a reliable performer that stands the test of time and continues to shine in various computing scenarios."]

Product: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked  LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Reviews: ["12600K is faster comparing to my 3900X(same on 3200Mhz, 8GB x4), more snappy when switching charts. Intel graphics driver doesn't support multi monitors well in Windows 10, seems to be okay in Windows 11. it cannot remember monitor relative postion when resume from sleep. no other issues found.", 'Good quality product.  I received messages about the location of my goods, so I always knew where it was and how long it would take to arrive.  The packaging is good, performance is good.', 'En general es un buen producto pero su manejo de temperaturas no me gusta, por un lado puedes tener un núcleo a 50°c mientras otro está a 34°c y otro a 29°c y tener saltos "raros" desde igual 29 a 45°c; y eso descontrola un poco el manejo del ventidador del disipador; esto es usando una motherboard nueva gigabyte B760m ds3h AX y refrigeración líquida Corsair Hydro H60, vengo de usar un AMD FX 8350 (que se calentaba mucho y por eso me acostumbre a la refrigeración líquida y con ese FX siempre tenía temperaturas en repodo de unos 25°c sin saltos raros y con el mismo H60 y TDP de 125W), cabe destacar que sabiendo del problema de pandeo que tiene esta serie (LGA 1700) he instalado desde el principio una placa de presion termalright para que ese problema no ocurra; hasta ahora todo funciona bien nunca ha pasado de los 60°c pero esos saltos de temperatura en diferentes partes del procesador siguen sin gustarme.', "Got it for £174 from Amazon US, which is about £65 cheaper than buying one in the UK. Even if you compare it with a 13400, which has a similar performance running at base clock, it is still so much cheaper (£46).If I remember correctly, the cpu does not come with a warranty, which is probably fine as CPUs are known to be very durable. So make sure you test it when you receivie it so you know if it's faulty.", 'Cumple con todo lo que promete, entiendo es una buena inversión, pues el mismo lo puedo usar tanto para gaming como para trabajo, excelente desempeño. Para una persona normal ita como yo esta súper, pues también he usado el 12700 y son muy parecidos en cuanto a rendimiento, a pesar de que el 12700 tiene más núcleos y que su consumo es menor, he sentido más estabilidad en el 12600k. Nota no hago OC. Siempre uso eso en stock.Lo tengo acompañado de rtx3080 y 64gb de RAM a 3600mhz y tengo otro que ya llevo desde que salió esta generación con 32gb de ram a 4400mhz y son una pasada para mi. Uno con Refrigeracion nzxt z53 y el otro con noctua nhd15s y se manejan súper las temperaturas en ambos casos.', 'He utilizado el procesador ya de algún tiempo y no he tenido problemas con el, simplemente perfecto', "Bought this as an upgrade for my old processor and I can honestly say I have not been disappointed. This thing is powerful and doesn't take up much energy. Haven't had any issues with it. If you've been eyeballing this one and are looking for a budget processor I'd say quit hesitating and get it.", 'I needed a PC that could edit video and raw picture files without crashing. This i5 10 core is amazing. I also added a GeForce 3060 ti and let my teen boys have a crack at it with gaming and they approve. I could have got a better CPU, but the price of this one was way worth it. Great buy!', 'Llego en perfectas condiciones y no me ha dado problemas en lo absoluto. Aun no pruebo el overclock pero no lo veo necesario, lo compré para que en unos años cuando se este quedando corto el procesador hacerle overclock y sacarle un par de años de uso más', 'Super recomendado comprado este año 2023, una excelente inversión. Super rápido.']

Product: AMD RYZEN THREADRIPPER 3960X 24-Core 48-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor, Black, Medium
Reviews: ['As a 3D artist I gotta say I really like this CPU! It is really fast at rendering and got a Cinebench score of 14254! I did enable the Precision Boost Overdrive in the BIOS.Things you should know is,make sure you properly cool this CPU, I bought the new Aorus Liquid Cooler 360 and it couldn’t cool down my temperatures at full CPU load of 95c, and resulted in lower Cinebench scores of around 13400-13700.However, I switched to a Noctua air cooler “NH-U14S TR4-SP3”, and replaced the fan it came with, with a 120mm fan “NF-A12x25” for better RPM. Overall, idle temps and full load were much better! 36c-39c idle, 84c-85c full load and much quieter than the Aorus Liquid cooler 360.Finally, I am happy with this CPU and it serves me well.Quick Note: just make sure you know what you are doing if you decide to enable Precision Boost Overdrive. Read and look up information and tutorials. and don’t mess with anything if you don’t know much.Update on a 5 star review:Unfortunately, I have to knock down 2 stars because as a 3D artist, Maya user, whenever I try to unfold some pieces of my UV\'s, I get a "// Error: Unfold3D process error." , which some users have experienced with Ryzen CPU\'s if you look in the Maya forums the same mesh works with Intel rigs and functions properly. Personally, I never had a problem unfolding UV\'s with my Intel rig until in Maya 2019-2020, only when I bought my new 3960X, which is a nightmare with UV unfolding because you have to cut the UV\'s in places that are very undesirable in order to unfold your UV\'s and then I have to reattach them manually in the right places.I know Intel\'s prices for the Intel - Core i9-10980XE 18-core may be high, but if you want to avoid software issues, I would definitely go Intel because recently as 02/24/2020 AMD has had many driver issues with their GPU\'s and the Ryzen Master App is super buggy, sometimes it loads and sometimes it doesn\'t and I get an "error hence aborting". Literally, I have to click on the Ryzen Master App sometimes up to 5 times in order to bypass the error to load up the app. AMD\'s hardware is impressive, but without proper functioning software it will still be behind Intel.Final thoughts:I would not recommend buying this CPU if you are a Maya user, AMD\'s software is too buggy and unreliable and this is the first and last time I will buy AMD. Sorry AMD, I gave you a chance and you failed me big time, I trusted you and these type of issues are not acceptable. Maya is an industry standard, and AMD should\'ve invested more time into these types of issues because you cannot render your mesh without UV unwrapping and texturing it first, so fast renders don\'t mean a thing if my Ryzen CPU has issues UV unfolding my UV\'s. UV unfolding was such a headache because it made a simple thing into a nightmare.', "I was debating between this and the 36 core model, and I'm glad I went with this one. My other components are 128gb of ram, Two 1tb NVMe 4.0 drives, 2080it...I use a LOT of the Adobe Suite, and for video editing, the Adobe CC suite isn't quite coded to fully utilize a build like this. Right now I've done a lot of editing and rendering and here is my experience:-Adobe After Effects: can not utilize these many cores. I'm sure the next release will, but right now if I render a video or even during editing, I'm at most 38percent processor utilization. According to what I can find on Adobe's site, it maxes out at 16 cores.- Adobe Rush - Utilizes all cores, but even with multiple layers on a 4k 60 min video file, 72% processor utilization-Adobe Premiere -  Same as Rush, but on a few renders I've been able to get up to high 80s on utilization.I don't regret the build, but at the moment, Adobe needs to do a lot of work on their software to start to utilize these processors.That being said... I can render something, and continue using my computer as if nothing is going on in the background, and that is incredible.My plan is to use this smaller core build, and then as Adobe steps up their game, and windows steps up their processor utilization game, then I'll upgrade to the larger core and not need to replace any other components.-", 'If you want a CPU that supports 256GB of RAM as QUAD channel (not dual) and has PCIE lanes in abundance, then this is a CPU for you.This is one of the very last CPUs that is affordable with these specifications.I do finite element analysis FEA. I do benefit significantly from more memory channels and a 256GB ECC RAM size, PCIE lanes etc. The 5950x and the 12900k go only up to 128gb and ECC support is not easy.It is still a bargain compared to the 5965WX Threadripper Pro which is listed for thousands more.It is still faster than the 12900k in memory intensive applications such as FEA. 7zip benchmark is attached.', 'The retail packaging is rather elaborate and seems rather more for jewellery (which it shares the price with). However the chip is delivered well protected. It is supplied with a torque wrench to ensure that the bolts locking down the holder on the mainboard are not overtightened. The chip is not supplied with a cooler, so you must find one yourself and ensure that you have the right thermal paste.For gaming it is great but possibly not the best value for money now. Where it excels are apps with lots of threads so graphics/video processing as well as AI/ML.For best performance, you need the right motherboard, I went for the Aorus TRX40 Master and the bios supported this processor out of the box', 'I Got this last week. I own a threadripper 3970x But. that is more costly then this one so I decided to buy this for my second threaddripper build. I used the same Asus mother board. I used the same be quiet air cooled cpu cooler. I went with the same  500gb Aorus nvme 2 ssd.  I used a corsair rm850x psu and 8 sticks of hyperx 16gb ram for a total of 128gb ram.  I mine with this machine Xmr/monero this machine cost me a lot less then my 3970x build.Which is same motherboard ,same cooler, same nvme ssd.  I am happy with this after 10-14 days of running it is nice.this machine does 21-22k hash ratethe more expensive machine does 27-28k hash rate.this build. was 35% cheaper. and I get 25% less hash not 35% less so this has more value.', 'Die alte Krücke wollte die Videobearbeitung nicht mehr so recht schaffen. Darum musste ein neuer PC her.Braucht man das in dieser Stärke?Ganz einfach: wer gelegentlich mal ein Video schneidet sicher nicht, aber bei mir läuft das fast täglich über den PC. Darum her mit was Vernünftigem.Der CPU ist der günstigste der 3ten Generation. Mit dem Oreis zwar kein Schnäppchen, aber man hat schon mehr Geld für Unnötigeres ausgegeben.Mit der Motherboard eigenen Software mal die Übertaktung getestet und im Stresstest 4,175 Gigahertz erreicjt bei knapp 81°C. Alles im grünen Bereich.PC Programme für Foto- und Videobearbeitung installiert, knapp 1 Minute je Programm.Video gerendert und exportiert, zusammen knapp 3 Minuten. Vorher waren es 30-60 Minuten und eine extrem heiße CPU. Jetzt grad mal 55°C.Also ein voller Gewinn.', 'Does everything it needs to do fast and efficiently. I lowered the PPT from 280Watts to 180Watts in Bios (can be done in ryzen master as well) and lost only 10% multicore performance and lost 0 single core performance for 40% less energy and heat output. Using this currently with a Noctua NH U9 TR4/SP3 cooler which only supports up to 180Watts of power. Under prime95 for a few hours all core load small FFT the temps stabilize around 80-87 Celcius. Absolute beast and quiet.', 'Upgraded from a 2700x to this with an Asus sTRX 40-E Gaming. the quad channel memory is INSANELY fast. I load games like Resident Evil 3 in about 5 seconds paired with a Radeon VII with water cooling for both.I run NPlus Miner for crypto mining on this and it runs at 50c at full load with a 360x 60mm thick rad.Worth every penny!', "Great for video editing in DaVinci Resolve or Premiere Pro. I've noticed a good performance boost when using it to create motion graphics inside the Fusion tab of Resolve, much faster than the Intel i9 9920x I was using. It also renders out projects very fast which is great in case I need to go back and render something out again. My first AMD processor and I couldn't be happier.The only thing to look out for is the heat this thing generates, using a Noctua NH-U14S, but it's not the recommended fan cooler for this CPU. The only coolers on the recommended list for this CPU are liquid coolers to my knowledge (as of 2/22/2020). Excellent CPU, worth the $$$ and switch to AMD.", 'Very happy with this purchase, has been working reliably for serval months.(not used for gaming - rather on a software developer machine)']

Product: Intel Core i5-13600KF Desktop Processor 14 cores (6 P-cores + 8 E-cores) 24M Cache, up to 5.1 GHz
Reviews: ['Happy to build my PC with the latest 13th gen i5 processors.', "Excellent  CPU, great gaming performance, and  the midrange  King of Productivity. Typical of Intel, it just works flawlessly with everything, 14 cores & 20 threads deal easily with heavy work loads.  Fast, 5.5-5.7 Ghz overclock, no problem! Efficient gaming chip, uses a little over half the power as a 9th Gen 9600k (that's  with a 5.5GHz overclock) and UK summertime in game temps rarely exceed mid 50°C's. (cooled with 280mm AIO) Flexible,  use with DDR4 or DDR5, so there's  a wide range of mobo's  to choose from. Impressive CPU.", 'this i5-kf replaces my 11th gen i7-kf. sure, one reads that and first thought is, he\'s downgrading. well, hang on, grasshopper!! this pup puts the 11th gen i7 to shame even when it was slightly overclocked. very weird cause it\'s has a slower speed but when it\'s time to rock & roll, it flies.boot time, and app loading is measurably quicker. when stress/load tested using the intel tool, it gets very hot. with this processor, temps above 89c did not cause throttling, so intel must be ok with this. temps are considerably lower when not testing. i was ready to buy an aio cooler but am holding off for now. the huge noctua d15 attached may suffice. i don\'t want to mess around with water pumps, so until intel figures out how to bring the heat, with less heat, i can park here for the foreseeable.lemme go out on a limb and say that for most folks, this much hp may be overkill. lastly, this was not a "vine" purchase but a damn good one at $285!', 'Got one for each kid.  Very thankful I bought them over the ryzen 7600 and 7700.  Card is a beast for gaming and smokes the Ryzens in multi tasking eqsoly.and even gaming, especially when overclocked.  Does great on an AK620 zerodark.  Nabbed money for loke 230 or 250 on sale. Worth every penny.', "While I've been trying to build a PC as a blender workstation I wanted a good enough processor that won't bottleneck under £300 as spent most of my budget on GPU. But it is way better than I expected. I am not rendering anything with the CPU and it handles complex geometry without hiccups. Unless you're doing complex simulations, I think it's a decent option as you can use the extra cash on GPU.", "I bought this proceesor based on the recommendation that it's the go-to mid/upper mid-range for this generation. I didn't do any in-depth comparisons for cost to speed, etc. as I felt it unnecessary. I'm coming from a 2014 Intel i7, so pretty much anything is going to be an upgrade. Everything is working great. Air cooled with a deepcool AK620, the temps under prime95 load can reach 100c, which seems extremely hot, but it seems like that's just the way the cookie crumbles with my setup. Reapplied thermal paste and made some space in my tower for better airflow and it more or less remained the same. Idle temps are around 35c.Everything is running very snappily, particularly loading models in Stable Diffusion now takes only seconds when it used to take minutes with my 4790k. Hoping this CPU will last me just as long.", "I won't go into much technical detail here since there's people a lot smarter than myself who can get into the nitty gritty. Generally speaking though - this CPU absolutely smokes, especially for the price. Don't let the 'i5' name fool you. The i5-13600K (and KF) is a top-class processor that for most users, will offer more than enough performance for intensive tasks while having probably the most reasonable power consumption and cooling requirements of the top-three 13th generation Intel processors.I came from an i7-5960X - still a solid processor in this day and age but unfortunately my motherboard wasn't exactly kind to me attempting to take it above 3.8 GHz. Despite it bottlenecking against my 2080 Ti, it still ran cool under a 360mm CLC, topping out at no more than 51 degrees C gaming (GPU load) and 60 degrees under full CPU loads. But since the current market for new components is pretty good, I opted to go all in on a 13th gen build rather than find a better X99 motherboard.Odds are, you're probably going to be cross shopping the i5-13600K with the i7-13700K and the i9-13900K. Unless your workflow necessitates the additional core count or you're chasing records, the performance difference between those CPUs and the 13600K did not seem worth the hundreds of dollars of additional cost and the massive increase in peak power consumption. Power also equals heat, and that was another motivating factor for going with the 13600K, having been accustomed to a relatively cool and quiet build for some time. That said; with the additional cores and much higher boost frequency, I was expecting higher peak power draw and temps despite a lower TDP on paper.And they were definitely higher, under the same 360mm CLC. After running benchmarks with Cinebench and 3DMark, I was hitting peak temps in the mid-to-high 70s under full CPU loads. Gaming loads however were definitely more manageable though, sitting in the 40s and seldom breaking 50 degrees, which was actually a small but appreciable improvement over the 5960X. I'd advise at minimum a high quality air cooler or a 240mm CLC for this processor.The out of the box performance is something else though. I managed to hit 23345 on a multi-core Cinebench test and a 16459 combined score on 3DMark Time Spy. Again, this is stock clocks paired with an overclocked 2080 Ti and 32GB of DDR5 at 5600 MHz. At 3440 x 1440 and 144Hz, games run like butter. I could dabble in overclocking it since I have the headroom but honestly, I don't see the point. It's fantastic as is.All in all, I feel like the 13600K is kind of the no-brainer option for most people looking to put together a high-end system on a budget. You're getting most of the performance of it's more expensive stablemates for a much lower price and less obnoxiously high power and cooling requirements. The KF is also a little cheaper if you don't need integrated graphics. Just buy it. You'll love it.", "For the price, it's just as good as most i9 and i7 processors and comes in a bit cheaper too. I use my PC for gaming/multitasking and it hasn't given me any issues so far.", 'Temp is fine on an air cooled pc.  It plays stafield just fine and price wise it was well worth it for the speed of this little bugga', 'Great processor for the price.']

Product: AMD Ryzen 9 5900X 12-core, 24-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor
Reviews: ['Good performance at a good price. No problems running Cyberpunk 2077', "Bought this for a new desktop I was building.Paired it with a NZXT X73 cooler (I'm using a Lian Li Lancool III RGB case) and I'm getting high 30s degrees when idle and high 60s - low 70s degrees when under load.Blazing fast and performs really well.  Even running Cyberpunk 2077 I get about 25% - 30% load max on 4K with a 3080Ti on Ultra, which leaves a ton of legroom for other apps running concurrent.I got it for SG$499 (including import fees), which is a real bargain.", 'Great CPU to get for productivity. Bought it for my custom build. Runs at about 75 degrees at peak loads with a fan cooler. Great buy!', 'Sold and shipped from Amazon USA.Well packaged with minimal damage to packaging during transport.Box contains only the CPU without any accessories or cooler, as expected.Direct drop in replacement of my 1st gen ryzen 1700 on my Asus x370 prime pro board.Updated bios to latest version prior to CPU swap. Works flawlessly.', "Great for both video work and gaming. Snagged this for 580SGD, an excellent price for the performance offered by this chip. I was debating between the 5700X, 5800X3D, and this, but when i saw this go for such a low price, I just went for it and I certainly didn't regret it!", "Upgraded from 5600X. This 12 core Ryzen is going to last a very long time, even Intel's i9-10900K only has 10 cores. I'd never maxed out my 5600X with any games or applications, and have never gone above 50% utilization with this 5900X.Only con is that the box is ridiculously empty since there is no cooler included. AMD could have made the packaging 20x smaller", 'I ordered 5950X initially, but waiting one week and didn’t ship, so I cancelled the Order and ordered 5900x, so far this cpu gave great performance to my daily work at video editing. Rendering takes a few minutes compared with my 2019 Mac Mini takes 6 hours to finish.', 'Great CPU. But it is hot. I plan to use this for my own personal desktop + lab. I paired it with Scythe Fuma 2 cooler. Many testings are yet to be done. So far, I am happy with it.', 'Authentic AMD Ryzen 9 5900X. Fast CPU, fast delivery.', "Best buy at promotional discount, the final upgrade for AM4. I'll be using this for a long time ahead.Amazon finally shipping this in a proper cardboard box and not in a flimsy manila envelope."]

Product: Intel Core i9-13900K (Latest Gen) Gaming Desktop Processor 24 cores (8 P-cores + 16 E-cores) with Integrated Graphics - Unlocked
Reviews: ["The Intel Core i9-13900K Gaming Desktop Processor has completely redefined my gaming and computing experience, offering a level of performance that's truly in a league of its own. With an impressive 24 cores, this processor delivers raw power that translates into seamless gaming, multitasking, and content creation.To start, the processing prowess of the Intel Core i9-13900K is jaw-dropping. The 24 cores and 48 threads make it a true powerhouse, capable of handling the most demanding tasks with ease. Whether it's immersive gaming, 3D rendering, video editing, or complex simulations, this processor doesn't break a sweat.The gaming performance is a standout feature. With its high clock speeds and multithreading capabilities, the i9-13900K ensures buttery-smooth gameplay even in the most graphically intensive titles. The ability to run background applications without compromising gaming performance is a game-changer for streamers and content creators.Multitasking reaches new heights with this processor. The 24 cores enable effortless switching between applications, ensuring a seamless workflow even with resource-hungry software. Whether I'm editing videos, running virtual machines, or working on complex projects, the processor's performance remains consistently impressive.The Intel Core i9-13900K's compatibility with the latest technologies is worth noting. Support for PCIe 5.0 and DDR5 memory allows for lightning-fast data transfer speeds and optimal memory performance, further enhancing the overall computing experience.Thermal management is another area where this processor shines. The advanced cooling solutions and efficient power consumption ensure that the processor maintains optimal temperatures under heavy loads, contributing to its long-term reliability.In conclusion, the Intel Core i9-13900K Gaming Desktop Processor has exceeded my expectations in terms of performance, gaming prowess, multitasking capabilities, technology integration, and thermal management. Its 24 cores offer a level of processing power that's perfect for gamers, content creators, and professionals seeking exceptional performance across the board. If you're looking to elevate your gaming and computing experience to unprecedented heights, the Intel Core i9-13900K is undoubtedly a worthy investment. It has earned my highest praise and has become the centerpiece of my high-performance desktop setup.", 'When it comes to going over the top for a PC upgrade, this CPU is the undisputed heavyweight champion. I, too, dabble in video editing, 3D modeling, and an array of demanding tasks, and let me tell you, this powerhouse just devours them with sheer gusto. Paired with a Kraken water cooler, it operates like a well-oiled machine, showing absolutely no signs of throttling, even under the most intense workloads. And as for those so-called "CPU-intensive" games, well, they might as well be child\'s play for this beast. If you\'re seeking the best of the best, look no further – this CPU is the crown jewel in the kingdom of processors, and it\'s here to make your computing dreams come true. It\'s not just top-tier; it\'s top of the world, and it laughs in the face of anything you throw its way. A true marvel of technology that\'s worth every penny!', "The Intel Core i9-13900K is undeniably a top-tier processor that showcases unparalleled performance and technological excellence. However, it's essential to acknowledge that this exceptional power comes with a premium price tag. While the Intel Core i9-13900K may be considered expensive, the performance it delivers makes it a compelling option for those who demand the absolute best from their computing experience.Let's address the elephant in the room first: the cost. The i9-13900K is indeed one of the higher-priced processors on the market. This means it may not be the most budget-friendly choice for all users, especially for those whose computing needs aren't as resource-intensive. However, for professionals, enthusiasts, and gamers who rely on cutting-edge performance to tackle demanding workloads and push their creativity to the limits, the i9-13900K's price begins to justify itself.With its impressive 16 cores and 32 threads, this processor shines in multitasking scenarios and content creation tasks. Video rendering, 3D modeling, and heavy computation become swift and seamless experiences, reducing project turnaround times and boosting overall productivity.Gaming enthusiasts will be delighted with the i9-13900K's prowess in delivering breathtaking gaming performance. Its native support for DDR5 memory and PCIe 5.0 ensures faster data access and transfer, leading to quicker load times and smoother gameplay, which enhances the gaming experience to a whole new level.The processor's unlocked multiplier empowers overclockers to maximize its potential further, catering to those who love to tweak and fine-tune their systems for optimal performance. With Intel's Turbo Boost Technology 4.0, you'll experience intelligent performance adjustments, optimizing efficiency when required and delivering maximum power when needed.Furthermore, Intel's 10nm SuperFin process technology contributes to the i9-13900K's energy efficiency, ensuring that it provides a balance between power and consumption, which is especially vital for environmentally-conscious users.In conclusion, the Intel Core i9-13900K may have a higher price point, but it delivers a level of performance that leaves competing processors trailing in its wake. While not everyone might find it within their budget, for those seeking the absolute pinnacle of computing capabilities, the i9-13900K is an investment worth considering. If performance and cutting-edge technology are your top priorities, this processor will undoubtedly elevate your computing experience to new heights, making it a worthy 5-star choice despite its cost.", 'This processor is a beast especially paired with gtx 4090 graphics card. I can edit videos and play games both at 4K settings together no problem and it doesn’t generate that much heat either. I previously had a 2080ti paired with 6900k and was very happy with it until everyone was transitioning to 4K so sadly I had to retire my old build. Just a heads up to anyone who plans to pair 13900k with 4090, don’t be a smartass and try to put it in small case, you will regret it later. I personally recommend big case with high airflow like fractal design torrent mid size atx but if you don’t want to spend too much money on graphics card and happy with getting something like 4060 then you can get the nano version of fractal torrent. Good luck gamers and editors. Just remember if gaming is the only thing you do then no point spending this much just go a step down on processor. AMD processors are better if gaming is the only thing you do.', 'Todo llego bien. Me gusto mucho el cuidado de empaquetado del producto. Muy bien.', 'Well, what can I tell you, it is simply the best processor of 2023, you have to have an idea of \u200b\u200bwhat you are going to use it for, it is a big beast that is not worth it for small fights.', 'Extremely fast processor. Moved from a 12900kf. Much faster RAM clocks without the issues the 12900kf was giving me.I have been using the processor for a while now with no issues and great thermals on a watercooled system. The processor stability has been rock solid even with a bios updated 12th gen motherboard.', 'Thanks 🙏', 'Super', 'Would recommend it for your battle station. I could not be happier.']

Product: AMD Ryzen™ 3 4100 4-Core, 8-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor with Wraith Stealth Cooler
Reviews: ['Windows上ではRyzen3 4100として認識され、4コア8スレッドで動作しています。', 'Yo la compré reacondicionada porque las CPUs prácticamente no tienen desgaste en comparación con el resto de componentes del build, así que te puedes ahorrar un buen pico comprandola reaco.Otro tip que os doy es que no hace falta pasta térmica! Ya viene con ella aplicada, en mi caso aún siendo de segunda mano al haberla comprado en estado "Muy bueno" la tenía sin tocar.La verdad que no sabía que estas venían con ella ya aplicada, pero bueno, dicen que la que traen de stock ya es suficientemente buena y así que otra cosa que te ahorras 😉Espero que os haya sido de utilidad estos dos tips', "This CPU is only 4C/8T which limits it's capabilities tremendously. I have it paired with an ASUS Radeon RX 6500 XT, (Which doesn't necessarily help it out in the gaming department.) and it does moderately well.It can run Apex Legends, The Forest, GTA V, Days Gone, Fortnite, Call of Duty, and some other games that aren't too demanding. If you were looking at this CPU for a good long term investment, don't.It does the job for now but it will be replaced soon. You get what you pay for. With this CPU you will only get 1080p at medium-high settings, even with the overclock. Any settings that are greater than that just feels rough to play.", 'Paired this with a ASUS A520-M A II board with 16 gigabytes of DDR4 3200 and slapped a Noctua NH-U9S that I bought previously and I’m absolutely loving how fast this thing is.', 'I had to fix a few bent pins and noticed a pin was broken, but still works!', 'Excelente procesador, se tiene en un servidor casero en modo headless y no ha presentado ningún problema, maneja excelente consumo energético y temperaturas aun usando su disipador de stock.', "Bonjour, ce processeur est sans chipset graphique. Après montage du pc, j'ai dû chercher deux jours pourquoi mon écran restait noir et pourquoi j'avais 4 bips au départ. Achetez une carte graphique en plus !!! Ça devrait être précisé sur le descriptif comme chez TopAchat.", 'great value for price. upgraded a ageing amd am2+ 7800 black edition 8gb ram nvidia geforce 8800gt 1gb . to a am4 r3 4100 32gb ram nvidia rtx 2060 6gb now dont have any choppy playback of uhd video. running ubuntu. works great.', 'Easy to install', 'Funciona bien en multitarea y puedes colocarle hasta una rx 580 de 8gb sin experimentar cuello de botella']

Product: Intel CPU BX8070110100F Core i3-10100F / 3.6GHz / 6MB LGA1200 4C / 8T
Reviews: ['Ottimo processore, rapporto qualità prezzo imbattibile. Molti lo giudicano male, ma pagare questo gioiellino intorno alle 50-60 euro per avere un processore nuovo in grado di battere processori usati chissà quanti anni venduti al doppio non è una cosa trascurabile', 'シネベンチでも余裕の性能です。', '安くても良い品物です。', 'It brings my cpu usage up to 70-100 when i game but it is fine', 'Este procesador en combinación con una RTX 3050, es una buena elección calidad/precio para PCs de entrada, mas que suficiente para Juegos competitivos (Valorant, CSGO, LOL, etc.) E incluso para algunos AAA rinde muy bien, ha llenado las espectativas de rendimiento.', 'It is not the best but if you are in a budget, it is enough.', 'Anteriormente tenia un i3 de séptima generación siempre estaba arriba de los 50°, pero este siendo más nuevo se mantiene en los 37-45°, usando el mismo disipador un cool master de aire', 'Works great, best 4 core 8 thread in my opinion', 'O processador chegou rapidamente, em apenas 1 dia. Esse é o melhor i3, não tem placa de vídeo integrada, mas compensa muito no resto.Para quem tem uma placa de média, como eu, vai acabar tendo a combinação perfeita.', 'buen producto']

Product: Intel Core i5-12400F Processor - S-1700-2.50GHz - 6-Core -18MB Smart Cache (12th Generation - Alder Lake)
Reviews: ['INTROCome è giusto che sia, anziché comprare portatilini e preassemblati, un vero nerd si costruisce il computer da solo, e oltre a questo, condivide la sua esperienza nell\'antica arte del PC Building anche con amici e parenti. Mio fratello aveva necessità di utilizzare un computer, e immaginando la tristezza di vederlo con un portatile, un preassemblato o ancora peggio con un Mac, ho pensato di costruirgli un computerino su misura. E comunque, quale modo migliore di convertire qualcuno al PC Gaming se non con un computer assemblato con tanto amore fraterno?Ho deciso quindi di scegliere questo processore perché trattandosi di una build sostanzialmente da utilizzo scolastico + gaming, e con un budget relativamente limitato (ok l\'amore fraterno e tutto ma non esageriamo), mi sembrava il miglior compromesso tra prestazioni e qualità. Alla fine il venditore mi ha spedito il 12400F, ma io volevo il 12400, quindi ho fatto il reso, e ho comprato il 12500 che comunque è identico a parte la GPU integrata e frequenze un pelino più alte, quindi lo posso recensire lo stesso visto che sostanzialmente sono lo stesso processore.Si tratta di un processore da 6 core e 12 thread, che non ha i fantomatici E-cores delle serie più costose (per sempio, il 12600 ha 6P-Core come questo più 4E-Core che aiutano nelle operazioni in background, specialmente se usate Windows 11), a una frequenza di 2.5 Ghz con un boost fino a 4.4Ghz se le temperature, il workload, e la vostra scheda madre lo permettono.Un processore di questo tipo eccelle nel gaming, ma non fa schifo neanche nelle operazioni più complicate, infatti questo processore si comporta benissimo anche nel video editing con Adobe Premiere.L\'ho abbinato a una RTX3060 12G della Gigabyte e a 32Gb di DDR4 a 3200Mhz, il tutto su una Asus B660M-A Prime.PERFORMANCE E TEMPERATURECome dicevo prima, si tratta di un processore di fascia media particolarmente portato per il gaming, ma che gestisce senza intoppi anche le operazioni più "professionali". L\'architettura di questi processori Intel di dodicesima generazione, dopo un\'undicesima generazione abbastanza deludente, è eccellente.Senza dare i numeri con benchmark e altre cose poco comprensibili, vi posso dire che nel gaming si comporta allo stesso livello del buon vecchio Ryzen 5 5600X, senza dubbio il miglior processore di fascia media assieme a questo. Non credo avrete problemi in gaming o produttività utilizzando questo processore, ammesso che il resto dell\'hardware sia all\'altezza.Io lo utilizzo con delle banali DDR4 a 3200Mhz, quindi come performance siamo simili al 5600X che avevo su una mia build dell\'anno scorso, se invece lo abbinate a delle DDR5 un po\' serie può sicuramente superarlo anche se di poco.In ogni caso, nel gaming si comporta benissimo, specialmente se abbinato ad una GPU un po\' seria (come la mia RTX3060). Non ho notato colli di bottiglia, specialmente nel caso di questa build, che sarà usata con un monitor "solo" 1080p.Per quanto riguarda le temperature, si tratta di una CPU abbastanza tranquilla con un TDP di solo 65W. Al momento non ho un dissipatore, perché non mi è arrivato, quindi sto usando il dissipatore stock incluso nella confezione. Mi aspettavo facesse pena, invece è decisamente accettabile. Le temperature non superano i 70C in gaming, anche con giochi pesanti, mentre invece sfruttandola al massimo con un Cinebench, non supera gli 80C, che è accettabile e ampiamente sotto la soglia di throttling di 100C. Anche il rumore della ventolina originale è abbastanza contenuto, quindi boh, magari lo tengo con il dissipatore stock. Sicuramente comunque il mio case, un NZXT con 4 ventole aggiuntive, aiuta non poco, oltre a questo non mi fidavo del velo di pasta termica preapplicata, e ci ho messo la mia fidata Gelid GC Extreme, perché per un processore da 65W con il dissi stock sicuramente è necessaria una pasta termica di livello Extreme.VERSIONE F O NON F? TRAY O BOX? GPU INTEGRATA?La differenza tra le due versioni sta nella disponibilità della GPU integrata. La versione F non la include, e generalmente costa un po\' meno. A seconda della differenza di prezzo, valutate se prendere una o l\'altra. Io non sono un fan delle GPU integrate Intel e cerco sempre quando possibile di abbinare una GPU dedicata, anche se scarsissima. In questo caso ho la RTX3060 che è una buona scheda da gaming, quindi perché ho voluto prendere il processore con la GPU integrata? Perché con certi programmi che supportano la tecnologia Intel Quicksync, la GPU integrata non sta lì a dormire ma viene utilizzata attivamente per l\'encoding video o per altre operazioni, come per esempio la timeline in Premiere. Il fratellino utilizza Adobe Premiere che può sfruttare questa tecnologia, ma anche altri programmi di video editing o streaming la usano, come per esempio OBS Studio, che può sfruttare l\'encoder video della GPU integrata per strimmare, lasciando libera la GPU dedicata per il gioco.In ogni caso, la GPU Integrata è la solita Intel UHD, sul 12400 è la UHD 730, sul 12500 la 770. Non l\'ho testata molto nel gaming, ma comunque non aspettatevi chissà cosa. La potenza di questa è simile alle entry level dedicate sui portatili di qualche anno fa come la 930M o giù di lì, quindi va bene per giochi leggeri. In ogni caso, non ha problemi di sorta quando si tratta di visualizzare video o immagini 3D non particolarmente complesse, regge senza problemi i video in 4k su youtube o giochini retro ed emulatori vari.Per quanto riguarda altre nomenclature criptiche, a volte vediamo Tray o Box, la differenza tra le due è la presenza del dissipatore nella versione Box. Come dicevo sopra, il dissipatore è scarso ma per una CPU come questa è sufficiente. Se invece il dissi non vi serve, prendete la versione Tray.PRENDO IL 12400, 12500 O 12600?Secondo me, tra questi tre il migliore è il 12400 e vi spiego anche il perché.Il 12400 e il 12500 sono fratelli, mentre il 12600 è a tutti gli effetti il modello superiore.Partiamo dal 12500, questo processore ha la stessa base del 12400 ma con frequenze di base e di boost poco più alte, oltre che una gpu integrata leggermente più potente (ovvero la Intel UHD 770 contro la 730 del 12400). Le frequenze più alte in buona sostanza si traducono in un miglioramento statico in media del 5%, di più o di meno a seconda del workload, ma praticamente mai sopra il 10%. La GPU integrata è di poco più potente, ma si tratta sempre di un\'integrata scarsissima poco adatta per il gaming a prescindere. Se la differenza di prezzo fosse di una decina di euro ci potrebbe anche stare, ma onestamente non mi viene in mente nessuna ragione per la quale il 12500 merita di esistere a quasi 100€ in più. Evitatelo. Io l\'ho comprato solo perché mi serviva di fretta e il venditore ha sbagliato a inviarmi il 12400F anziché il 12400. Altrimenti non l\'avrei mai comprato.Il 12600 invece è su un altro campo da gioco, ed è a tutti gli effetti il modello superiore. Come dicevo all\'inizio, oltre ai 6 P-Core il 12600 ha 4 E-Core, oltre che frequenze più alte, e la versione K se volete overcloccare. Per il prezzo di quasi 150€ sopra al 12400, potrebbe anche starci se rientra nel vostro budget e fate multitasking intenso o molte operazioni di rendering. Nel gaming sono praticamente uguali, la differenza tra i due si percepisce a framerate elevati e risoluzioni basse, in giochi AAA magari in 4k sarete limitati dalla GPU nella maggior parte dei casi. In ogni caso, se si vuole assemblare un PC con un budget più alto del mio e magari abbinato ad una GPU più potente della mia 3060, potrebbe valerne la pena, anche solo per la presenza degli E-Cores.Comunque, ritengo che il 12400 sia lo sweet spot, da considerare per qualunque PC di fascia media, valutando eventualmente un upgrade tra qualche anno alla generazione 13xxx quando caleranno i prezzi.CONCLUSIONEChe dire, il 12400 è una CPU di tutto rispetto, ad un prezzo molto conveniente tra l\'altro. È eccellente in una build da gaming di fascia media, abbinato ad una GPU un po\' seria, e non fatica nemmeno nei programmi di grafica professionali (utilizzati a livello amatoriale o scolastico).Sicuramente non vi sto dicendo niente di nuovo, ma lo consiglio appieno per build di fascia media e budget contenuto.', 'Acquistato durante il Prime Day a 150€, questo processore porta sulle spalle 6 core e 12 thread che, anche se può sembrare scontato, è ormai diventato lo standard per giocare, non prendiamoci in giro. Anche se il clock di partenza è 2.5 GHz, sappiate che la scheda madre attiva il turbo boost e vi fa arrivare fino a 4.4GHz. Per quanto riguarda i consumi, in uso normale sta sotto i 60w (20-50w), nei giochi massimo mi ha registrato (poi dipende) un carico massimo di 90w. Sotto stress, 117w precisi, netti, come dichiarato da intel. Ora però passiamo al maledetto tasto dolente che perseguita da anni questi processori: il dissipatore. Io ho provato diversi dissipatori, e devo dire che si sono impegnati, anche se il sistema push-pin rimane macchinoso (non entra alla perfezione). Lo so, vi sembra strano, ma anche se non è perfettamente agganciato, copre ugualmente tutta la superficie dissipante, potete stare tranquilli. In-game, la massima temperatura che ho registrato (con temperatura ambiente di 35°C) è stata di 85°C. Poi quando avevo provato con temperatura ambiente di 25°C, la temperatura è scesa a 78°C! Sembrano valori alti, ma fidatevi che per un dissipatore stock fa il suo sporco lavoro. Per questo motivo do 4 stelle.AGGIORNAMENTO 3 agosto 2023Ho disattivo l’intel Turbo Boost e adesso, anche quando gioco, non sale mai sopra i 68°C, abbassando quindi di 10°C la temperatura. Anche se perdete quei 4,4GHZ, sappiate che è ugualmente performante e non avete problemi di stabilità. Quindi aggiorno la recensione a 5 stelleAGGIORNAMENTO FERRAGOSTO🔥Il dissipatore stock mi ha abbandonato, temperature schizzate a 100°C e poi va in protezione. A quanto pare deve essere montato perfettamente sennò non ce la fa. Dunque lo sostituisco con un tower. Sconsiglio di usare quello stock se non volete incappare in questi spiacevoli inconvenienti.
