Aggiorno a 4, nella speranza di non avere ulteriori problemi.', 'llevo casi dos meses probandolo y wow, les comento vengo de un i5 7400 y el cambio para este 12400f tengo que decir que es abismal y se nota demasiado sobre todo en multi tarea, uso dos monitores y muchas veces juego mientras escucho musica y incluso aveces hago streaming y la verdad no me ha fallado.la verdad pienso cambiarme en un futuro a algo de la 13gen ya que junte mas dinero jajaja pero la verdad es que con este para lo que lo ocupo hoy en dia es mas que suficienteSi es tambien el caso de ustedes y tienen ya una tarjeta de video como fue mi caso lo recomiendo ampliamente.', 'Cuando compre este producto, pense en algo que no pudiera retrasar a mi tarjeta de video y que ademas tuviera más potencia que el que antes tenia y despues de seis meses de uso puedo destacar lo siguienteJamas me ha dado un mal rendimientoSoporta una gran cantidad de programas abiertos, incluso juego con varias ventanas abiertas y no sacrifica el rendimiento por elloNo se sobrecalienta incluso con programas exigentesEn resumen, no es el tope de gamma, pero es lo suficientemente potente para realizar cualquier tarea relativamente exigente. (Cabe mencionar que la uso con una RTX 3060 y uso memoria SSD además de 16 de RAM)', "Le 12400f est un très bon processeur 6 cœurs et qui est très rapide si besoin (4GHz voire un peu plus) et offre des montées en puissances très intéressantes.Il se fatigue beaucoup moins puisqu'il s'adapte à l'utilisation, ce qui lui permet de beaucoup moins chauffer/consommer.Couplé à un bon ventirad et à sa patte thermique inclue, il est top et ne chauffe pas trop.", 'Buon processore anche per il gaming, non scalda eccessivamente e ha delle buone prestazioni! Il costo è adeguato alla tipologia di prodotto che stiamo acquistando, ha una qualità medio-alta quindi ci sta tutto.Consegnato con la sua scatola originale e nei tempi previsti da Amazon!', 'Super Prozessor! Lieferung erfolgte nach 1 Tag.In der Preisklasse der beste Prozessor den man sich zulegen kann, meiner Meinung nach. Benutze ihn bereits seit 9 Monaten und bin sehr zufrieden. Der beigelegte Kühler ist auch „okay“. Er kühlt der Prozessor ausreichend aber nicht unbedingt leise :DDa würde ich dann eher zu einem guten CPU-Kühler raten, kosten ja auch nicht viel', 'Les caractéristiques de ce processeur ne sont pas tout à fait ceux de la série des core i de 12eme génération. À vrai dire il est plus proche des core i5 de 10eme génération. On retrouve l\'hyperthreading comme sur les core i7 et i9 mais seulement des coeurs "traditionnels" pas d\'E-cores ni P-cores. Pour un prix dérisoire ce cpu fait tout à fait le travail pour du gaming. Associé à une RTX 3060 ti et 16go de RAM en DDR4 je suis très satisfait de mon achat et je vous le recommande.PS : Ce cpu vient avec un ventirad puisqu\'il n\'est pas "K".', 'Un processeur qui fait le job sans consommation excessive.', 'Price, performance, gaming?This CPU is beyond amazing, and then you see the price and holy moly it is a powerhouse at an unbelievable price.']

Product: Intel BX80684I79700KF Intel Core i7-9700KF Desktop Processor 8 Cores up to 4.9 GHz Turbo Unlocked without Processor Graphics LGA1151 300 Series 95W
Reviews: ['Not sure how it compares to Ryzen CPUs vis-à-vis price to performance ratio, but the i7-9700k is certainly a very capable chip nonetheless. It runs hot though, so do make sure you have adequate cooling.', 'Magnifico', 'Fonctionne encore sans problème en 2023', 'Passage d\'une configuration initiale : A Core I7 2700k , 16 Gigas de Ram vive à 1666 MHz , complété d\'un WD CAVIAR BLACK SERIES à 7200 tours/Min. sur Windows 7 64 bits . Le Core I7 de génération Sandy Bridge étant toujours fonctionnel et ce , même en "heavy load" , et ayant été overclocké à 4.5GHz , de façon très stable , sur une très longue durée , "in Game" .Premières impressions : Conditions :Procésseur refroidi sans watercolooling et par Ventirad NOCTUA : NH-U12S avec remplacement du ventilateur d\'origine de 120mm  en 1500 RPM , par un ventilateur industriel : A haut rendement en 3000 RPM ( Très silencieux en applications courantes et en idle ) . Aucune Chauffe .Ce Processeur 9700K , procésseur de dernière génération à 8 coeurs , et certes sans hyperthreading , apparaît en "Idle" et dans toutes les tâches courantes , et de prime abord  très rapide !!!Mais c\'est tout de même ,  au regard de son prix , ce que nous étions en droit d\'espérer .Point remarquable : Associé à un ventirad Noctua NH-U12S , dont le ventilateur de 120mm a été remplacé par un ventilateur capable d\'un débit en "AirFlow" de  186 mètres cubes/heure , (  NF-F12 iPPC-3000 PWM , Ventilateur pour refroidissement à haut rendement, 3000 tr./min. ). En tâche courante , et assisté de 32GB de DDR4 en 3000 MHz , le niveau sonore en décibels est très réduit . Autant dire que pour les taches courantes , si vôtre installation est stable , et que tout a été mis en place correctement , aucun soucis côté bruit .Le ventilateur Noctua effectue quant à lui le travail , avec une remarquable efficacité , laquelle est immédiatement perceptible .Aucune chauffe n\'a été constaté , dans un boitier correctement aéré .Tout celà demeure à confirmer en "heavy load" ... et "In Game" , en pleine session de travail ou de jeu ,mais les premières impressions sont en faveur de ce processeur , qui apparaît très réactif , et c\'est un air  TRES  frais !!! qui émane du boitier et non , un air sec et chaud .Le bond  et les avantages techniques entre un 4 coeurs même hyperthreadé et overclocké , apparaîssent ici immédiatement .Dans les tâches courantes , et à l\'heure actuelle technologique , s\'il est assisté d\'un SSD valable , de suffisamment de RAM , pour pousser celui-ci vers de hautes températures , il apparaît de suite qu\'il faudra lui envoyer un "workflow" de taille , et donc une quantité d\'informations conséquentes .En terme de bureautique classique , il semble peu nécessaire de se tourner vers ce genre de processeur .Points positifs :- Aucun problème de chauffe constaté . ( refroidissement à air ) , sans système de "Water-cooling" .- Prix en baisse à l\'heure de l\'écriture de ce commentaire .- 8 Coeurs vrais .- Le gain en terme de performances pures , comparativement à un 4 coeurs même largement overclocké .Points négatifs : Le prix , encore élevé .Bilan :Excellent Procésseur , surtout destiné aux applications exigentes , et au "Gaming" .PS: Prévoir une carte mère de génération compatible : A Chipset Z390 , ou bien en Chipset Z370 , lequel  nécessitera une mise à jour du Bios .BON JEUX !!! :-)))MISE A JOUR du commentaire : Confirmation !!!Aucune chauffe notable du Core I7 9700K , même en 4K "In Game" sans aucun Water-cooling , après plusieurs jours d\'utilisation .Comme indiqué un ventirad Noctua suffit , telle que la référence indiquée par exemple , avec le remplacement du ventilateur d\'origine limité à 1500 RPM ( Rotation Per Minute) , par un ventilateur capable de 3000 RPM toujours de chez Noctua convient . Aussi , et c\'est un peu la cerise sur le gâteau , niveau sonore , aucune mauvaise surprise constatée .', "A good Cpu, and a great choice if you are upgrading on a x370 or z390 motherboard. It does not come with a stock cooler, as the stock cpu cooler is inadequate for the I7I do NOT reccomend this purely for gaming, because the processor has 8 cores and 8 threads, which is overkill for most games, you would be better off buying an i5-9600kf which has 6 cores while still being overclock-able, it has no integrated graphics but, at a lower price.  You can invest thay money into something else, like a better graphics card or more SSD storage. make sure your system's performance is well balanced, won't be ideal to pair this with a GT 610 now...The cpu has a boost clock of 4.90 Ghz, and with some tweaking in the bios power settings you can improve its performance, go watch some YouTube videos on bios setting for this CPU.I brought it for a wide variety of applications where I required the extra cores, such as: gaming and streaming simultaneously, media creation, and rendering videos. I was able to render a 49 minute video at 1080p, 60fps, 12 Mbits bitrate, vbr 2 pass, under an hour while doing other things!Yes, it was constantly at 100% usage, but I was very surprised that it never peaked over 68°C, I only used a hyper 212 evo black, no water cooling, just 1 cpu fan.My cpu never hit its maximum tdp of 95 Watts though, so I am still leaving some performance on the table.At idle, my cpu draws about 8-20 Watts running discord, chrome, and a bunch of background applications.It is disappointing Intel disabled hyperthreadding for this cpu, therefore the cores and threads are the same number.The Cpu won't be a bottleneck during gameplay, it will be up to the rest of your system to do their part.While recording and streaming, you can easily do x264 encoding at medium preset in OBS, and still have enough performance for the game.I upgraded from an I3-8100, it was cheaper than getting ryzen as I would have needed another motherboard.Beware that your motherboard may not be able to supply enough power for this processor, if its relatively cheap, and is not reccomended for overclocking, it may damage the capacitors on the motherboard from too much current, be sure to look for reviews on your motherboard first to make an informed decision, its better not to risk destroying your motherboard and or other parts of your computer.Q: Do I need an unlocked Cpu?A: Most likely not! However overclocking is for squeezing out even more performance form the Cpu, so even if you aren't planning to get the best performance in the world, it's good to know that when your Cpu eventually becomes underpowered in the next few years, you can always overclock it a bit more to be able to match newer generations of hardware. But in the short term they do cost more money to buy.I do not believe making a new system with this cpu is a good Idea, as you won't be future proofing yourself. So either get a newer generation of cpu or just wait for Intel or amd to make a cpu that won't change its socket the next generation.But hey, it's YOUR system! Do as you please!", "It's a fine CPU, gets the job done for me. But there are way to many amazing CPU's on the market to go with an older CPU like this unless you're paying rock bottom prices.", 'Works for my application', 'Ich habe den Intel Core i7-9700K Prozessor für meinen Gaming-PC gekauft und bin absolut begeistert von seiner Leistungsfähigkeit! Mit seinen acht Kernen und einer Taktfrequenz von 3.6GHz bietet dieser Prozessor eine unglaubliche Geschwindigkeit, die selbst die anspruchsvollsten Spiele und Anwendungen ohne Verzögerungen ausführt.Ich war auch beeindruckt von der einfachen Installation des Prozessors. Die LGA1151-Sockelkompatibilität machte den Einbau in mein Mainboard zum Kinderspiel. Der Prozessor ist auch sehr leise und bleibt selbst bei hoher Auslastung angenehm kühl.Als Gaming-Enthusiast ist es für mich besonders wichtig, dass meine Spiele schnell und flüssig laufen. Der Intel Core i7-9700K Prozessor hat definitiv meine Erwartungen übertroffen und ich kann ihn jedem empfehlen, der nach einer leistungsstarken CPU für Gaming- oder andere anspruchsvolle Anwendungen sucht.Insgesamt bin ich sehr zufrieden mit dem Intel Core i7-9700K Prozessor und gebe ihm daher eine 5-Sterne-Bewertung.', "I bought this CPU to relieve the CPU bottleneck that my last processor was implementing on my new 3070 GPU. I'm giving 4 stars as it allows my GPU to run at 100% on most games at 1440p until I get to extremely heavy CPU games like Cyberpunk or Battlefield 2042. I had to stay 8th or 9th gen as its all my motherboard supports. this CPU is several years old now and it will not be future proof for me but it will certainly do for now. I bought the cheaper version that says like new! go for that one! its significantly cheaper and it was only used for 10 mins! and it came brand new looking!", 'massive improvement to my gaming experience.']

Product: Intel Intel CPU RPL-S CoreI5-13500 14/20 4.80GHz 6xx/7xxChipset
Reviews: ['El producto es el que se indica y se encuentra funcionando', "I just assembled a new computer using this processor on a Gigabyte B760 with DDR5 memory. The system came up without a hitch and the BIOS screen appeared very professional. I installed Ubuntu 22.04, the only thing I noticed was a hang when installing 22.04.1, so I had to initially select safe mode. I recommend using 22.04.3 (current) because it probably fixes that issue.With 20 cores total this processor is just a downgraded i5-13600k, I don't overclock anyways so it fits my needs. RAM and the sleep function work perfectly (I had trouble with the competitor's)", "The Intel Core i7-13700 is a beast of a processor. It's packed with features that make it a great choice for gamers, creative professionals, and anyone who wants the best possible performance.The i7-13700 has 12 cores and 20 threads and it's also clocked at 5.1 GHz, which is one of the highest clock speeds of any mainstream processor.In terms of performance, the i7-13700 is simply outstanding. It's the second fastest processor that Intel has ever released, and it's even faster than all of AMD's CPUs except the 7950x. In benchmarks, the i7-13700 consistently outperforms its predecessor, the i7-12700K, by a significant margin.Overall, the Intel Core i7-13700 is an excellent processor. It's the second best that Intel has to offer, and it's a great choice for anyone who wants the best possible performance.Here are some of the pros and cons of the Intel i7-13700:Pros:  12 cores for cheap  Blazing fast performance  Excellent multi-tasking capabilities  Best for gaming  New Raptor Lake architecture  Up to 5.1 GHz clock speedCons:  Not overclockableIf you're looking for a new processor, the i7-13700 is definitely one of the best CPUs you can buy", 'Bon produit', 'Me gustó, no me fijé mucho en los precios antes de comprar y pague casi lo mismo por él que lo que costaba el 13700k. Error mío que igual no quita que sigue siendo un excelente procesador.', 'This is the ideal choice for tight quarter ITX builds. It is easily cooled. I’m running it in the Fractal Ridge.', 'used item in very good shape, with very easy install and very good performance at a good price.  winner', 'AviUtlのx265で1080p動画のCPUエンコードに60fps出るのは驚きました。同じエンコード設定で他のPCと比較すると・・・Core 2 Quad Q8200は5fps (AVX命令がない時代なのでお察し)Celeon N4100は5fps (4コアAtom≒Core 2 Quadの法則)Ryzen 5 3500Uは7fps (Zen+のAVX256は内部的に128bit処理で激遅)Ryzen 5 Pro 3400GEは17fps (Zen+なのでお察し。体感Sandy Bridgeと同程度)Core i7 4770は20fps (Zen+より速いがHaswellなので時代遅れ感否めず)Ryzne 5 5500Uは25fps (型番詐欺のZen2、6コアだが2.5GHzしか出ない)Core i5 1135G7は30fps (AVX512対応で4コアの割に速い)Ryzen 7 Pro 5750GEは45fps (Zen3はAVX512非対応で8コアの割に遅い)intelはHaswell Refresh(第4世代)の頃からAVX命令が速くて動画変換に強いのと、アイドル時は700MHz程度まで落ち込む(Ryzenだとせいぜい1.4GHz程度)ので省電力性能も高いのが良いですね。ただし、電力リミットが全然働かないマザーボードだと冷却に苦労します。TDP65W向けのCPUクーラーではサーマルスロットリングで3.0GHz程度に落ち込みます。それでも上記の性能が出るので大したものです。立派なCPUクーラーを付けたら常時4.0GHz前後で動くのでしょうね。AtomからXeonまで幅広いCPUを作っているintelが得意とするP-Core(シングル性能特化)とE-Core(効率・マルチ性能重視)の異種混合CPUも2代目。製造プロセス(nm値)ではAMDやARMに遅れがちですが、やはりアーキテクチャ技術や命令セットではまだまだintelが優れているのかなと思います。Tiger Lake(11世代)以下から乗り換えれば性能倍増も夢ではないので、技術の進歩に驚くばかりです。内蔵GPUは実行ユニット数32個 (Tiger Lakeのi5 1135G7だと80個もある) なのでオマケ程度と割り切るべきでしょう。少しでもゲームをする気があるなら素直にビデオカード増設を。しかしビデオカードがなくてもモニタ出力できるのは便利です。最近はi5ですら円安で3.5万円もかかるから悩ましい。昔だったら同じ値段でi7が買えていたのに。。。最近は5000円程度の激安マザボもなくなり、安くて1.5万円はかかる時代なのでCPU+マザボだけで5万円コースに。。。それでもいい買い物をしたと思っています。', 'This is a GREAT little CPU. Super fasssssst with very low 65W TDP. Multiple cores handle video game processing with ease. Includes onboard video (if needed). Get yourself a good air cooler ( Thermalrite Assassin)  and check your mobo CPU Turbo settings for PL1 and PL2.  Start with 65W and 219W settings (per Intel). Even today, this CPU is commanding a bit of a premium price but it is still cheaper than the 13700K or KF versions.  This is kind of a sleeper in the 13th gen series. Buy it !', 'Muy satisfecho con lo rápido que es, me sorprende su capacidad para abrir aplicaciones y procesar datos, y todo en relación a su precio, es muy bueno']

Product: Intel Core i7-10700KF Desktop Processor 8 Cores up to 5.1 GHz Unlocked Without Processor Graphics LGA1200 (Intel 400 Series chipset) 125W
Reviews: ['Fast shipping, came just as described!', "I recently upgraded to the Intel Core i7-10700KF and I have to say, it's been an absolute game-changer! This processor is lightning fast and handles multiple applications with ease. As someone who enjoys playing games on their computer, I've been particularly impressed with the seamless gaming experience that this processor provides. The fact that it has 8 cores and 16 threads means that it can handle even the most demanding applications without breaking a sweat. I would highly recommend the Intel Core i7-10700KF to anyone looking for a high-performance processor that can handle everything from gaming to video editing with ease.", 'Todo bien!', "I build my own systems, and have now for about 20 years.  If you haven't yet, and are about to, welcome aboard what will be a very satisfying hobby/job.  The last two were Intel builds, my previous being an i7 4790. Yeah, seven years ago.  I had some money, and a wife who agreed the upgrade was necessary, and off we went.  So good to meet the UPS man at the door, or in the front yard for several days in a row.  Neighbors were jealous.  It was just as much as a blink of yer eye's worth of effort to install this CPU.  It really felt weighty and substantial in the figglers.  The build went off without a hitch, and she's running now.  Before, the Bluestacks launch would take  about 30 seconds to load. Now???? It's done in about 5.8 seconds!  That's fast!  I see the differences in speed on several fronts, and it's very nice to command.  Thank you, Intel, for another winner in the CPU dept.", 'It’s great keep in mind it has no igpu which I did start to miss after a while.', 'I got this processor in other computers and it’s fast and reliable so I bought another one for a new computer. No regrets.', "Leaving out all of the typical troubleshooting you would normally do with a custom build, the only real problem I had was windows selecting a balanced power profile automatically on startup after I got everything put together and running. The balanced power profile was causing the 10700kf to perform sporadically in my recording software (Studio One 5 Pro) and led to power throttling in the Intel extreme tuning utility. Deleting the balanced profile so that windows was forced to use high performance or extreme performance seemed to fix the issue. So far I haven't been able to overload the cpu in any applications. Overclocked to a solid 5.0ghz. Very happy with the performance I get out of this cpu.", "No iGPU, no video from motherboard. you'll need a graphics card for this, I use one anyway but I'd like that failsafe option. they got me with the (10 year warranty) deal, this was only $10 cheaper than getting the iGPU. lesson learned. still a great cpu, though", "Wish I would have done my research better before buying. The processor itself is fine but for the exact same price an i7 12700k can be had with 4 extra cores. I know those are not compatible with the same socket but as someone who had to buy a motherboard anyways I screwed myself. All in all its a good processor , I just wish I wouldn't have spent so much on it.", "Le processeur est bien celui que j'avais commandé, il était en effet neuf cependant très mal emballé, très mal protègé."]

Product: Intel Core i7-13700KF (Latest Gen) Gaming Desktop Processor 16 cores (8 P-cores + 8 E-cores) - Unlocked
Reviews: ["Researched it and found the marketing was a little funny for AMD. Found out 13th gen intel was beating all the new AMD CPUs in terms of gaming performance.Not old games that don't matter anymore, the Next-gen games. Anytime a brand new game comes out that has alot of hype, intel seems to deliver the best performance. You're better off waiting for intel 14th gen, which is about to be announced this Fall. However, this 13700KF is a beast and will give you near the best gaming performance you can get right now, paired with a 4090.", 'Processador de ótima qualidade, velocidade,etc.Superou expectativas!', 'llevo un par de meses con el y no me ha dado ningun fallo para videojuegos y programacion', 'This CPU runs HOT. Im upgrading from an i7-9700k and this beast is definitely more difficult to cool. Saving up for a new cooler and fans but I have to undervolt in the meanwhile. Great product though very strong and fast!', 'heavily dependent on motherboard settings, but this is enough power paired with a high end gpu to bring star citizen on its latest patch 3.19.1 as of this writing above 55 fps at 2160p on a 55 inch tv display.  I mention that game because for me, if i can run it stable, with a good amount of FPS, current patch performance issues not considered its what I wanted.my numero uno tip for you is - if you are getting HOT temps ... like 85C or close to that while gaming? you want to go turn off Intel adaptive boost technology in your bios.  research your board and see if you can undervolt. the intel fail safes that asus has setup on my board put voltage at 1.4+. using the asus typical setting its more like 1.2 or 1.3.  much cooler. and stable. also asus had long term load at the same wattage as short term. switched that back to intel spec and ... yeah its not as bad of an oven now.then look into improving your cooling.be nice if it was like not 100 bucks over the 13600 however.', "Exactly as described, could have had better packaging for 400$ thoughI said it could use better packaging because it was in a small box with 1 air bag, what's that gonna do?? I work at ups and I know how people treat packages", 'Great CPU! It is sooo fast on my EVGA Classified MB & it installed very easily.', 'Pas de problème pour moi....', "This is the cream of the crop if you going for Intel CPU's. High Clocks, good IPC and stability. There's no secrets on Intel processors it is just plug and play, on AMD side you have to worry about other factors like memory compatibility.It could be cheaper. I think $500 is somewhat steep, but this is the present reality so we have to endure and hope it gets better in the future.", "I don't really go in for testing myself. All I know is it works perfectly from the first start up and continues to do so. No lag and no problems so far."]

Product: Intel Core i5 Core 12400F Desktop Processor 18M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz
Reviews: ['Actualice mi PC recientemente y decidí no colocar el disipador de stock por uno de torre que ya tenía, fuera de eso mi equipo ha trabajado muy bien', 'excelente producto, llego muy rapido y bien empaquetado, funcionando al cien', 'Funciona 10/10', "I don't see how anyone can hate on this processor. Great performance for $160. I have the i3-12100F as well and love it. There is excellent value in the Alder Lake generation.", 'Great Comms from seller. Got a tracking number on same day of order and delivered next day. Well protected packaging. Would definitely use this seller again. Product exactly as described.', 'Fácil de instalar, muy potente, de buen rendimiento, se recomienda', 'went from a 3470, to a 10100f, to an 11600kf due to the motherboard being cheap and good, and now since I’m going from mid atx to mini itx I decided to just get a different socket based cpu, even though they’re both 6 core processors and both won’t have much different performance I still think there’s more cache on the 12400f.', 'Este es un gran procesador que cumple con las 3b, bueno bonito y barato, funciona excelente con una 3060ti.', 'good product from intel as always', "Bought the CPU for my MSI motherboard. It is awesome for gaming has smooth performance. Doesn't have overload problems. Runs cool with the original fan. Got it when it was on sale. I totally recommend this processor. Totally recommend this product"]

Product: AMD Ryzen™ 5 4600G, 6-Core, 12-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor with Wraith Stealth Cooler
Reviews: ['Not for games, but daily use', 'Runs great and cool even with stock cooler. Unable to tune in Ryzen Master. Not sure if mobo issue or this CPU is locked.', 'Best', "My targeted use for the AMD 4600g was for a MiniITX based HTPC. For $99 this guy is a beast and was easily one of the best CPUs in this range. Anything cheaper saw sharp reductions in performance. I also paired him with a fairly quality $99 mITX board from gigabyte and the system is overkill for what I needed it for.In 2022 the Intel i3 12100 (The later 13100 is more or less the same in performance and price) really tried to move in on the 4600g's spot. Now in 2023 the price difference is only around $15 and the intel does give a little better cpu performance, but if you were also interested in the gaming performance of the built in iGPU you will find the Vega7 graphics are a bit better. Not only in performance but also at the driver level, the AMD will offer significantly less bugs over intel. If you are looking to pair up with an external graphics card however the intel is probably better.The cost of a MiniITX for the intel will also add an additional $15 at least  (And this may go up, I found when I wanted to use some older intel processors in mITX builds the motherboards were all oldstock and significantly marked up). So the final build should you go with AMD should be cheaper, too.", "Partiamo dal presupposto che stiamo parlando di un processore di fascia medio-bassa pensato per configurazioni da ufficio, media center o gaming economicheLe qualità principali di questo processore a mio parere sono le seguenti:- Ha un adeguato numero di core/thread (6/12) in grado di supportare carichi di lavoro moderati;- Ha una GPU integrata (Radeon Vega 7) di tutto rispetto per le aree di utilizzo che ho indicato (in gaming è in grado di offrire un adeguato framerate a 1080p con livello di dettaglio medio) che vi consentirà di realizzare delle build senza una scheda grafica dedicata ma comunque rispettabili;- Ha un prezzo ottimo in rapporto a ciò che offre;- Appartenendo ad una famiglia di CPU di precedente generazione può essere montata su architetture AM4 con memorie DDR4 attualmente a prezzi decisamente più bassi delle più nuove AM5/DDR5 o simili della controparte (Intel)Io personalmente ho acquistato questa APU per realizzare un piccolo media center che tengo in soggiorno  del quale sono molto soddisfatto (Asus PRIME A320I-K, 2x16GB Corsair LPX 3600 CL18, Silicon Power A80 512GB NVME, Thermalright AXP120-X67, Case SilverStone SST-SG13B-Q, SilverStone SST-ST30SF 300W)Per l'utilizzo che ne faccio veramente un ottimo acquisto!!!!", "Processeur reçu dans sa boîte d'origine, avec ventirad inclus (c'est pas clairement indiqué, du coup, ce commentaire peut aider ^^). Il est très performant et complètement à l'aise dans les tâches quotidiennes mais également dans la retouche de photos, l'infographie, la bureautique ... et YouTube en 4K.Ce modèle possède une partie graphique Radeon Vega 7 très performante qui permet de faire tourner quelques jeux en faisant des compromis sur la qualité et la résolution.Le ventilateur est silencieux dans les tâches quotidiennes et se montre un peu plus bruyant sans que ça ne soit excessif quand on sollicite la partie graphique.Bref, c'est un chouette compromis si on ne veut pas trop investir (dans mon cas, c'était une machine d'appoint pour soulager ma machine principale).", 'Levou duas semanas para chegar, veio antes da data prevista (21 de set - 5 de out). Casou muito bem com a minha placa mãe e a minhas duas memórias 2x8. Não são todos os jogos que ele vai rodar com os gráficos no talo, mas pra quem saiu de um notebook que travava só de abrir o Google, esse daí tá mais do que perfeito.Esse é o meu primeiro pc, tô amando a experiência.', "I was waiting for a 6core CPU with this performance profile under $100. This is it. If you must this thing runs the latest games just fine. I got it for a server, though. While I'd love to limit it to 35W if you need compute it goes up to 65 (80 system power). But it masters it all. Perfect home server CPU if you want some grunt.", 'Comprato per fare upgrade del mio vecchio Ryzen 5 1500x sulla mia Motherboard Gigabyte GA-AB350 Gaming v1.0 . Nonostante il produttore la desse pienamente compatibile già da 3 aggiornamenti del Bios a questa parte ( aggiornata all\'ultima versione), dopo avere montato questo processore in fase di boot del sistema operativo appare segnale video non presente appena si alza la risoluzione del monitor. Anche provando a fare una installazione pulita di Windows, in fase di installazione appena il sistema chiede più risorse a metà installazione scompare il segnale video ( sia sfruttando la grafica interna del processore, sia con scheda video a parte). Dopo qualche giorno di prove ho risolto disabilitando da bios "c-state" del processore e dato che il mio alimentatore aveva un connettore EPS 12v a 4 pin ho risolto con un adattatore da 4 a 8 pin. Da quanto ho scoperto indagando su internet tutte le Motherboard Gigabyte chipset B350 soffrono di questo tipo di problemi con le APU Amd con grafica integrata.', "Used this with ASRock A520M-ITX/ac.Ran without BIOS update.Build also uses SSD and RX 7600.Stealth cooler is very quiet under gaming load, no heat issues, haven't tried overclocking or CPU stress tests.Stuttering does happen but it's very rare, and not caused by heat / throttling.Overall, for the price, it does the job well."]

Product: Cooler Master Out-of-The Box Kits for LGA 1700 and Intel Alder Lake Processors Hyper 212 Black Editon, Hyper 212 Black Editon RGB
Reviews: ['Good', "Bought this so I could re-use my old 212 on my latest upgrade to 13th Gen.  Bought from Amazon USA and was delivered to UK in less than 2 weeks.  Expensive for a bit of plastic and some metal, but worth it, as I've been able to re-use a perfectly good coller worth £50 or so.", 'Fits good and easy installation', 'I bought this so I could use a slightly dated cooler in a new build. It worked.', 'Este producto me ayudó a adaptar mi ventilador de 8° generación y ahora funciona de maravilla', 'Not much to it just being an adapter bracket, works well, my 212 Evo is seated pretty securely and no issues with contact with the CPU, adapter does the job.', 'I really wish that these were included in the box for the CPU coolers. The new LGA 1700 CPU’s have been around for 2 years and they are still not included in the box with some CPU coolers which is very frustrating. While it does work very well I shouldn’t have to pay an extra $20 or even $10 from CoolerMaster themselves on top of what I paid for the cooler in order to be able to use this with the new Intel CPU’s.', "I intended to install a liquid cooler from a AM4 prebuilt to a LGA1200 socket. Unfortunately the prebuilt doesn't come with the brackets and I had to buy this. It does have the LGA1200 notch on the mount but you still need to have a LGA1200 backplate. It is just a generic one so you can get it from anywhere. However the problem is that the spacer isn't the correct height. I had to do some DIY to mount the cooler.", 'This sumgun popped right in! Nice fit worked perfectly for what I needed! \U0001faf6🏼', 'I am trying to get an LGA1700 kit for an MA612. I ordered what was supposed to be the mounting kit, I was sent a kit that is not compatible. Cooler Master is a terrible company, I do not recommend ordering any of their equipment.Update: After performing a TON of research (3+ hours with a background of >7 years of experience as the lead tech at a PC repair place) I discovered that Cooler Master made a second revision of my cooler as a silent "upgrade" with different mounting hardware, then released all of the flanker models of the MA612 (Stealth, 624) with this same mounting hardware. I have the Ver.1 mounting hardware on it\'s way in tomorrow, based on my visual assessment comparing the manual, the cooler. the hardware as shown etc, it appears to be correct.']

Product: AMD Ryzen 9 5950X 16-core, 32-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor
Reviews: ['Delivery late for one day from expected date but acceptable cause The package arrived nicely no dense on boxes and handling to me right at my door step. The chips is great. Powerful make my computer works great with any heavy task I have to deal with.', 'Threadripper performance in AM4 socket.Tower air cooling works with this chip. With fuma 2, all core stock 100% at 70C while gaming at 75C. Max spike to 85C.', 'just buy it from amazon msrp, ignore all third parties scalpers. manaul overclock to 4.5ghz 16 cores 32 threads, faster than my old us$2000 7980xe', 'Box came slightly dented but processor is in working condition.', "I bought 2 5950x processors at the same time, from the same vendor. Tested and benchmarked both upon arrival, both were working well. Never overclocked either besides PBO. They were both for identical work machines in my company. One of them failed little by little until dying completely - symptoms were boot loops, crashing quickly after booting, crashing while reinstalling windows, and finally not working at all. I thought it was the motherboard, it wasn't. I swapped the 5950x processor from the other machine into the dead one and immediately it booted and worked normally. So roll the dice and see if you get a good one I guess, but if you need the machine to work reliably, I would not recommend this processor.", "The 5950X processor is a beast. It annihilates everything I throw at it. The only downside to this chip is the cost, but that said, it's totally worth stretching to if possible as it'll be quite some time before another upgrade is needed and the performance it delivers is simply lovely. Even the intensive apps I use are smooth as butter and it provides the processing power to support the latest games. A powerful CPU like this will easily provide the speed to support the latest games and help the latest graphics cards reach their potential. Pairing a 4 series RTX GPU for example, with an older/slower processor, will cause bottlenecks, limiting the potential of both. With a 5950X, that simply isn't an issue, it's fantastic.So yeah, pricey, but you get an awful lot for the money. I love this chip.", 'Montei hoje meu PC com esse Ryzen 9. Eu tinha um pczinho com um AMD A10-7800 só com 4 threads. Esse aqui foi como sair de um fusca e entrar numa Ferrari. 105 TDP parece gastador, mas se você for analisar, são 32 "funcionários" trabalhando consumindo só 105 watts. Um proc. mais "econômico" gastaria o mesmo tanto só com 16 "funcionários" (threads) ou até menos. Resumindo: Ryzen 9 vale a pena! Nota 11.', "Bought it for  $439.46 The listed price was $899.00. What a steal! pretty much getting two Ryzen 7 5800x in one.Get it while it's available. Blast through apps and games with lightning speed.It's a HOT product. Use quality air cooling or AIO water cooling at the least. CPU idle 39c/gaming 55c GPU idle 38c/gaming 54ceverything is Gucci from here.update: forgot to put in my computer build;Windows 11 proMotherboard Gigabyte  AX370-Gaming K5-CF Bios F51h Checksum: 903D AMD Agesa V2 1.2.0,8Ram TeamGroup T-Force DDR4 32GB (2x16GB) 3200Mhz CL16SSD NVMe PCIe 4.0 Fanxiang S880 4TB READ 7300mb/s Write 6800mb/s TBW 2800PSU Cooler Master 1000wGraphics XFX Merc AMD 6750xtCPU AMD 5950x 16 core 32 threadCPU Cooler Master AIO  MasterLiquid LITE 240Thermal Paste GC Electronics 10-8109 Heat Sink SiliconePhanteks (PH-ES518XTG_DBK01) Enthoo Evolv X ATX Case Tempered Glass Windows Digital RGB Black", 'I got this to replace my 5800x since it mostly for video encoding. Double the power, double cores, twise performance. After run it for nearly 24/7 at 90% average I can say this is a battle horse. You need to pair it with a video card since this is a non-video version. Since I use CPU and not gpu for the encoding process, along my gtx 1650 is more than enough to meet my requirements. Pair it with water cooling for better temps. There is no way an air system can keep this babe cool enough at that workload.', 'Produto chegou rápido e desempenho incrível por é preciso um sistema de cooler bom para segurar a temperatura do processador.']

Product: AMD Ryzen 9 3950X Desktop Processor, Black, X-Large
Reviews: ['XMRig, nicehash_randomxmonero, 13.9-14.01kH/s, 120.9-122.3wH 👍🏻', 'If you are going to use the CPU for post-production work then this a great CPU for you. If you just need a CPU for gaming you better choose AMD 3600 will do. Most of the cores will not be utilised for gaming. Temperature of my CPU always hover between 50-70. So make sure you have great cooling mechanism in place.', 'Não serve apenas para jogos, mas principalmente para trabalhos que exigem um bom processador que consiga atender recursos pesados de multitarefas sem sacrificar performance. Uso Linux e atualizo o sistema, consigo programar e compilar tudo ao mesmo tempo. E de uma maneira que nem sinto o computador ficar lento em nenhum momento. Com certeza vai durar uns 10 anos no mínimo agora para eu atualizar o hardware do meu PC.', "TL;DR at the endBought this CPU as an upgrade from my Ryzen 1700. I have a decent x370 motherboard (GIGABYTE Gaming 5), so I was wary about whether or not I should upgrade my motherboard as well; however, after making sure I was on the right bios version to support 3rd gen ryzen, I plopped this bad boy in and was immediately blown away. Gone are the days of CPU bottleneck for my 1080ti. Gone are the days of non-GPU accelerated video rendering and audio exporting. It for sure doubled my speed even with my 1700 overclocked to 3.8 GHz, and there's still more I can get out of it if I were to upgrade my mobo to an x570 board. Nonetheless, this chip is amazing. It's a bit pricey, but I feel like I'll be using this baby for much longer than I used my 1700. The ability to use my old hardware is a HUGE plus.The only con (minor) I noticed was it runs a bit hotter than my 1700, as expected, but it required some cooler tweaking to not have my PC sound like a jet engine 24/7. For context, I am using a corsair h100i v2 AIO cooler. At idle, the chip is between 45-50 ⁰C. It sits around 50⁰C when browsing YouTube and such. During 1080p gaming, games like AC Odyssey (max settings) were pushing it to 64⁰C max in a roughly 22⁰C atmosphere. Because the curves on the corsair link software settings were not set to handle water temps that the chip was producing, the fans were pushing 75% usage at just idle (default fans have 2400ish RPM limit). I had to spend a good hour or so and then some more time during gaming to customize and tweak the fan curve settings. It paid off because now my PC as quiet as possible while having stable temps for both the water and the CPU. I'd also recommend using Ryzen Master to check temps ad 3rd party software, at the moment, aren't reporting correct cpu temps (they show the temps as roughly 5-7⁰ hotter with more usage spikes)TL;DR:- If you invested in a good x370 board (~$180+) for the ryzen 1000 series, this CPU is a very good overall upgrade if you have the money to fork over for it. If not, the 3900x is also a great option (or any of the 3000 CPUs, honestly).- Make sure your cooler can handle the temps and the mobo vrm can deliver enough voltage (most x370s can).- Be prepared to modify settings for your cooling solution as the chip runs hotter than ryzen 1000 CPUs.", "First off, yes, this CPU was very hard to get.  No time announced for when it would go on sale, broken search linking preventing the product page from being found without knowing exactly what to search for, and finally when the listing did go live it said you couldn't order it unless you went to the list of sellers and specifically selected Amazon.  Very strange.  To make matters worse, the product page only showed the minimal info on launch day so there was no way of knowing if Amazon was going to offer the game bundle or not.  Then when they got around to updating the page with the missing info, they added the info direct from AMD implying the game bundle was included.  Well, guess what, it's not.  I opened a ticket with Amazon support about it and was told they received no game bundle codes from AMD and I should go ask them about it.  Um, yeah, sure.  And the FAQ on the AMD rewards site specifically says it's on the retailers to distribute the codes.  So I and the others who managed to score one of these on launch day are out of luck there.  I'm tempted to deduct a star for that but I don't want to take anything away from the CPU itself.Alright, enough complaints about the low stock, strange order process, and misleading game bundle info.  The good news is this CPU is every bit as good as the reviews say it is.  So far after a solid day of testing I can say it's a crazy fast compute monster that runs cool, stable, and relatively quiet on my MSI MEG X570 Unify motherboard with a Noctua NH-D15 air cooler and 64GB (2x32GB) of Corsair Vengeance LPX DDR4 3200 C16 memory (CMK64GX4M2E3200C16) overclocked to 3600-18-22-22-42.  The other important bits in my system build are a Phanteks Enthoo Luxe case, Seasonic FOCUS GX-850 (SSR-850FX) 80+ Gold power supply, EVGA GeForce RTX 2080 (08G-P4-2081-KR) video card, and 1TB Samsung SM961 NVMe SSD running Win10 Pro 1909.  You can safely ignore AMD's water cooling recommendation as long as you get a good air cooler and ensure good air flow in your case.  Power consumption is amazingly low for such a powerful CPU.  Sure, it's going to pull more total power than low and most mid-range CPUs but this is still an extremely efficient processor.  Gaming performance is excellent.  Maybe not quite as good as Intel's best gaming CPUs but close enough provided you don't game for a living.  On the other hand, this thing rules the roost in video encoding.  It's amazing.  I do a mix of both so this CPU is the perfect balance for me.", 'Pues llego en tiempo y forma, como siempre amazon México con un servicio excelente, el procesador venía en una bolsa sin ninguna indicación de que es frágil afortunadamente el empaque del cpu es resistente, es un delite el solo hecho de tener la caja y verlo.Después de 3 días de empezar a usarlo es increíble tener tanto poder en un espacio tan pequeño, en si el cpu es pesado a comparación con el 1800x (el cual estoy actualizando), la mobo al que se lo instale es una crosshair vi hero x370, y va de maravilla, tenia mis dudas por el tema de la potencia pero al activar el precision boost overdrive, puedes darte cuenta que la placa esta sobrada en potencia, El oc máximo que se ha intentado es de 4.4 a 1.35v con una compensación a 1.41v a una temperatura máxima de 84°c la puntacion en CBR20 fue de 10,100 impresionante subir de 9,049 en stock mas de 1000 puntos, todo esto refrigerado por un kraken x72 en una configuración de 6 ventiladores noctua a 3000rpm (push and pull), en cuanto a ram se refiere son unas trident z a 3000mhz que perfectamente son estables con un oc a 3600mhz con 1.35v, afortunadamente aun son chip samsung B-die, eso ayuda bastante.Cabe hacer mención que después de varias pruebas el voltaje puede bajarse aun mas, ya que lo permite,con lo que se podría pulir un poco el tema del calentamiento, o al contrario intentar subir la frecuencia pero sinceramente no veo necesario hacerlo ya que con el hecho de poner las ram a 3600mhz, y activar precision boost overdrive, se logra un buen incremento en el rendimiento claro no comparado con un oc manual pero se podría decir que es una media,  logrando 9,590 en CBR20 a una temperatura de 73°c,  en procesos cotidianos con este cpu considero es lo mas adecuado, ya que si se tiene un sistema de water cooling costum valdría la pena el oc manual a mi consideración todo depende de los parámetros.En conclusión es un cpu monstruoso por el precio que tiene y comparado con mi antiguo 1800x y un olvidado 1920x es un cambio bastante radical, ya que se acaba de juntar en un solo equipo lo mejor de dos mundos gaming y workstation.', "Salve a tutti dal buon Snake questo è XREVIEWS recensioni genuine per Amazon!Ho deciso di cambiare PC e vi do un'idea di una configurazione TOP-END che ho buildato sopra questa CPU:CPU RYZEN 9 3950X - 801,00 €AIO Kraken X73 - 174,00 €MOBO Gigabyte X570 AORUS XTREME - Warehouse Deal 545,00 €ALI Corsair Psu Hx1200I Platinum - Warehouse Deal 238,00 €SSD 2 x Sabrent SSD 1TB Rocket Nvme PCIe 4.0 M.2  488,00 €RAM 2 x G.Skill - Kit DIMM 32 GB DDR4-3600 F4-3600C16D-32GTZNC, Trident Z 427,00 €Avevo nel mio vecchio i7 7700k (che poi tanto vecchio non e') una GeForce 1080Ti e ho deciso di continuare con quella fino ad almeno la prossiama generazione.Che dire di questa CPU? Fantastica!Mi permette di avere 3/4 macchine virtuali aperte contemporaneamente, una per lo sviluppo web/app, una per video/photo editing ed numerosi container docker. Beh si, una CPU del genere ha come primo consumer qualcuno che utilizza macchine virtuali a gogo altrimenti ha poco senso l'acquisto.La differenza rispetto all'i7 si nota poco nell'utilizzo quotidiano del PC ma si nota moltissimo quando le macchine virtuali sono in esecuzione, nell'i7 facevo girare tutto su windows main, in questo PC ho deciso di tenere separate le cose per lasciarmi la possibilità di avere il sistema operativo main pulito per fare Gaming.Riempirlo di programmi inutili e servizi in background in passato e' risultato controproducente e quindi tutto quello che e' potenzialmente rischioso da utilizzare sul sistema principale lo faccio girare su una macchina virtuale con Hyper-V.Le prestazioni sono pazzesche ma l'i7 si difende ancora molto bene nonostante gli anni. Le temperature sono piu basse dell'i7 che aveva il problema del delid da fare e che io non ho mai fatto, quindi anche la stanza in cui e' presente il PC ne giova di freschezza!Consigliato per chi ha tanta roba da far girare e chi fa video editing.", "Preso questa cpu poche settimane fa, passando da un AMD 1700.. che dire, la differenza è abissale. Il numero di thread la fa una cpu ideale per pesanti carichi di lavoro, per app professionali, editing foto/video, creatori, eccellendo anche  in gaming; anzi, visto sempre il maggior supporto per multithread è chiaro qual è il futuro anche del gaming, quindi anche in questo senso è un acquisto assolutamente azzeccato e lungimirante.Ideale il fatto che si possa fare upgrade anche da motherboards economiche volendo su AM4, io per esempio ho una Asrock AB350M pro 4, e la cpu (senza overclock, che comunque non mi interessa, dato anche l'incremento di consumi notevole che si ha con overclock pesanti su queste cpu) va a meraviglia; AMD consiglia impianti a liquido, ma se non si fa overclock basta anche un dissipatore ad aria adeguatamente dimensionato  (ho preso un dissipatore di arctic cooling da 30 euro che fa benissimo il suo lavoro, in perfetta silenziosità).Un'accortezza può essere quella di abbinargli memorie almeno da 3200 mhz con timings tirati, oppure di frequenza più elevata, ma se ciò non fosse possibile sicuramente le prestazioni saranno ugualmente sorprendenti.Inizialmente ero indeciso se prendere questo o il 3900x, ma poi visti i cores in più ad un prezzo che non è molto più alto ed il tdp accettabile raccomando il 3950x per pc desktop di fascia alta che secondo me è la scelta migliore.Certo più di questo c'è il 3990x, con ben 64 cores e 128 threads, ma lì si parla di un socket diverso, solo mb ATX disponibili e costi non alla portata di tutti (anche se comunque in linea come rapporto prezzo/prestazioni!), quindi cpu come il 3990x rimangono appannaggio di professionisti molto esigenti o aziende.. oppure enthusiasts!Dopo anni di stagnazione nel mondo delle cpu AMD è tornata in campo alla grande ed ha dettato qual è il nuovo standard delle prestazioni per cpu", "The best binned chips from the AMD Ryzen 3000 series for desktop users. CPU Temperature control is sensitive as Tdie reports the highest temperature of hottest core out the 16. If the cores are not at around 60*C then they are not boosting to their highest boost frequency. It is important to get good thermal paste like MX-4, PK-3 or NH-H2 to dissipate the heat quickly. I used PK-3 and very please with it. If you set the cores frequency by the CCX you can get a massive 10% boost for multithreaded work. 4.20Ghz is good if your work desires it. 4.35Gz you can reach to 10,000 on Cinebench R20 but CPU Temp jumps to 105*C! yikes. Try to keep workload temps below 80*C which 4.25GHz was ok when using it with the Arctic freezer ii 280 and PK-3 thermal paste. Idle temps are 35-40*C with cores @4.25ghz.The CPU can work with basic potato rosewell thermal paste and a non-PWM cpu cooler but idle temps are at 50*C and boosting is out of the picture when cores jump by 20*C because the thermal paste isn't fast enough to dissipate the heat. Your cores will drop to 2GHz if your cooler can not keep up with 16 core heat! AMD BIOS CPU configuration has an option for eco mode in 45w, 65w, and 90w  . The temps only slightly improved with eco-modes, mimicked the same workloads when the cores are thermal throttled.UsingMSI x570 ACE motherboard128GB of Oloy RAM from newegg. If you have memtestx86 errors show up then up the ddr4 voltage by 0.02. Make sure not to pass 1.4v for DDR4 for 24/7 use. Currently around 1.38v with XMP enabled.Please refer to GamerNexus for more CPU and MEM settings on youtube.Have fun rendering and compiling with your High-tier gaming, Mid-tier workstation!", "Bien mais trop cher de l'acheter quand il sort"]

Product: Intel BX80684I99900KF Intel Core i9-9900KF Desktop Processor 8 Cores up to 5.0 GHz Turbo Unlocked Without Processor Graphics LGA1151 300 Series 95W
Reviews:
['It’s a fake product. It’s NOT intel original CPU. Please take care of scams!', 'Bra processor för schyst pris', 'El procesador llegó en buenas condiciones, tal y como está en la descripción, les recomiendo al vendedor sin duda alguna 👍🏻', "Great performance. Great value for the price.Didn't come with original box which tells me it was probably a return?", "The media could not be loaded.
                



\xa0What more can someone say that's not already been stated. It's expensive, yes. But if one can fit this processor into their budget, the return on investment will NOT be disappointing.Installation was very easy, I decided to go with the stock thermal paste that was pre-installed on the AIO Corsair cooler. See specs below. I was able to assemble my new build which took about 3 hours. The wiring/cabling was NOT a breeze. PC Case was a bit tight but everything did install.  Mainly I was overly cautious but Win10 installed in under 15 minutes to a desktop. Fast!!Temps have been very low, ranging from the low 30s to barely above 50 degrees Celsius even in gaming. I have read comments this proc can sometimes spike hot, but my experience is this build is easily the coolest running PC thus far. I am NOT overclocked as yet, have had the build running for about 2 weeks now. Going to wait on that so can't comment but I know this beast is built for overclock potential. My default clocks on all cores seems to peak at 4700Ghz and I am thus far happy with that for now. Esp. From where I am upgrading previous, a 5 year old mid-range gaming PC.I have had zero issues and definitely notice my FPS in games is up. The only game I am running now is Black Desert Online, most will likely not have heard of this, a 3 year old game that is brutal demanding on hardware with graphics settings maxed out. My old rig pushed 10 to maybe 32 FPS if lucky. Yes I am using a 4K 27 inch monitor. I do need a better graphics card for 4K, you will also if ever considering moving to 4K. It's NOT an easy move if you don't account for graphics power. I have had about 3 years of laggy stuttery gaming (frequently but not all the time) so if considering 4K gaming, do NOT go with low budget graphics builds. You WILL regret it.But my FPS jumped up to 40 to 60 fps. All new components except the Video card and monitor are from my old build.Multitasking is a breeze, everything noticeably responsive and opens quickly. This Proc won't dissapoint. If you can afford it. After my last build in 2014 where I skimped on the processor (core i5 4790K) due to limited funds, I decided to throw as much as I could into the heart of the system and I am very happy I did!Fractal Design Meshify C White CaseGigabyte Z390 AORUS PRO WiFi  Intel LGA1151/Z390/ATX/2xM.2 Intel Core i9-9900KF Desktop Processor 8 Cores up to 5.0 GHz Turbo Unlocked Without Processor GraphicsXPG GAMMIX 1TB S11 Pro 3D NAND PCIe NVMe Gen3x4 M.2 2280 SSD  Ultra-Fast PCIe NVMe Gen3x4 Interface Read/Write up to 3500/3000MB/sCORSAIR H115i RGB PLATINUM AIO Liquid CPU Cooler 280mmCORSAIR VENGEANCE RGB PRO 16GB (2x8GB) DDR4 3000MHz C15 LED Desktop MemoryEVGA GeForce GTX 1080 GAMING ACX 3.0, 8GB GDDR5X, LED, Graphics CardEVGA SuperNOVA 650 G3, 80 Plus Gold 650W, Fully ModularMicrosoft Windows 10 ProLG 27-UD88-W 4K MonitorThermaltake Pure Plus 12 RGB TT Premium Edition 120mm Software Enabled Circular 9 Controllable LEDs PWM Case/Radiator Fan - Triple Pack", "voici un retour d’expérience sur ce i9900 KF que je test depuis plusieurs semainesEt comme toutes critiques et avis sur ce fabuleux proc est à mettre en corrélation avec la config utilisée,  besoins et usages , à vous d'en tirer des conclusions...Tout le monde s'accorde à dire que c'est un monstre de puissance, je le confirme !qu'il chauffe bcp - Je confirme,  et,  comparativement à mon ancienne config , un i5 4770k.. on peux dire que je m'attendait un peu naïvement à y faire face.Grosso merdo, les températures sont très correct en usage bureautique , et comme les chiffres parlent mieux que moi,à l'heure ou j'écris ces quelques lignes :temp proc =  40°temp ambiante intérieur 25° (été)carte mère ITX sur boitier moyen tour phénom bitfenix capot latéral ouvertradiateur 100% cuivre + ventilateur 95 mm à 65 % (donc encore silencieux à cette vitesse)1 ventilateur à l' avant pour  l'air frais +  1 ventilateur 12 cm  arrière pour extraire l'air chaudPâtes thermique conductonaut (grosse galère à étaler mais fait gagner 10° comparativement aux autres)Ça se complique avec des applications lourdes , jeux etc..IN game je ne descend pas (en été)  en dessous de 72 ° avec des pointes à 87 ° - ventilateurs à 100% (donc pc bruyant)Pour calmer la bête j'ai stabiliser le ratio du proc à 45X100 pour éviter les fluctuations jusqu'à 5ghz , et je peux downgrader d'avantage , ce qui m'éviterais surement une surchauffe excessive  en utilisation massive.(et en été)Possibilité de réduire le vcore du proc , mais je n'ai pas testé cette option qui pourrait me faire gagner de précieux degrés sans perdre en stabilité à fréquence raisonnable.Je reste donc positif (sur l'aspect chauffe) et je continue à chercher des possibilités sans passer par un watercoolingdont l'efficacité reste à prouver par rapport à un air-cooling haut de gamme dont je me passe aussi pour le moment.Donc,  tout va bien et j'ai encore à apprendre pour maîtriser la bête sans partir sur un grand tour équipé de18 ventillos ,+ azote liquide.", 'Reçu le lendemain conforme à la commande produit neuf avec étiquette sécurité. Emballage un peut lège mais arrivé nickel.Version I9 9900 Kf donc version sans puce graphique. _8 cœurs et 16 threads. 299€MatérielMSI - MPG Z 390 Gaming Edge ACCRUCIAL - Ballistix - 32 go 4X8 @3200 cl 16MSI - RTX 3070 8GO SUPRIM XWD - SN 550 1 ToSEASONIC - GX 850W Fm GoldDEEPCOOL - Castel v2-360 a-RGBASUS -dual screen 27" 165Hz -1 ms -1080pVentilation boitier 3X140 Phanteks entho pro windowedLogiciel utilisé  pour testCPUID / Core Temp / OCCT / 3Dmark / Win 10 ProInstallation très simple comme tout proc avec pate thermique TF8 13,8 W/MK- Excellente conductivité surtout sur les montées rapides en température et facile d'utilisation.Apres plusieurs stress test voici mes résultats.Conso max 144 W en pique, 70-71 ° max @5.0 MHzDonc en utilisation normal même en le chargeant il dépasse pas 30% d'utilisation je suis blufféTesté ensuite avec grosse session de jeux + discord + cam et web rien à redire je pense être tombé sur une très bonne version de puce aux vues des résultats que j'obtiens. il reste sous la barre des 55° piece a 24 ° et pc sous le bureauDonc pas besoins pour moi de céder a un Up grade de matériel inutile il y a encore de quoi faire avec un prix en version KF très contenu merci au vendeur c'est topissime. OC s'il y a encore mieux à en sortir. @5.2 MHz me semble facile et gain de fps notable sans avoir une monté en temperature excessive juste pour le FUN :DJ'ai tardé a posté mais depuis son installation @5.2 il  fonctionne a merveilleMerci overclocking_comJe suis donc hyper satisfait des  résultats  et du produit,Merci de m'avoir lu en espérant vous avoir répondu a quelques questionnements.', 'La inversion valio la pena y es parte del equipo de game PC  sin ninguna falla, valio la pena colocarlo en la nueva PC', 'The NEW i9 processor I have received is perfect. However I originally had ordered a “Like-New” used offering on this page and it was a scam. I was sent an old i5 model not even close to what I needed.', "Je ne pensais jamais me prendre un i9, au mieux un i7, le tarif me paraissait bien trop élevé.Finalement je n'ai pas résisté face au prix proposé (300 €) quelques mois plus tard, l'upgrade de mon i5-9400F ne s'est pas fait attendre...Couplé à un très bon ventirad avec une pâte thermique de qualité moyenne dans mon cas, avec 21° de température ambiante dans la pièce :- environ 70° sur les jeux les plus gourmands après plusieurs heures de fonctionnement- environ 30° idlePour du gaming, couplé à une carte mère milieu de gamme gérant le XMP, de la DDR4 3000 MHz et une 3060 Ti, bon nombre de jeux tournent assurément en 1080p avec 140 FPS, là où le i5-9400F limitait clairement la puissance globale du PC (qui plafonnait 20 FPS au dessous).Pour des rendus vidéos, pas encore testé, mais vu la vitesse à laquelle on peut ALT TAB venant de n'importe quel programme, même les plus gourmands et relancer derrière d'autres programmes gourmands en simultané, le multitâche semble aujourd'hui être une formalité pour ce processeur, là où vous aviez le temps de vous faire un café avec le i5.Côté consommation électrique, je trouve ça raisonnable avec ma config, environ 330 Watts avec un jeu triple A qui tourne à fond (Warzone) et un peu de bazar sur la multiprise en plus.Que du bonheur !"]

Product: Intel Core i5-12400 Desktop Processor 18M Cache, up to 4.40 GHz
Reviews: ['I was initially only bought this due to it being the most affordable mid range CPU at 290 SGD for my new build, and was also considering similarly priced AMD Ryzen 5600X, but settled on this ultimately. I do not regret this at all. The performance is amazing and can run CPU-intensive games well along with my 3060ti. The stock cooler provided is also amazing and simple to install, but would have preferred if it came with metal mounting screws instead of cheap-feeling plastic push pins.The price is well below other retail shops in Singapore including Sim Lim square. Although it is shipped from overseas, it is genuine and the packaging arrived sealed and undamaged. The shipping time also took less than a week.The only problem was that motherboards with LGA 1700 sockets (that supports 12gen Intel processors) are currently much more expensive than LGA 1200 or AMD counterparts, so I had to settle with a non ideal mATX motherboard to stay within my budget.', 'Intel i5-12400 maybe the best choice for gaming. no need efficient cores, the 6 performance cores with hyper-thread are powerful enough.', "The i5-12400 is at a nice spot on the value/performance curve for a homelabber.  Anything lower and you only get four cores. Anything higher and you have to deal with the P-core/E-core dichotomy. The included heatsink/fan combo isn't much to look at but it gets the job done.", 'Calidad esperada, no se calienta mucho, fácil de instalar y con buena velocidad, se recomienda', 'What can I say?The really valuable, decent, and low-budget pc core.', 'Works great paired with my 3060.', 'Todo en perfectas condiciones, muy bien empacado y por ahora funciona de maravilla', 'Muy buen producto para mis necesidades', 'Using it for a computer at church that is running Propresenter 7, and it seems to be handling it fine. Also using it with a xfx Radeon rx 6600 GPU, and Corsair DDR5 5600 32gb.', 'Lo tengo en una PC para jugar y funciona con todos los programas de maravilla']

Product: Intel CPU Core i7-12700F / 12/20 / 2.1GHz / 6xxChipset / BX8071512700F
Reviews: ['12700F is an amazing all-around performer. CP 2077 runs all-cores at 56 C. Fewer frame dips in CS:GO as well. This CPU is the sweet spot right now: well-priced, easy to cool, runs anything well, very stable, no thermal throttling. 240 AIO is enough to cool it.', 'Este producto tiene todas mis felicitaciones es toda una maravilla, solo cabe recalcar que no especifica que viene con el ventilador y disipador esa es una gran informacion para algunas personas', "10000 times better than the 6750. specs wip it's pathetic ass", "While this is a great CPU with all the bells and whistles, but for gaming there is not real reason to go with this rather than i5 12600K(F). This may shine in productivity tasks where core count matters more, but overall it's a decent CPU.", 'El procesador es muy bueno, lo compre para la PC de mi esposa y el rendimiento es excelente. Lo compare en programas de productividad con mi 5900x y están muy a la par con la ventaja del Intel de soportar PCIE 5.0 para las nuevas GPUS.Lo recomiendo si buscas en procesador para juegos y multitasking', 'Paired with a z690 motherboard and Scythe Mugen 5 cooler, the performance is on par with a 12700K (see the picture).On a z690 or b660 motherboard with good VRMs, 12700F can run at high power rating (PL2) continuously. And, a better cooler than the one included, Scythe Mugen 5 for me, keeps the CPU cool to avoid thermal throttling (never exceeds 70C under any load). When paired with a good cooler and motherboard, the performance practically matches 12700K. The latest CPUs are no fun to overclock anymore as they draw too much power and cooling becomes too expensive and noisy for the little performance gain. So, I went with this CPU and completely satisfied.', 'This chip runs cooler then my i7-9700k and uses less of the cores. Actually super happy with this upgrade. The new retention was alittle weird but overall great value. Fyi make sure you get the right cooler in my case i had the corsair h150i elite capellix so i had to order the new retention kit from corsairs website. You can use the old backplate it comes with just the screws are shorter. The cpu is thiner.', 'Fast and easy to install.  Great performance.', 'Yeah, it is good, but a little expensive tho. It kinda works well with my 2060', "Everything I read said it'd be super mega hot - and so I paired it with a 360mm AIO. So far, temps are GREAT.No complaints - 20 core beast screams. Price is great, too."]

Product: AMD Ryzen 3 PRO 4350G Processor 7nm 3.8Ghz 4 cores 8 Threads Processor only (Tray)
Reviews: ["Fairly decent build. Fast for 4 core. Comes with video card built in! How can you go wrong???? Going intel that's how!"]

Product: INTEL CORE I3-12100F DESKTOP
Reviews: ['Die CPU hat mehr als genug Kraft für alle Büroanwendungen und wird im Normalbetrieb nichtmal handwarm. Eine prima Technologie zu einem günstigen Preis. Der Einbau in ein passendes Mainboard (LGA 1700) geht kinderleicht und ist idiotensicher.Für den i3-12100F wird eine dedizierte Graphikkarte benötigt. Im Schwestermodel i3-12100 ist eine recht gute Graphiklösung schon auf dem Chip vorhanden und reicht für praktisch alle Büroarbeiten völlig aus. Für "Normalanwender" sind die 20..30 Euro Mehrpreis für den i3-12100 gut angelegt und lohnt sich allein schon für die Stromrechnung.', "Très bon cpu pour des config gamer entrée/milieu de gammeNe nécessite pas de refroidissement particulier et si un ventirad est nécessaire tourné vous vers le thermalright assassinX a ~20€Vendeur fiable, livraison rapide prix cohérent avec le marché, petit bémol la boîte du cpu (seulement la boîte je précise bien) est arrivé un peu abîmé moi qui aime bien gardé mes boîtes c'est une occasion manquée sinon rien d'alarmant a signalé", "It is exactly what it shows and described on the promo. Works like a charm. I'm even surprised myself of how great is performing in my system. Comes with the whole shebang ready to install and also comes ready to install on the motherboard (Silver Thermal Grease CPU Heatsink Compound Paste). No need to put anything, just peel off the plastic and install... Awesome.", 'Olha, a velocidade me surpreendeu! Pensei que o Clock seria baixo, mais ele faz o over sozinho, a frequência sobe para 4.3, e um ótimo processador pra quem quer trabalhar, ou jogar, vai funcionar para o dois! Se você tiver memória e um boa placa de vídeo.', "I have this installed in an ASUS PRIME PLUS-D4 with an M.2 970 EVO Pro 1TB, ZOTAC 2080, 32GB VulcanC DDR4, AZZA Spectra 280 case with 7 fans.  Running 1080P maxed out CyberPunk 2077 @ 57-60fps WHILE streaming was more than I thought this 'lil dude could handle. Third day stock cooler couldn't keep up so I threw in a Deepcool cooler in there! Never goes above 70C now.... Love this build :)", 'Paired with 8 gb ram, H610M-E D4 Intel Lga 1700 Mic-ATX Motherboard, Western Digital WD Green SN350 NVMe 240GB, Upto 2400MB/s, and working fine. Go for it.', 'Do grania w 1080p idealny, bardzo niski pobór mocy, niskie temperatury, wydajnościowo w grach nie odstaje od Ryzena 5600. Jeśli chodzi o wielozadaniowość (multicore) wypada gorzej ale to mi nie przeszkadza.', 'buon prodotto consegna veloce', 'I’ve paired it with a RX 7600. Works pretty well with it. I’ve not experienced any issues so far.You may push to get a i5-12400F for higher cores if your budget allows it. Otherwise, this is a great starting point for a budget PC build.', 'Probably the best 100 dollar cpu out there.']

Product: AMD Ryzen™ 9 7900X 12-Core, 24-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor
Reviews: ["Had to buy from Amazon since the local 7000 series MSRP still haven't come down yet. Coming back from where it belong. Absolute worth for the price even after the shipping and import duty fee. Although it's still an overpriced CPU and AM5 ecosystem overall to be honest. Besides the brace period about a week after placing the order, the shipping itself was really quick for something that shipped from the other side of the earth, received in less than a week. The parcel box quite damaged but the processor box is mostly fine.Make sure the rest of the PC hardware configuration is right to make use of it. Lots of people overlooked their specifications and ended up with issues. Paired mine with MSI MPG X670E Carbon Wifi. Using this as my personal workstation and minor gaming. Anything beyond the 7700X is already overkill for gaming tbh. Hopefully it can last for at least 4-5 years.", 'Been waiting to build my new rig for quite some time and this was the missing piece.New build:Corsair Icue 7000X Full Tower RGBRyzen 9 7900X CPU32GB DDR5 5600 Corsair Dominator RAM1 TB Crucial M.2 Gen 4XFX Merc 319 Radeon 6950XT 16GB Graphics CardCorsair 1000w PSUGigabyte X670 Elite AX AM5 MotherboardCorsair iCUE H150i Elite LCD XT Liquid CPU Cooler (360 AIO mounted to top as Exhaust6 Corsair ML140\'s Fans (10 total fans including those with the case/aio with 6 as intake and 4 for exhaust).Lian Li Strimer V2 RGB Cables for the GPU and Motherboard (they look very nice and controllable via the L Connect 3 software)As I needed additional powered USB headers I also added a Corsair Internal 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub - 4X 9-Pin USB 2.0 Ports for the Commander Core XT and Lian Li Controllers to function.Thermal Grizzly Kryonaut Thermal Paste (removed the stock paste with AIO using TG cleaner wipes as well for better contact).ThermalRight AMD5 CPU Shield - This allows the AIO or Waterblock (if doing a custom loop) to make WAY better contact with the CPU HS. It can be a little nerve wracking as your removing the cpu mount and installing this one but its worth it. As the AM5 CPU has no pins (the mobo now has the pins), its imperative you are gentle on the placement. Best way I found to install this shield was to place the CPU into the socket, then remove the cpu holder so this way you can\'t damage the cpu or pins as they are socketed. Installing the shield from that point is easy, just don\'t overtighten it. Theres a bunch of youtube videos on this process. Definitely recommend reviewing them before attempting this step.I upgraded from my old Ryzen 5 2600X system with a GTX 960 SSC 4GB card and a 512gb M.2 Gen 2 drive.Needless to say this was quite the upgrade from my old system.Cinebench scores on my 2600X even with a mild overclock was only around 7200.After getting everything configured/setup and Windows 11 Pro installed with all updates and enabling EXPO1 (RAM OC) and enabling SAM in the BIOS I started my benchmarking.Cinebench score with just EXPO1 enabled baseline was 28745. What a jump!CPU temp on the multi-core threading with the 360 AIO only went as high as 82c (AMD rates these to run at 95c as normal operating temp so it was well below even that).Haven\'t done any OC\'ing other than enabling EXPO1 yet since I really don\'t need to as the CPU and GPU run everything maxed out.Tested on a few games on max/ultra settings and below are what I got FPS wise:The Division 2 (All settings maxed and on DX12) - Avg 125fps on 3440 x 1440 165hz resolutionAliens: Fireteam Elite - Avg 160fps on 3440 x 1440 165hz resolutionBorderlands 2 (older game I know but love to play it with max settings) - Avg 476fps on 3440 x 1440 165hz resolutionForza Horizon 5 - Ultra Settings (max) including Ray Tracing - Avg 155fps on 3440 x 1440 165hz resolutionAliens: Colonial Marines (older game) - Avg 190FPS on 3440 x 1440 165hz resolutionWarframe - Avg 155fps on 3440 x 1440 165hz resolutionPairing this CPU and GPU together worked great and the CPU itself is a beast. It does get hot when it turbo\'s up into the 5ghz range which is why you need a really good cooler (either AIO or custom loop) to keep the temps in check.If you do that, this CPU will be everything you need and then some.One thing I always tell people is to take your time, plan out your PC parts you want for what you want the system to do (video editing, gaming, streaming, etc). Don\'t be afraid to look around for good deals. I scored the AIO Cooler off Newegg for a much cheaper price than Amazon had it and it works beautifully and the LCD screen is just a nice "geek" factor to put JPG\'s or GIF\'s there.Once you have everything, take your time when building it. You may run into an issue here or there which is normal. First boot on AM5 systems is sometimes slow (Memory has to train) and you may see it cycle on/off for up to 1 minute. Mine did this and on the 4th power cycle it posted and I could get into the BIOS and everything showed up correctly.Good luck enthusiasts and hope this review helped with anyone looking at this CPU for their system!Its worth it!', "I realize that a pc picture for a processor is pointless and just showing off, but isn't everyone who gets this showing off a little lol. Anyway, the title says it all, a beast. I've been intel all my life, though to be fair I havent had many computers, but still, i was like amd who? lol. Even when amd surpassed intel with the x3d for gaming anyway I was like well whatever intel's still the goat so they can have their short victory, which is unheard of for me because if there are 2 brands that are equal or even one thats close but not quite as good, ill always go with the red one(obsessive fav color), but then am5 came out, and to be clear, i wasn't one of those fanboys who was like omg becky! amd is going to destroy intel and there's going to be nothing they can do about it. No! quite the opposite. I knew. I knew what revolutionary technology the hybrid core design was and how great raptor lake was going to be, I knew it might even surpass amd's new best unlike everyone else. Didn't matter though. Because i wanted to try changing it up and switching to team red for a variety of reasons. 1. like i said cuz its red. 2. because as great as raptor is, i dont wanna be in the cycle i was in before where if i wanna upgrade a single pc part like the processor, ill have to basically build a new pc, which is what i had to do and what youll always have to do with intel usually, but amd will have upgradability on this for years new platform and all on top of the fact that amd has always been better about keeping compatible socket types for a longer time, while obviously thats not true for raptor, and even if raptor was a new platform lets not play like am5 still wouldnt be supported way longer, because it will, hell am5 will probably be supported to the end of intels next platform lol, 3. ive never once cared about power efficiency and heat, like so what, ok it draws alotta power, BUT, as long as the performance is there(lookin at you 12900/13900) and it will not throttle and be stable, awesome, do whatever you want, why limit performance for braggin rights efficiency(i know some people will cringe reading that), but anyway, while idc about it, it is a big win all the same for amd 4. 12 cores and 24 threads of pure American Muscle (jk but you get the point lol), 5. amd has become the stability platform thanks to intels new incredible but still NEW architecture 6. you get every bonus I just said and are getting like the 3rd best consumer processor in the world right now, who cares if the 13900 is technically #1 by a few percent 7. if you want both gaming performance and workstation performance, which is the main reason i upgraded, this is the way to go, best of both worlds if 16 core 32 thread or 13900k is just a bit unnecessary for you but you still want that best of both worlds, and for that reason idc what any reviews say online about it being slightly overpriced, because for all of the reasons i listed above, i disagree 8. well this is more of a counter, but, are the motherboards pretty expensive, yes, is ddr5 expensive? yes but if your building a new pc it really doesn't matter does it because your already spending a bunch of money and you might as well pay a bit more for that amd upgradability over intel, and for those who aren't building a totally new one, assuming you don't wanna pay a bunch of money, if you do your research you can still get a good motherboard and ddr5 for pretty cheap OH AND AT THE TIME OF WRITING THIS I've been talking about the normal price, but currently the 7900 is at an INSANE DISCOUNT, LIKE CRAZY, final note: that second picture i showed was me letting hw monitor run for 30 minutes, the point is that, it does go way above 5.6 even if only in semi frequent spikes, just thought it was cool, i know practically it doesnt matter", 'Nach ca. mehr als 5 Jahren endlich der Umstieg und Erneuerung meines Computers vom Intel i7-3770 nun auf AMD Ryzen 9 7900x. War das beste was ich tun konnte. Schnelle Lieferung. Nichts kaputt oder so.Eingebaut und läuft. So soll es sein.', 'Ne bronche pas. Par contre prévoir un excellent AIO ou watercooling custom car il chauffe le coco.', "Un monstre, utilisation hybride aujourd'hui, (développement etc), mais éventuellement j'ajouterais plus tard pour un R9 7900X3D sur un autre PC gaming.Par contre j'attends des nouvelles de mon Starfield Ultimate Edition, mais nada, aucune mention !", 'Mine runs at 90C + under load with water cooling, not overclocked. Had it off and on again, several times. Everything is making contact that should be. I even put 3 120mm fans on the radiator that scream 5200rpm. Is what it is. Games run like butter. 3d printer slicing happens fast. Just the heat thing. Be prepared to not cheap the cooling.', "I originally paired this 7900X with an RTX 4080, and 64gb DDR5 6000Mhz CL36. It was a gaming powerhouse. Sure, there are some other options out there but this 12 core 24 thread 7900X is a beast. Yes it's one of the hotter running CPU's on the market but it's easier to cool than a 13700k. I had a 280mm Arctic AIO cooling my 7900X and the temps are great. Temps are typically in the low 60⁰s which is very good.", 'CPU is insane and I love it.Built my PC with this and bought this CPU to future proof it, this CPU is insane and is a bit overkill atleast it is at the moment. When playing heavy games the cpu does idle at 90 degrees which is normal. When using for normal use it’ll sit at 40 degrees. I myself use a liquid cooler AIO in order to manage the temps.For the price it is 110% worth it, was either this or intel i9 13900k but the price definitely beats it here.If you are building a pc and using this CPU just remember to buy an AM5 compatible motherboard. AM4 AIO coolers still work with this, just make sure to use the mounting bracket.', 'Es muy rápido, dependerá del sistema operativo que gestione correctamente su potencial. Por lo demás es un procesador increible.El envío fue desagradable, tardó un largo mes en llegar. El vendedor no era directamente por AMAZON sino otro proveedor y no me dejó un buen sabor de rapidez.']

Product: Intel Core i5-13400F Desktop Processor 10 cores (6 P-cores + 4 E-cores) 20MB Cache, up to 4.6 GHz
Reviews: ['Perfect for me!', '本製品は型番F付きなのでグラフィック機能がついていません。これにより発熱をかなり抑えています。ケースの風通しが良ければ付属のリテールクーラー(ださい)で十分冷えます。能力は配信をしながらハイエンドのゲームをやるとコア数の都合で100%行くこともあるという感じです。100%を気にしない人で他に金を回したい人なら買いです。気になるならもっとコア数を増やした方がよいかと思う。', 'For the price this is an amazing mid to high range cpu. I’ve had this for a few weeks now and it works great.', 'Great performance on a budget. Great core for a 1080p/2K gaming machine. Easy to install and no issues with operation.', 'Excelente para juegos, buenas temperaturas pero el disipador stock es un poco ruidoso...', 'This really handles gaming well, look up bottle neck calculator online…. Match it with some GPUs you may be quite surprised of what it is capable of. Works great with my rtx3080. Yea I like it. :)', 'Super great price, runs super cold. Worth it', 'Running smoothly,I have used it with 1080ti ,playing high configuration requirements PC games for several months.and it works great.  It’s not expensive, very worth.', 'perfect for 2K gaming. Never used the integrated graphics on a CPU before and you save some with this F model. No issues so far.', 'El producto mas concretamente el procesador llego bien ojo solo el procesador, pero cuando abri la caja del procesador (para armar mi PC), el ventilador que venia con el estaba roto, pero por suerte no me preocupe, pues tenia una refigeracion liquida que ya habia comprado y no me detuve a pedir garantia, pues solo me interesaba el procesador.']

Product: Intel Core i7-12700K Desktop Processor 12 (8P+4E) Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked  LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Reviews: ["I upgraded from the i7 6700k to the i3 13100 and saw a great performance increase. I was eager to test ddr5. However,  I also wanted to experiment with 6+ core processors. Fortunately I found this i7 12700k when the price dropped to 275. I wasn't sure if it would be a big increase from the i3 and the i7 6700k.
