But the i7 12700k is a ferocious beast that has crushed all tasks I've given it and brought immesnse life back to my RTX 2060 super and it stays cools & fluent.Z790 auros elite axI7 12700k overclocked pcores 5.2 ghz ecores 4.0 ghz 50-65°C during multi intensive tasks and games for long periods of timeRTX 2060 super 8bg ddr6Corsair vengeance 6000mhz ddr5Cyberpunk 60-65 fps 1080 ultra+psycho with medium ray tracing with a low of 59Starfield 30- 40 1080p fps high settings the devs need to optimize thoughHorizon zero Dawn 80-85 fps 1080 ultraShreds through video editing and music editing all at onceAmazing at multitaskingPowerfulFastCan be placed in ddr4 mobos and ddr5 mobos", 'I upgraded to this CPU after some HEAVY research, asking Reddit (Both Intel and AMD subreddits), weighing in money VS performance gained. I have used AMD since I was a teen and started building computers. The conclusion is this: It is an amazing CPU, runs faster and cooler than my Ryzen 7 1700. The price AND performance VS AMD (Also including a board) was better than if I had went with a Ryzen 7 5800X.Some background information: I wanted to upgrade after receiving an Amazon gift card (I have never ordered computer parts from Amazon though). I upgraded from a Ryzen 7 1700, with an ASUS x370-f board. I really wanted to upgrade, and was sad also that Windows 11 did not support my CPU! I will give it to Microsoft for this, as it made A LOT of people upgrade their entire computers, all for basically the same OS as of now with newer looks, and not much done under the hood (EXCEPT for 12th gen Intel, so good news there too). Sadly, my old board STILL doesn\'t support the Ryzen 7 5000 series, and only the 3000 series (They are working on a BIOS apparently for the 5000 series, because of people who were in my shoes). I first almost ordered the Ryzen 7 3800XT, for $400! After a couple hours of research, asking, and thinking about it... I cancelled that order (Thankfully) and thought "Well, if I am going to spend this much on upgrading my CPU, I might as well go all in/spend a little more for something better, as this may be my last big upgrade in this regard for awhile." I was then going to get the Ryzen 7 5800X with an Asus board. There lied a problem of price, I could not find a board AND get that CPU still within my budget (At-least not a board that wasn\'t worse than the one I had in ways). I mentioned I had posted on the AMD subreddit, and even they suggested I go Intel (Intel is just killing it as of now, hands down, although I am sure AMD will retaliate). I ended up getting the MSI Z690-A DDR4 (I wish I had the money for DDR5 RAM, I would have went with the DDR5 version as it was basically the same price). I had A LOT of second thoughts on this board though, as it just didn\'t seem "Premium" as the one I had (I am going to do a whole review on it after this. I\'ll save my Pros & Cons for there.) This CPU also auto-clocks itself up or down depending on the load (Saw it clock down to 1GHz, although not for long, for example if not much processing power is warranted, which makes sense and I wish everything did). So if idling, it will clock down and save power/heat/and therefore longevity is increased. I absolutely love this CPU coming from AMD. Anyways...If you have a Corsair H100I RGB Platinum or similar cooler already: The included 1200 screws work just fine with the 1700 socket and this CPU, even though you are supposed to get the 1700 kit/screws for this CPU (Which I did, but they are taking FOREVER to ship, so I googled, and someone said using the 1200 screws will work just fine). I get better temps. than my Ryzen 7 1700. I can even overclock EVEN MORE but have no need, and no point.TL:DRUpgraded from: Ryzen 7 1700, Asus Rog Strix x370-f gaming.Upgraded to: i7-12700K, MSI Z690-A DDR4.Parts kept: 4x8GB 32GB DDR4 CL16 3000MHz RAM (With XMP, D.O.C.P), RTX 2070. The RAM works great with this CPU as well, although it TECHNICALLY (Latency wise, runs at 2T on Intel instead of 1T on AMD) runs slower than when on AMD (AMD\'s infinity fabric) but obviously whatever Intel is doing makes up for that, and therefore my RAM either runs faster/the same)Pros: It is an amazing CPU for price VS performance. The i5-12600K is good as well (I almost just went with it), and you would be fine going with it for gaming (As even it still has more cores technically than the Ryzen 7 5800X, it also beats the 5800X even though THIS CPU is supposed to be its comparison rival brother.) This CPU has cool temps on my Corsair H100I RGB Platinum cooler, and the P&E core structure are REALLY cool and fun to watch when doing tasks/gaming. It shipped fast!Cons: Literally none with the CPU itself. Just with shipping - It shipped really fast! Was here in 2-3 days after purchasing on here. The biggest complaint I have is Amazon\'s shipping (SO BE AWARE OF THIS) I have never ordered computer parts from Amazon, and have always used New-egg. They just left the CPU in my mail-box, and if it weren\'t for me looking at my camera\'s, and looking out for this part, it would have sat in the mail-box all day. My mail-box sadly is not very weather proof as well, and if it had been raining... It wouldn\'t have been good. Although it did come in a big box around it. The CPU also was jarred loose and flopping around in the box (Not held into the front window).I hope this review helps people!', 'É muito rápido, mas esquenta bastante, chega a usar 220W em teste de estresse. Antes de comprar, procure saber nos fóruns sobre essa questão, não importa qual cooler e pasta térmica use, ele vai esquentar muito. A única solução é fazer um ligeiro undervolt, ou diminuir o loadline calibration na BIOS. Me fez lembrar o i7-7700K que sofria do mesmo problema.', 'Rien à redire et il ne chauffe pas (28C au repos) même sans water cooling', 'Bought this for a new personal PC. My last was an i7 4790K build that got totaled out (crushed) during shipping. After building a new one on a z790i platform, the performance gain was stunning, completely night and day! I cannot say enough about this CPU, and would totally recommend this product!!', 'Good.......', 'Paired it with an ASUS MOBO and a Lian Li 360mm AIO.Runs cool, no performance issues, and no bottlenecks for the gaming i use it for.', 'super', "This item has been with me for a very short time.So I recently decided to upgrade my gaming rig, and after extensive research, I made the bold choice to order the Intel Core i7-12700K Gaming Desktop Processor with Integrated Graphics and 12 Cores. Let me tell you, this processor is the absolute best! With its 12 cores, it brings a whole new level of performance to my gaming experience. Whether I'm playing graphically demanding AAA titles or indulging in intense multitasking, this processor effortlessly handles it all. And what's even better is that it comes with integrated graphics, meaning I didn't have to shell out extra cash for a separate graphics card, yet. The integrated Graphics offer the flexibility of running dual displays smoothly without any hiccups. Plus, with Intel's reputation for reliable and high-quality products, I know I can trust the i7-12700K to last me for years to come.I hope you find this review helpful.", 'Tutto Ok']

Product: Intel Core i5-12600KF Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked  LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Reviews: ['Have one in my build for over a week and it works great, does not overheat with most FPS games i play and is powerful enough.', 'Took a little longer (14 days) to ship out but delivery was fast. Great Upgrade from Intel 9600K PC User.', "When my motherboard died, I decided to build myself a new PC and update my son's Ryzen 2600 build with something with more zip. I bought this processor (on a smoking coupon deal), a Z690 board for it, and a Z590 for the i7 11700KF from my old build to form the base of the two builds.I kind of agonized over which I would choose for myself - the 11th Gen i7 paired with the Z590 or this 12th Gen i5 with the Z690. I chose the latter, mostly because those parts came first and I was the one with the dead PC.Turns out that it didn't much matter. The i5 12600KF is every bit the equal of the i7 11700KF. Considering that I paid under $160 for this processor, I couldn't be happier with my purchase.", 'Excelente procesador a buen precio', 'Tutto perfetto', 'I was using an i7-5820k and the 12600kf blows it out of the water and it’s less than I paid for the 5820k back in the day. 10/10 recommend', 'Super Leistung', 'received within ten days after ordering, which is normal for my country (in asia). Product was packed nicely as usual and is performing well as intended. Really satisfied especially with the coupon Amazon offered, thank you.', "Amazing CPU handles everything I throw at it with ease and I'm able to run everything smoothly.I would like to add that for some weird reason windows wasn't using all cores and I suspected that I received the wrong one. In order to utilize all cores and use them to their max potential you need to make sure they are first of all enabled in the bios and only after that in windows you need to go to msconfig.msc > boot > advanced options > and uncheck the box with number of processors. This is very important otherwise windows will pretend that you don't have a 10 core CPU and give you false info under system info. and make sure to reboot for this to take effect. and when you do that windows will show that you have 10 cores CPU but still doesn't mean they are all in use. Download a software called QuickCPU and then change the power plan to high performance and at the bottom set everything to 100% and click apply. Once that is done congrats windows will use all the cores to their limit.", "Buy with confidence. Amazing product. Just note however, on your choice of motherboards, get a Z if you plan on doing some overclocking, and an H if you don't. Do not bother with the other two cheap bords."]

Product: Intel Core i9-13900KF (Latest Gen) Gaming Desktop Processor 24 cores (8 P-cores + 16 E-cores) - Unlocked
Reviews: ["i upgraded from 5900xt. I got the msi board z690 -a for 159, and this the 13900kf. I ‘ve been wanting a cpu with an IGPU for years, but couldn’t justify the price increase on the gpu version. I actually use a dgpu but it really is convenient, and they can be used to accelerate some work. Again, before you judge i'm using this for work, productivity. NOT gaming. I would spend 200 for a gaming cpu.my use case is productivity. i’m a developer, and this is the sole reason i upgraded. I was fighting windows freezing and slowing down during a lot of my workflows. I use wsl intellj, docker, react apps java etc, often at the same time. It’s pretty noticeable the improvement. It really helped.  Like that i could use ddr4 for now since the boards are about 150 it was acceptable.Heat: The cpu gets a bad reputation due to heat and wattage. I put this in the bucket frankly that amd got as well. I mean it’s fine they are using as much power as needed to maximize perf. I limited the cpu to 250w, and it runs on a d15 cooler than my 5900, Full load can get up to high 80c, but working is 30’s. you lose very little perf by running it more in the zone. I don't know about other boards but that msi one sure makes it easy and the price if right.About the cpu: it has a ton of cores, I didn't need to buy ddr5--  i need quite a lot of ram and it still costs too much for the benefit it provides in my workload. The memory controller on 13gen is far better than ryzen 5000 series. I couldn't before get my ddr4 stable at 4000 on the 5900x and it did it on the intel one immediately. Indeed i was even able to tighten up the timings just a touch. So modern processors (and i'd assume the amd ones as well) have made welcome improvements to memory support. Id' say if you don't need as much ram say 32gb, and you don't have ddr4 already to tide you over i'd consider getting ddr5 though.  I mean nothing is cheaper than what you have and 4k speed is fine. If i had nothing or maybe some old ram i'd go w/ ddr5.Price: For 570 it’s decent deal here. It is more than i love spending, but for what you get it is a lot better than what amd is offering at the time i write this which was 700.I do wish intel supported board reuse down the line, but that even can. be overblown (to an extent, and only an extent) though it's a selling feature to me frankly reuse!! I had to really think about that. I don't understand why intel is so stubborn on this subject.  with my amd cpu i went from 2700x to 5900x and the board went from a 470 to 570 because i waned more io and better pcie but i also gave that board to my kid and upgraded it one time. With intel especially I mean i just buy cheap boards anyway and upgrade more because there are a ton of features that get added half the time. I usually try to spend about 150 on a board, though it. is getting harder but it would be more my preference. I 'm not really onboard with the 600 motherboards. Is there a  300 one in-between i guess so but that's equally unappealing to me esp w/ out the upgrade.Tips/A rant if you will: trust me on this that msi board for 159 is so amazing. It really works great. don’t worry about the vrm. that’s also very overblown too. you can go calculate the amperage this will not come close. ALso msi is a great brand and the bios is easy to navigate. If you want fancy audio buy a dac that you can reuse and plug into usb and keep reusing it. Just think about what you really need in there. The msi board has a nice selection of pcie slots and well placed nvme. I use multiple gpu one nvidia gpu quatro for encoding (its a small one) and and amd one 6900 i bought for 570 for gaming. I just really love the layout connectivity and features of the board. They cut all the stuff i don't need and pared with the cpu it's all together about 700 for a cpu and board, pretty much as good as you can get.", "Concerning Intel Core i9-13900KF,I have this CPU with board ASUS ROG Strix Z790-E Gaming WiFi 6E LGA 1700 for gaming usage.  Once I discovered that I had to slow the memory down from the 6600MHz XMP rating to 6200MHz, the board/cpu combo has worked very reliably  (multiple passes of OCCT Gold stress test).  Just checking the XMP II box,  the 6200MHz box and the (so called) AI overclocking box in the bios gives a score of 40K on Cinebench R23 so it's plenty fast -- the loss of 400MHz memory bandwidth isn't a big deal.  I tried various other adjustments but the latter turned out to be sufficiently fast and very reliable.  My current chip has a Silicon Predictor(SP) of 99 (roll of the dice).  I suspect that higher SP levels while possible are rare.I am using a ARCTIC Liquid Freezer II 360  AIO which works OK but the CPU can run hot.  The mother board cooling prediction for said AIO is 155 but that is not really enough for this chip to run all out.  It is easy to get this CPU up to 100C using OCT Power Stress test.  While the CPU might run at 100C for a long time, it will not do it any good and it will not run reliably -- I needed to check the 90C max box in the bios to get it to pass the OCCT power stress test.  I have a RTX 4090 and in the OCCT power test the net system power gets up to 1100W.  Normal gaming so far never gets to such power levels but still worth considering.FWIW, I have had a CPU apparently fail from running the OCCT Power Stress test.  If you want to run this CPU all out with reasonable temps, you really need significant cooling.  I doubt any AIO will work for this.  I suggest an open loop system with something like a Watercool MO-RA3 420 PRO radiator.All said, If you are building a gaming system, you would be just as well served with a ASUS ROG Strix Z690-E and a i9-12900KF CPU.  It will be easier to cool and will save you some money for a better graphics card which will make *much* more difference in most games than the CPU.", 'Es un procesador muy poderoso y se calienta por lo tanto vas a necesitar una buena refrigeración liquida así que no ahorres en la refrigeración de este procesador.', "The Intel Core i9-13900KF is an absolute beast! From the moment I upgraded to this 13th generation CPU, everything has been running very smoothly. My DaVinci Resolve playback on 4K is now smooth with zero choppiness or freezing, a remarkable improvement compared to my old setup. I'm blown away by its speed and performance, making it a game-changer for my work and entertainment. Highly recommend this powerhouse CPU for anyone seeking top-notch performance! 💻🔥", "I have found the KF models overclock a bit better. This is a beast of a CPU and puts AMD fan boys to shame. This one is able to do 6.0 GHZ all core at 1.40 volts with DDR5 running at 8000 mt's CL32.  Currently the best CPU you can buy at time of writing this.  Pair it with a 4090 and you have the fastest 4K gaming PC out.", 'Best investment I ever made when it comes to a gaming/streaming pc. I’m a pretty hardcore gamer and this cpu is the most amazing thing I’ve ever had when it comes to a high end build. I paired it with a rtx 4080 and needless to say this cpu doesn’t disappoint. Now, this review isn’t about pricing because we all know this cpu is expensive and honestly if you’re only gaming then maybe a 13600k would suffice. However, if you are streaming, photo editing, video editing etc…. Then this is the right cpu for you. I’m able to snap together YouTube videos in seconds NOT minutes or anywhere near it. I’m able to stream and game at the same time with less than a 10 fps loss while gaming and streaming on the highest quality settings. My wife loves it for photo editing bc everything is just perfect. Only downside is that it does run hot but you can get a good 240-360mm aio that will tame this cpu with ease. All the issues I use to have on the 10th gen platform are completely irradiated now that I own this cpu. I did go with the ddr5 and honestly for me it runs better than ddr4. Tech reviewers say otherwise but from personal experience ddr5 is the future NOW. Performance issues I use to have with ddr4 and weaker cpus are just gone now. I can do so much and this cpu doesn’t break a sweat. For instance, ddr4 for whatever reason sometimes wouldn’t work with xmp although it was advertised. I like to tinker so it wasn’t an issue BUT sometimes it’s just nice to do a single click and let it dial itself in and that’s what ddr5 has done for me. I’ve used several different sticks with this cpu and from all of them I went with Corsair vengeance. Honestly, this is the most bada$$ cpu I’ve ever owned or seen in a personal system of mine. If you have the money I couldn’t recommend it enough. Everybody has different needs and in my case I needed this cpu. It hasn’t disappointed. As for amd, if you want the bugs and issues go ahead and grab one of those cpus and tell me how that goes. This cpu can do everything and more. Hope this review helps anybody who is on the edge about getting this or something else.', "Remember F and K means no cpu based graphics. So as long as you are installing a gpu, you're fine. Even if your motherboard has video outputs, you cant use them.This only becomes a problem if you have to troubleshoot and it COULD be the gpu.", 'Even 14900 is close at hand, 13900 is still powerful to  handle any task. The temperature is higher than it’s competitor 7950x3d but still can be controlled by any 360mm water cooler', 'Seems to run pretty cool using the Corsair H115i water cooler and overclocked to 5800 on the EVGA Z790 Dark Kingpin with G.Skill Trident 8000 memory. Only had it installed and overclocked for about a week now but I have not seen it reach 50c yet. I play a lot of COD MW2.', 'Insane processor, I put this thing on an H770 plus motherboard. Blazing fast cpu, 24c,32t this thing eats everything i throw. Fortnite 1.2k fps at 1080p, minecraft 1.3kfps at 1080p just all around winner; future proof i expect to get a good 8-10 years or so out of this cpu']

Product: AMD Ryzen™ 5 4500 6-Core, 12-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor with Wraith Stealth Cooler
Reviews: ['You get what you pay for on a budget CPU but better than a 4 core CPU for it price.USD$83 for a 6 core/ 12 threads CPU base Clock at 3.6GHz!It lost it performance if you compare others 6 core CPU due to it limited "L3 Cache 8MB"!It\'s not a bad CPU for it current price get this CPU instead of saving a few bucks on a 4 core CPU why not a 6 core CPU with decent 65w TPD :)If you wanted to buy a budget 4 core CPU I recommend this CPU for it value!If you want a CPU with 6 core and wanted good performance and not on budget get something else!Thank you!', "Ce processeur, assez dénigré par la plupart des testeurs, est  excellent de performance et de stabilité en rapport à son prix actuel.La plupart des benchmark utilisé, en terme de performance, équivaut au ryzen 7  1700, et dépassant dans certains cas le ryzen 7 2700Ces performances sont globalement proches de l'excellent ryzen 5 3600En lui faisant passer le test de stabilité, il ne bronche pas.J'ai été surprise par sa puissance, sa nervosité prêt à répondre  rapidement à la plupart des tâches sur lightroom, photoshop, première proConcernant les jeux (résident evil village, tomb raider 2020, last of us, ne l'ayant utilisé qu'en full hd, là encore, il ne bronche pas et dépasse rarement une température de 58°cTout ceci, avec les paramètres par défaut du bios, c'est à dire avec le turbo boost activé.Turbo boost qui me pose actuellement un problème :Le processeur joue au yoyo passant de basse fréquence à 4200 htz sans cesse.  Ce qui implique le mouvement constant des ventilateurs, ce qui peut être agaçant.Lorsque le processeur est très sollicité (à 4200 htz par défaut chez moi) , les températures grimpent et nécessite une bonne ventilation du boîtier. A prendre en compte si on veut utiliser tout le potentielde ce processeur.Le fonctionnement du processeur dépend aussi de tous ses composants et organisation du boîtier.En attendant de compléter mon équipement, et pour ne pas faire chauffer le processeur, il y a une solution : désactiver le turbo boost dans le bios.Cela le ramène à une température de 48°C max. quelques soient les activités (traitement d'images ou jeux) , cela le rend moins nerveux mais reste efficace.Bref, pour ce prix, c'est un excellent processeur. Attention toutefois à vérifier la compatibilité", 'Als passionierter Gamer und kreativer Content-Ersteller ist der AMD Ryzen 5 4500 Prozessor einfach ein wahrer Alleskönner!Die Leistung des Ryzen 5 4500 ist schlichtweg atemberaubend. Mit seinen 6 Kernen und 12 Threads sorgt er für eine unglaublich flüssige und reaktionsschnelle Performance, egal ob ich anspruchsvolle Spiele oder komplexe Multimedia-Aufgaben erledige. Die Geschwindigkeit, mit der der Prozessor arbeitet, hat meine Erwartungen weit übertroffen und lässt keine Wünsche offen.Die Energieeffizienz des Ryzen 5 4500 ist ebenfalls bemerkenswert. Trotz seiner starken Leistung verbraucht er vergleichsweise wenig Strom, was sich positiv auf meinen Energieverbrauch und meine Stromrechnung auswirkt. Das ist nicht nur umweltfreundlich, sondern auch ein wichtiger Faktor für mich als täglicher Nutzer meines PCs.Die Einrichtung des Prozessors war ein Kinderspiel, und die Kompatibilität mit meinem bestehenden System war perfekt. Ich musste keine Komponenten aufrüsten oder andere Änderungen vornehmen - es war ein problemloser Plug-and-Play-Prozess, der meinen Zeitaufwand minimierte.Zusammenfassend kann ich nur sagen, dass der AMD Ryzen 5 4500 Prozessor meine Erwartungen in jeder Hinsicht übertroffen hat. Seine Performance, Energieeffizienz, Kompatibilität und Preisgestaltung machen ihn zu einem absoluten Spitzenreiter in der Welt der Prozessoren. Egal, ob Sie ein Gamer, Content-Ersteller oder einfach nur ein PC-Enthusiast sind - der Ryzen 5 4500 wird Sie nicht enttäuschen!', 'Dopo un primo sconforto perché la mia scheda non lo vedeva, una volta aggiornato il BIOS tutto okQuindi super contento, avrei gradito qualche grammo di pasta termica in dotazione, ma mica posso chiedere la luna😂', "Rapport Performance/Prix juste imbattable pour ce Ryzen 5 4500 !Le ventirad fournis suffit à refroidir le processeur même pour une utilisation gaming.Idéal sur une config pro ou gaming petit budget avec une GTX1660 ou même une RTX 3060 !Notez qu'il faut absolument une carte graphique pour afficher une image car le processeur ne possède pas de chipset graphique intégré.", 'Processore dal basso costo ma dalle ottime prestazioni, non sarà un top di gamma dei processori, ma fa tutto adeguatamente dal navigare su internet a anche giocare a giochi tripla A recenti, se cercate qualcosa per montaggio video forse vi serve qualcosa come più core e frequenza più elevata.', 'Ce produit est trop bien pour son prix je vous conseille !', 'comprato per fare un upgrade al mio fisso, ovviamente spedizione puntuale e pacco in ottimo stato.', 'Estoy seguro que cuando lo agregué a la cesta de compra no ponía por ningún lado que se trataba de un producto usado, me llegó sin la caja (que me hacía mucha ilusión tenerla). Solo llegó el disipador de calor en su caja negra y, pegado con celo a esa caja, el procesador (dentro de su blister pero sin sellar). De momento funciona muy bien (tanto el ventilador como el procesador), es lo que esperaba, pero deberían ser más especificos y destacar bien cuando de trata de productos usados.', 'Love the CPU, threw out the stock fan cooler. Went and got an Arctic Freezer 7x, way better. The CPU does great for Converting Video and audio and light gaming. The stock cooler becomes a turbo jet loud when it sucks 100% on all 6 cores when Converting and shot the temps to 175 Degrees F. Went right back down after converting was done. Paired this with a B450 board and 32gb of 3600 ddr4 ram.']

Product: Intel® Core™ i5-11400 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.4 GHz LGA1200 (Intel® 500 Series & Select 400 Series Chipset) 65W
Reviews: ['Soy muy nuevo en el mundo de Ensamble de Computadoras, pero he de decir que he cumplido mi cometido con esté excelente procesador, funcional al 1000% en desempeño de trabajos de oficinas, escolar. En el gaming, excelente para bajos recursos no me ha decepcionado en juego como League Of Legends, Minecraft o Genshin Impact.Un procesador que vale la pena.', 'Stabile e potente con la gestione del video è un ottimo processore per chi non cerca il prodotto estremo.', "I use my system for 5 channel audio splitting and extensive photo editing through Photoshop CC '23. The CPU and associated internal graphics have so far not disappointed. With heavier image files (~33-37mb), the experience has been surprisingly good. At a cost of 12499, I think it offers excellent performance.Provided cooler seems to work fine for my use case, with highest temperature close to 60° on a hot summer day", 'Ottimo veloce e performante', 'Todo llego en buen tiempo, empacado de maravilla. Excelente desempeño, relación precio y las prestaciones para lo que requiero. No lo uso tanto para gamer pero quería algo intermedio para un desempeño óptimo para este armado.', 'processore di undicesima generazione con chip video, fa egregiamente il suo lavoro e non scalda particolarmente.', 'Perfeito', 'Go for it if you are tight on budget you can even play some games without gpu and is an efficient processor comes with Intel stock black fan with 3yrs warranty👍', 'Bought this processor with motherboard ASUS Prime H510M-E with GTX 1050 Ti 4GB graphics card and with Crucial RAM 8GB DDR4 3200MHz RAM. The M2 SSD which I used with the motherboard is Crucial P3 500GB PCIe 3.0 3D NAND NVMe M.2 SSD.Overall good processor for moderate to heavy tasks.', 'Good Product']

Product: AMD Ryzen 9 3900X Unlocked Desktop Processor
Reviews: ["Switched from intel to AMD and i think its a wise choice for me as my budget is tight.Tho AMD still losing abit or on par with intel processor and its a big thing for pricing wise!The only thing i'm worried is the prism cooler seems like leaking lubrication oil but im changing to full watercooling so should not bother me much.", 'Great product from AMD. The processor works right out of the box and offers great all round performance without breaking the bank. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a high performance computer. The only con I can think of is while the bundled cooler is great, it may struggle to cool this 12 core chip, depending on the ambience temp in your location.', "Amazing processor for the price that you can get it at now. If you're not a hardcore gamer that needs that extra 1 fps boost from an Intel cpu, this is way more worth it.", 'Very satisfy with the Ryzen 3900x performance, it is going into my Asus tuf x570 wifi MB', "Best processor I've ever owned my whole life.", 'works perfectly', 'It took a long while before the order was dispatched. To my horror it came without the CPU, just the Cooler fan in the box. The box was not sealed at all. How could this happen?', 'The seal is broken and the processor is missing. Only the cooler is in the box, I asked for a refund. I am very disappointed with Amazon, never buy from Amazon again!', 'Indicar que cuando recibí el paquete venia aplastado y roto (Se veía el contenido del paquete), en el interior de la caja venia sin papel burbuja, sólo con un trozo de papel acartonado, es un procesador, no es un balón de futbol, es delicado, y por suerte la caja del propio procesador protegió bien el contenido. De mano antes de pedir la mercancía me puse en contacto con el vendedor para indicarle que no quería un producto usado, reacondicionado o manipulado, de hecho, antes de abrir la caja hice un video realizándolo para curarme en salud, por suerte vino todo bien precintado y en perfecto estado. (Leí las reseñas de los usuarios y procedí así)Por una parte, tenemos el procesador Ryzen 3900X con 12 núcleos y 24 Hilos con frecuencia base de 3,8GHz y hasta 4,6GHz con socket AM4 y un TPD de 105w (Ojo que el consumo es bastante inferior, solo llega a ese extremo en renderizado y puntualmente)Lo tengo instalado en una placa base MSI PRESTIGE X570 CREATION con 32GB de RAM DDR4 a 3600MHz (G. Skill Trident Z adecuada para estos Ryzen) con refrigeración líquida NZXT Kraken X42 y su temperatura es de 34-38°C en procesos normales, jugando no pasa de los 50°C y renderizando no pasa de los 65°C (Temperatura ambiente 21°C)En relación con el disipador de serie (Probado pero reemplazado por refrigeración líquida que es más eficiente), es muy chulo, las luces RGB muy llamativas, buenas velocidades de ventilador para no meter mucho ruido (No es muy ruidoso a bajas temperaturas a altas es algo molesto)En la parte inferior del disipador de serie en vez de ser plano totalmente tiene 3 ranuras, en principio es para una mejor refrigeración pero que con la pasta térmica no hacen el contacto adecuado que debería y es fácil echar más pasta térmica de la adecuada y terminar con la pasta en sitios que no deberíaExisten termal-pad que te evita estos posibles problemas, pero por algún motivo en mi caso con la refrigeración líquida la temperatura es más alta que con la pasta térmica y eso de que es reutilizable en mi caso no ha sido así, ya que queda inservible (Hablo de 0,5 mm)*Un factor determinante a la hora de comprar este procesador y no un i9 9900k o i9 10900k han sido las vulnerabilidades que siguen afectando a Intel y que, aunque alguna este parcheada por software o por hardware no me convencía su compraRecomiendo este procesador porque es una pasada lo optimizado que va sobre todo para edición de video y para los más gamers para jugar, además su precio es muy bueno ahoraEso si es muy importante tener un hardware equiparable a nuestro procesador, (Una buena fuente de alimentación es primordial)* El consumo energético es bajo (Mi PC con todo suele consumir sobre 130-250W), dependiendo la carga de trabajo.** Mucho cuidado al poner pasta térmica, si pones de más límpialo en el zócalo, no vaya a ser que lo retires y parte de esa pasta pase a los pines.*** Ahora Ryzen saca la serie 5000, el equiparable al 3900X sería el 5900X, que si leemos las características y mejoras no lo veo una gran mejora, he tenido la opción de comprarlo, ya que socket y mi placa lo admite, pero por 200MHz no compensa. Además, pasa lo mismo con el 3900XT son 100MHz más. El 3900X me parece la mejor opción de compra además las BIOS ya está pulidas.**** Se supone que este procesador su frecuencia base es de 3,8GHz y llega hasta 4,6GHz, yo usando el modo automático de MSI trabaja todos los núcleos a 4,2GHz, todo esto a una temperatura de 36°C (Sin carga de trabajo), ahora en renderización de video llega a 4,3GHz pero nunca ha superado esos 4,3GHz (A ver si con las nuevas BIOS mejora esto)', "It is fast, runs cool, and has 12 cores and 24 threads. What's not to like?"]

Product: Intel Core i5-10400 Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.3 GHz  LGA1200 (Intel 400 Series Chipset) 65W, Model Number: BX8070110400
Reviews: ['Great for its price', 'Muy buena cpu calidad, rapidez con que llego a mi casa, se mantiene el rendimiento y calidad.', 'I used an aftermarket fan but aside from that my PC is pretty barebones and this CPU has really been impressive.I have not run into any trouble at all with it.Its very fast and runs cool.It handles every steam game I have easily and handles cad software I use to design PCBs with ease.So far I am very happy I went with 10th gen. Mientras en unos años ahorras para subir de nivel, está muy bien.', 'Excelente produto, eficiente e com desempenho muito bom.', 'Es un buen producto con buena relacion calidad precio y tiene buen desempeño', 'This cpu is better than my i7 I used to have with a higher clock speed and everything which is crazy', "This processor beats many i7, and isn't much below some i9.the 6 cores are regularly runnin at 4.0GHz with no heat problems with just a basic heat sink.This really is a fine fine processor. With benchmarks that reflect it.", '安定しています', 'Strong powerful for the money . Intel is #1']

Product: Intel Core i9-10900K Desktop Processor 10 Cores up to 5.3 GHz Unlocked  LGA1200 (Intel 400 Series Chipset) 125W
Reviews: ['O que é isso! Não é desse mundo! Quero dois, pra um pc do!', 'Uno di migliori', 'Solid for gaming, I have noticed a performance boost for sure. Easy install and great quality for the price. 10/10 overall worth it', "Personally I was scared to order such a CPU, however I just went for it and it came earlier than it should of, I built my pc up and downloaded the Intel drivers, after that I downloaded a few games and tested them out, immediately I noticed a difference, my fps doubled since my last pc. I was reallyimpressed by it. Also the cpu was running at more than 4GHz, nearly 5, so I didn't even want to OC it because it was already good enough. Personally I was impressed and glad that ordered it.", "Edited after exactly 1 month of use:THIS CPU IS A BEAST!!! IT RUNS EVERYTHING. With a good Cooler, Thermal Paste, and Case with good airflow it runs around 25-27° degrees doing normal stuff like navigating, and 32-38°C playing. Haven't got mayor temperatures playing games but it also depend on what are you playing. For example is not the same playing 2D than 3D or Open-World games. Have been playing shooters, GTA V and 2D platformers. One time I rendered a model on blender and it went to 60°C but it was a one time thing, also I was using the integrated graphics (UHD 630) so the CPU couldn't resist that much. With a decent GPU runs smoothly.Anyway... What are you waiting to buy this?First of all, I must clarify that I've bought directly from 'amazon.com' and not any other third party store.At first I was a little worried that the box would come with that square shape and not with the fancy one, but doing some research I realized that after the next generation intel came out, they simplified the 10th generation box so no problem with that, also it's just a box so who really cares.By the way I checked the CPU thoroughly and it doesn't have any details, it's completely new and it came with all its certification, stamps, even its manual and everything well sealed and no fingerprints anywhere.To finish, the package was intact and very well protected.  I could buy again here. 10 out of 10, four spoons, A+, a regular.. tomato? 🍅 Whatever that means.. VERY NICEU CAESAR-CHAN!!.... I'm sorry, forget that.Finally, nice product. Thank you Amazon for everything!", 'Night and day difference with PC I would highly recommend.', 'El procesador ha cumplido los requerimientos que demandan los software con los que trabajo le doy un 10', 'As it should be, brand new, mint condition, no issues.', 'Super leistungsstarker Prozessor!!!Hatte schon einen recht Leistungstarken PC mit einem i7 4930k und habe mir jetzt den Rechner neu aufgebaut mit diesem Prozessor als Basis. Ich werde quasi weggepustet von der Leistung. Zusammen mit der  Wasserkühlung (Corsair h100x) ist die Leistung im  Gaming-, Musik- u. Videosektor dieses Prozessors mehr als Begeisternd (hab ihn auf 10 Kerne x 5,10 GHz, stabil bei 30-50°C). Multitasking der nächsten Generation ist angesagt.Außer dem Preis ist es einfach nur ein Traum :-) Aber am Ende muss ich sagen, das Geld hat sich mehr als gelohnt....', 'Treated myself to this LGA1200 and a Z590 no complaints they perform great just as I expected']

Reviews: ['Good product... delivery protect very good....', 'This processor is a monster. If you dont want to have to worry about buying a cpu for a few years, this is the one. Personally, i use the Noctua NH-D15 cooler and it does a phenomenal job of keeping this cpu cool. I highly. recommend installing Intel’s XTU program, which will allow you to manage the cpu in many ways. Good cpu.', 'O produto chegou rápido e bem embalado dentro de uma caixa Amazon. Isso demonstra o cuidado com um produto caríssimo e frágil. Ainda não instalei nem abri o box mas acredito que esteja ok. Se houver alguma surpresa volto aqui para avisar.', 'Got this for a steal on Prime day and it works great with the system! Handles schoolwork, multitasking, and gaming with ease! The iGPU works fairly well on its own too (used it for about a week while waiting for my 4070-Ti). Great performance for price!', 'La caja venía con el sello roto, sin embargo, el procesador esta en buen estado y funcionando.', 'Amazing CPU for my gaming rig. The price quality is just right and not insane compare to the 13th gen i9. This CPU is future proof for the next 5-7 years. Definitely a steal for its price in today market.', 'Not much to say about it.  NICE AND POWERFUL.  Built my PC around Video and Photo Editing.  With this built into my setup it does the Job nicely.', 'great processor but hot, Therefore, good cooling and a little tweaking in the BIOS is desirable', 'высокий класс!!!', 'This beast of a CPU arrived on time and was well packaged. I bought this for a new gaming monster of a computer.Pros: Easy to mount. My CPU with little to no over clocking, runs at 3.5Ghz. With some fine tuning, it can run stability at 5.7Ghz on all cores with Efficiency cores running at 3.8Ghz. Awesome!!!Cons: Pricey considering the 13th generation is only $120 more dollars than this at the time of purchase. Ran into some issues with the CPU being recognized, but with a BIOS update, fixed. No other problems that i can find. If I find any I will update this review.Overall I think this CPU is an awesome one. It has definitely has made my build a beast of a machine!! I recommend this to anyone that doesn’t want to upgrade to Intels 13th generation CPUs!!']

Product: AMD Ryzen™ 7 7700X 8-Core, 16-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor
Reviews: ["I decided to upgrade from AM4 and my 5800X to this beast of a cpu, the 7700X. On the one hand, I now have a brand, spanking new AM5 platform and cpu. On the other hand, it was a very expensive upgrade due to the stupidly high early adopter tax. I also had to buy two new modules of M.2 (pcie) SSD's because AM5 does not support sata based M.2. A very expensive investment indeed.Back to the 7700X. I am very happy. It is definitely faster than my 5800X and notably more snappy in various programs such as video editing and gaming. I can believe AMD's claims that it is 13% faster than the 5800X.I do not understand why some people (I will come back to this) are complaining about it being too hot, etc. Yes, it does run hot (but so does 12 and 13 gen intel), but the 7700X is nowhere as hot as intel.When I had PBO and auto-OC activated for my 5800X, the Noctua industrial fans on my air cooler were running at full pelt and sounded like a jet engine. The 5800X also ran hot, at up to 70c. In the end, I deactivated PBO and auto-OC to get far better thermals and acoustics (but at a cost of somewhat decreased performance).The 7700X did run hot under load with PBO and auto-OC turned on, as I saw temperatures go up to 57c on tasks. With gaming, it would go up to 65c (depending on the game). At idle, my 7700X would sit at circa 45c.After a bit of tinkering in BIOS and disabling PBO and auto-OC, my 7700X is currently sitting at a very comfortable and constant 35c. This is with a single tower air cooler and two fans (same cooling solution as with my 5800X).Also, during activated PBO and auto-OC, my fans were only intermittently running like jet engines and then would calm down (7700X). With these two features deactivated, my Arctic Freezer Esport34 duo air cooler is now running almost silently.To summarise, my 7700X is definitely running cooler and faster than my previous 5800X under different BIOS scenarios and work loads.Note - For the very first time, AMD has included a built in (integrated) graphics chip for 7 series Ryzen (including my 7700X). I have not yet tested the iGPU, but I will in due course, when the time is right. I will then update my review.Moving on, particularly to one individual who posted a review on 07/10/22 and was whining about the cost of the 7700X and heat output. Yes the release MSRP for the 7700X is over-priced at between £430 and £440 in UK, whilst it is selling for $400 in USA (when the 5800X was released, the UK msrp was £400).IMHO, the 7700X should not be more than £380. Sadly, the current high price is mostly due to the atrocious state of the british economy, with some good old fashioned price gouging thrown in for good measure.I also remember when Zen1 was released in March 2017, the 1800X (which I purchased) was retailing for £500, the 1700X at £400 and 1700 non-X at £340.This individual was also whining about the supposedly bad physical design for Ryzen 7K series cpu as the metal lid is sitting c.4mm higher on the actual chip. He claimed the thermal paste kept dripping down the sides of the metal plate and it was so bad that Noctua were forced to release an AM5 cpu guard (NATPG1).From my own experience, I have had no such issues whatsoever. So this dribbling TP problem comes down to user error and especially competency (more specifically, lack thereof). Mind you, I have been building pc's since March 2007, so I have a lot of experience.Hurdygurdy then concluded that Ryzen-7 and X670 is very difficult to justify at such absurdly hiked up msrp. He even stated that entry level X670 was grossly over priced at £500 and concluded he would be migrating back to intel, bearing in mind the imminent release of Raptor Lake.Please ignore his review as he is clearly an intel fanboy. First of all, who shells out >£1K for an AM5 platform and then decides he does not like it, due to high msrp and heat issues?. If you did not like the price of AM5 and 7700X, then why did you supposedly buy it in the first place?.Secondly, entry level AM5 mobos do not cost £500. In fact, my top dog Gigabyte Aorus Master X670E cost £500. The entry level X670-P mobo msrp starts at £268. The entry level X670E mobo msrp start at £300.Let me put things in perspective by now comparing the 7700X (8c/16t) to intel Raptor Lake. The 13700K Raptor Lake (8 Performance cores/16t with 8 economy cores/8t) costs £500 and the last generation 12700K Alder Lake (8c/16t) costs £416. This is in stark contrast to the new architecture 7700X which cost £430. So if you want the 13700K, that is an extra £70 you have to shell out. But is it worth the extra expenditure?. I will come to that later on.As mentioned, my AM5 mobo cost £500 and if I look at exactly the same brand/model mobo but for intel platform (Gigabyte Aorus Master, Z790, LGA 1700), then it is costing £620. For around the £500 price point, I am seeing the mid range Z790-F for £480. So the same tier intel mobo is £120 more expensive. Again, is it worth the extra expenditure?.IMHO, it most definitely is not as the Gigabyte AM5 and Z790 variants have very similar features.The only price advantage that the Z790 has over AM5 is that it is compatible with DDR4 and DDR5, whereas AM5 is compatible only with DDR5. TBH, I purchased from Amazon, a Crucial 16GB DDR5 module for £64. So not bad at all.In terms of benchmark comparisons, according to WCCFTECH, RGT, etc the 7700X is virtually on par with the last gen 5900X (12c/24t). That is a very good performance upgrade.According to Hardware Times, the 7700X narrowly beats the i7-13700K in gaming, but the 7700X is slightly slower in (synthetic) content creation.According to benchmarks by Hardware unboxed, the 13700K is only 3% to 7% faster than the 7700X in gaming (dependent on different games) and about 4% to 10% faster in productivity (depending on different productivity tasks).Ultimately, it comes down to buyer preference. I see no benefit is shelling out c. £200 more for an intel platform.On hindsight, I should have upgraded my 5800X to a 5900X (£330 new in June 2022). This would have been the cheapest and most convenient upgrade option. I could then sit tight and wait for the MSRP of AM5 and Ryzen-7 to drop down to a more palatable level (Q1-23), bearing in mind Zen4 global sales have been very poor due to the high prices of Zen4, AM5 mobos and having to migrate to expensive DDR5 RAM. As a result, AMD has made the decision to cut back Zen4 production in order to keep msrp artificially high (instead of maintaining Zen4 production and reducing msrp to sensible levels, which would encourage consumer purchasing). AMD is now adopting the same policies as intel and nvidia.", 'Sin duda es un procesador muy potente, pero que con un Noctua NH-D15 ( que es lo mejorcito del mercado en refrigeración por aire ) se ponga a mas de 90 grados a la mínima que le metes un poco de caña, me parece una burrada, por mucho que AMD diga que estos procesadores de la serie 7000 están preparados para eso...Por muy preparados que estén, esas temperaturas van a afectar, si o si, a su vida útil y a la de los demás componentes que están dentro de tu equipo...Y los que sepáis un poco del tema me diréis que puedo poner el procesador en modo "Eco" utilizando el software AMD Ryzen Master ( o modificarlo a través de la BIOS ) y así será mas difícil que llegue a esas temperaturas.... Pues sí, así es, aunque a cambio su rendimiento se verá ligeramente afectado... Y, al menos a mi, no me parece muy normal comprar un procesador y limitar su rendimiento, por poco que sea, para que funcione a unas temperaturas mínimamente aceptables... ( tampoco mucho mas aceptables ).Otra cosa que no me termina de convencer es la forma de funcionar de estos Ryzen y que ya era similar en los anteriores. Concretamente los continuos "spikes" o "picos" de frecuencia a la que funcionan los núcleos del procesador y por consiguiente también picos de temperatura y acelerones de los ventiladores del refrigerador, que por muy silenciosos que sean, llega a apreciarse y es bastante molesto en un entorno silencioso.Por último, el consumo del que tanto se habla últimamente... Pues bien, si hipotéticamente tuvieses tu procesador trabajando al 100%, tu Ryzen consumiría menos que un Intel de características similares...PERO, cuánto tiempo tienes el procesador trabajando al 100% y cuánto tiempo en lo que se llama "idle" o mínimamente activo? Pues para el uso típico de un usuario medio, el procesador va a estar en "idle" muchísimo mas tiempo que trabajando a tope, y en ese estado, el Intel va a consumir mucho menos... No lo digo yo ( que también, porque lo he comprobado ) sino todos los test que se han hecho al respecto y que decidí investigar al ver el alto consumo de este 7700X en reposo o "idle".No me enrollo mas. Aun estoy en duda si quedarme con él o devolverlo y cambiarlo por un Intel como por ejemplo el i5-13500, que siendo mas barato, gracias a su mayor cantidad de núcleos, en productividad está mas o menos a la altura de este Ryzen 7700X.', "Meant to buy a 7600x for a friend but didn't realize i had gotten this one, but it works perfect and can handle what you throw at it. Only issue i've ran into (when i say i, i mean the friend i gave it to who has then told me the issues he ran into) was that when you're on linux and don't currently have a gpu installed, the APU sort of just doesn't desire to operate as it should and you wind up with a solid white desktop environment with nothing else. But if you only use a TTY then you're good to go! But for most i would recommend getting a gpu alongside it if you're on linux until amd decides to offer better support for the APU inside of it. From my experience tho, the APU works just fine on windows, and perfect on linux if not using the APU.", "I recently upgraded my PC with the AMD Ryzen 7 7700X processor and paired it with an RTX 4060 GPU and an Asus B650 motherboard. The performance has been outstanding.The AMD Ryzen 7 7700X, with its 8 cores and 16 threads, has significantly boosted my PC's processing power. It handles multitasking, gaming, and content creation with ease. Plus, being unlocked, it's a dream for overclocking enthusiasts.Whether I'm gaming at high settings or working on resource-intensive tasks, this processor delivers exceptional performance and efficiency. It's a fantastic choice for anyone looking to elevate their computing experience.", "While part of me almost bought the 7800X3D since at the time I bought this the X3D was only 85 bucks Extra. I'm Happy with what I got this does everything I need it to do and Its been an Excellent chip.Don't Forget to buy a CPU cooler with this as the 7700X Doesn't come with a Boxed Cooler. Paired mine with a Noctua NH-U12A Chromax Black + Noctua 7mm Offset Brackets & Noctua AM5 Thermal Paste Guard (fills in the gaps with a plastic cover to prevent thermal paste from seeping between the IHS gaps on AM5 Processors.)", 'El mejor procesador que he tenido hasta la fecha, como un cohete, la verdad que en cuanto a calidad/precio podríamos estar ante el mejor del mercado, recomiendo encarecidamente que si estás mirando si comprar un modelo inferior o este apostar por este pues será una mejor inversión a largo plazo.', "Preso questo 7700X per mandare in pensione il 3800X e il salto di prestazioni è qualcosa di incredibile. Per tutti quelli che, come me inizialmente, sono un po' spaventati dalle temperature notoriamente elevate di questa serie 7000; non temete, i processori di questa specifica generazione sono progettati apposta per operare a temperature discretamente più alte di quello che ci si aspetterebbe, è tutto nella norma e confermato da AMD. Una volta viste le prestazioni che sono in grado di tirare fuori ho capito il perché delle temperature, davvero impressionante! Questa serie è micidiale! Un consiglio che posso darvi tuttavia qualora voleste ottimizzare il rapporto prestazioni/temperature (+ RPM di sistema) è quello di o effettuare un leggerissimo undervolt o semplicemente abbassare la temperatura massima da 95 gradi a 85 gradi dal bios. Non si perde praticamente nulla in performance ma si ottimizzano di MOLTO sia le temperature che (di conseguenza) il profilo sonoro del sistema nel caso abbiate una fan curve un po' aggressiva, come la mia.", 'Hey! Ich habe mir die beiden Prozessoren, den 7700X und den 7700, genauer angesehen, und ich möchte dir mitteilen, dass ich mich letztendlich für den 7700 entschieden habe. Warum? Nun, es gibt einen deutlichen Unterschied beim Kühlen dieser beiden CPUs.Der 7700X hat eine TDP von 105, was bedeutet, dass er mehr Wärme erzeugt und schwieriger zu kühlen ist, insbesondere in kleineren Gehäusen wie ITX oder M-ATX. Bei solchen Gehäusen ist die Wärmeableitung oft eine Herausforderung, und ein Prozessor mit höherer TDP kann zu höheren Temperaturen führen, die die Leistung beeinträchtigen oder sogar zu thermischen Problemen führen können.Aus diesem Grund habe ich mich für den 7700 entschieden, der eine niedrigere TDP von nur 65 hat. Mit dieser geringeren TDP produziert er weniger Wärme und ist einfacher zu kühlen. Dies ist besonders wichtig, wenn du ein kompaktes Gehäuse verwendest, da die begrenzte Größe den Luftstrom und die Kühlung beeinträchtigen kann.Dank der niedrigeren TDP des 7700 kannst du eine bessere Kontrolle über die Temperaturen in deinem System haben und somit eine stabilere Leistung gewährleisten. Du kannst einen Kühler wählen, der besser zu deinen Bedürfnissen passt und die optimale Kühlung für deine CPU bietet.Insgesamt bin ich mit meiner Wahl des AMD 7700 zufrieden, da ich dadurch in meinem ITX- oder M-ATX-System eine bessere Kühlung erreichen kann. Die niedrigere TDP macht einen deutlichen Unterschied und sorgt dafür, dass mein Prozessor auch unter Last kühl bleibt.Ich hoffe, diese Bewertung hilft dir bei deiner Entscheidung, und wenn du weitere Fragen hast, stehe ich gerne zur Verfügung!', 'Utilizando em uma Asus Tuf Gaming B650M Wifi. Ficou show.', 'Ottimo processore, mi sta dando belle soddisfazioni. Rispetto ai processori di alcuni fa i Ryzen 7000 scaldano un pò, ma vale anche gli Itel. Con i primi bios i 7000 scaldavano parecchio, ad eccezione forse del 7600x che rimane un pò più fresco. Con gli ultimi bios però la situazione è migliorata e adesso sono molto più gestibili.N.B. dal 7700x in su servirà un dissipatore di una certa qualità, preferibilmente a liquido. Io ho un Bè Quiet Pure Loop 2 FX 280mm e mi sto trovando bene. Sotto un 280mm non andrei.']

Product: AMD Ryzen™ 9 7950X 16-Core, 32-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor
Reviews: ["What I like to do is run CPU intensive things in the background while also playing games. Often times I can go in Ryzen Master and drop the clock and voltage down and things still run at a satisfying degree. I've used this playing at 1080p-2160p. Top to bottom no issues. Like 2 months later the 7950x3D was on sale for what I bought this for but it is what it is. AM4 lasted a long time. Someday I'll be buying some x3D 16 core from the last AM5 gen CPUs.It's great when you have software that lets you choose to encode/simulate on the CPU and set how many cores to use. Give 8c/16th  and play games without issue. I've kept up with bios updates so I haven't had issues with the overvolting EXPO stuff that was in the news. I use a Thermaltake Peerless Assassin to cool it  and that's been adequate even when playing at stock voltages where it hits those 95 celcius temps. You can undervolt this thing, drop the clocks a bit and the performance difference is negligible.If you're a software developer, you'll enjoy the amount of cores for running VMs, docker containers, compiling software, etc. I like photography so enjoy playing with RAW photos in Darktable and mild things in Krita. Going from a 4770k to this was a pretty massive change.I feel like people buying CPUs seperate probably know what to expect. I was able to run a 4770k for 8 years. I don't want to run this for 8 years but I wouldn't be surprised if the performance in games at 2160p is so minor that I just keep going on with this and occasionally upgrading the graphics card", 'As a software developer, I spend a great deal of time compiling thousands of lines of C++ code so need a CPU that has exceptional multi-core performance.  I bought the Ryzen 9 7950X for a new AM5 build to replace an ageing 10th generation i7 and I was delighted with the performance.My previous system took almost 5 minutes to do a full build of my project but this CPU has cut the build time to under 30 seconds. I highly recommend this CPU if you have a requirement for heavy multi-core processing.', '(geschrieben am 08.09.2023)Absoluter hammer das Teil,  sehr stabil und macht bis jetzt  keine anzeichen von fehlern in denn Berechnungen / Gameing .Das einzige was  vielleicht abschrecken könnte ist die hohe belastungs Temperatur,eine reine  luft kühlung könnte zu wenig sein (hängt von der Gehäuselüftung  ab).Wenn möglich  würde ich sagen besorgt man sich am besten noch eine Wasserkühlung (AIO reicht schon).', 'Mostly been on Intel chips for the last 40+ years. But I like to give the other guy a go if they have a competitive product.', 'Build:  AMD Ryzen 9 7950X  MSI MPG X67E Carbon  G.Skill Trident Z5 NEO RGB F5-6000J3040G32GX2-TZ5NR  (AMD Expo 2 x 32GB DDR5 6000 CL30-40-40-96)  Crucial T700 1TB Gen5 NVMe M.2 (CT1000T700SSD3)The DDR5 runs solid at 6000MHZ.The gen 5 Crucial T700 gets 11700MB/sec.FAST!!!The only caution is that this CPU is tuned to run up to 95 degrees C to get all this performance.Be sure to have a good cooler.', "I can run every core at 5500mhz, for hours, with just a little overclocking, core tuning, and a good 360mm AIO. This is just an amazing amount of computational power for a home computer.  The best part, I have it tuned such that I can do this while it runs at 65c (vs 95c).  This is an enthusiast CPU, and you will want to watch a lot of videos on how to tune and optimize it, and if you don't have excellent cooling, you will never get the performance you paid dearly for.  This thing rocks, and handles any task I throw at it with zero hesitation.  AM5 is also relatively future-proof for a while.  :)", 'amazing performance, bought it for my 3d workstation and it makes everything I throw at it a breeze!', 'El producto llegó a tiempo y perfectamente sellado. Es excelente para computadoras gamer de gama media, no es necesario el overclock pero enfriamiento líquido es recomendado aún sin esta modalidad.', 'Gute Leistung schlecht zum OC', 'The best processor ever']

Product: Intel Core i5-10400F Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.3 GHz Without Processor Graphics LGA1200 (Intel 400 Series chipset) 65W, Model Number: BX8070110400F
Reviews: ["Quality good but without graficcard it's not working, so better to purchase with grafic card", 'Shipment arrived on time and in great shape. Product was exactly as advertised, works great!', '', 'Processeur 6C/12T qui reste encore très performant en 2023 , ne chauffe pas beaucoup et une consommation électrique maitrisé , 9W en idle,  entre 30 et 50W en gaming selon les jeux,  et au maximum 88W pendant un stress test très exigeant.', "Make sure to read the details! I tried to boot my system up before I had my graphics card and it wasn't working. This requires a discreet (external) graphics card! No integrated graphics. oh duh haha", "Surely buy good processor with this price but we couldn't get display without graphics card", 'Nice working', 'I had a 7600k I-5 And felt for an upgrade since it had lower threads than this one. It is amazing great value and would recomend it to those who are looking for a less pricey upgrade for gaming.', 'buon processore di 10a generazione molto performante al pari di un i7', 'Não é muito forte hoje em dia, mas é a melhor opção custo benefício da Intel, bom, uma delas.']

Product: Intel Core i5-9600KF Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz Turbo Unlocked Without Processor Graphics LGA1151 300 Series 95W
Reviews: ['The product is legitimate and the item was received smoothly. Only issue I had was the box arrived pretty dented. While the processor itself was working and does not looked damaged, I wished the product would be delivered in a nicer condition.', 'I have receive the product is very good quality thanks.', 'good job keep up', 'This is the top-end Coffee Lake i5, I believe. Works great for my purposes, although I have not tried overclocking it. With my (suspectedly sub-standard) cooling, I can get sustained all-core turbo boost of 4.3 GHz, which is below the advertised maximum but I have it in a very cramped mini-ITX case.', 'very epic if u have a 1660 super', 'Great offer', 'Good good good', 'Received box like this, ugly, when trying to check barcode this sticker they put makes it impossible to see S-spec number', "Nel corso di questi tre anni, l'i5-9600K ha vissuto momenti di intensa attività e giornate di relativa tranquillità. Dal fotoritocco al rendering, passando per sessioni di gaming ad alta definizione, non c'è stato un solo momento in cui abbia sentito il bisogno di un processore più potente. Il vero test, però, è arrivato quando ho iniziato a lavorare da casa, dovendo gestire diverse applicazioni contemporaneamente. Nonostante il carico di lavoro, l'i5-9600K ha dimostrato di essere all'altezza della situazione, permettendomi di svolgere le mie attività senza alcun rallentamento.Punti di Forza:Il principale punto di forza di questo processore è senza dubbio la sua performance. L'i5-9600K è infatti un vero e proprio campione di velocità e multitasking, capace di gestire anche i carichi di lavoro più pesanti senza alcun problema. Inoltre, nonostante le elevate prestazioni, il calore generato rimane sempre nei limiti della norma, un dettaglio non da poco se consideriamo che un'eccessiva temperatura può ridurre la vita del processore e danneggiare altri componenti del PC.Punti di Debolezza:Nonostante l'i5-9600K sia un ottimo processore, non è esente da difetti. Il primo è legato al costo: se da un lato la qualità e le prestazioni sono indubbie, dall'altro il prezzo potrebbe risultare proibitivo per chi sta assemblando un PC con un budget limitato. Un altro aspetto da considerare è l'assenza di un dissipatore nella confezione, elemento che dovrà quindi essere acquistato separatamente. Infine, per sfruttare al meglio le capacità di overclocking dell'i5-9600K, sarà necessario disporre di una scheda madre e di un sistema di raffreddamento adeguati.Conclusioni:Nonostante alcune piccole pecche, l'i5-9600K è un processore che consiglierei senza esitazioni. Che siate gamer, professionisti o semplici appassionati di informatica, con questo prodotto avrete a disposizione un componente capace di fare la differenza. A tre anni dal mio acquisto, posso affermare di essere pienamente soddisfatto della mia scelta e di non aver mai avuto motivi per pentirmi.", 'Produto chegou.']

Product: ASUS - ROG Zephyrus G14 AMD Ryzen 7 6800HS Mobile Processor (8-core/16-thread, 20MB cache, up to 4.7 GHz max boost)| AMD Radeon RX 6700S | 1TB SSDn| 16GBDDR4 RAM (GA402RJ-0088E6800HS)

Product: Intel Core i7-12700KF Desktop Processor 12 (8P+4E) Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked  LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Reviews: ['I felt that Amazon should provide the Intel CPU fan as well as a package deal. The CPU is already so pricey and throwing in a standard CPU fan would not hurt Amazon bottom line.', 'los amo con toda mi alma, creo que se les acabo en stock cuando lo pedi, porque me llego un 13700k, pero en la etiqueta de envio decia 12700fkLOS AMO', 'I like Intel processors. Been building primarily Intel based computers since my first 386SX 16 back in about 1991. I just never have issues with Intel builds like I have with other vendors. This i7 is no different. It’s fast and stable with a moderately priced air cooler. No issues. Rock solid. I think this 12th gen is currently the best bang for the buck as of late summer 2023.', "I'm upgrading from an old AMD FX 8320 chip and that was an 8 core 8 thread 3.5ghz cpu. i could overclock it to 4ghz no problem but it was DDR3 1600mhz ram. This thing crush's that chip like there is no tomorrow. I have this chip paired with Corsair Vengeance DDR5 5200 RAM, a Asus TUF Z690,1X Fire Cuda 530 Gen 4 NVMe SSD, Alseye M120D cooler and a case with 7 fans, crushed 4tb data file transfers across old drives in about 12 hours, never got hotter then 62C in any of my bench tests and maintains an average temp of 35C while general use. startup is 0-15C until you heat it up first time then it doesn't seem to drop below 32 until a shut down for a while. I had it off all day on second day, turned it on and logged in, got distracted on my cell phone for 1 hour then looked at temp, and it was 12C. checked 3 different sources all read same. then i ran a game for 15 mins and it got to 43C. i stopped the game and left it for an hour to see what it did with nothing really running. it immediately dropped to 36 when i shut game off within under 5 seconds.After 20 mins of it pegged at 36 i maxed out the fans then took the hour to drop to 32 to see if it made a difference. 0 change.  anyway Skoocum chip and it isn't even the best you can get right now. plus gen 14 is right around corner ;)", 'Conseguí este procesador a un precio increíble, no dudé en comprarlo, es rápido y los núcleos e hilos extras que lleva me resultan muy útiles.', "I bought this CPU with internal graphics primarily to have backup if my primary installed GPU should fail. Also for the speed and quality of the CPU itself, it satisfies. But the internal graphics not so much. I used it's graphics for the time I was shopping and waiting for my ordered GPU and was not impressed. I would never want to depend on it permanently. My TV monitor continually had issues with detecting it's source and would drop connection on occasion, forcing me to have to continually reset HDMI cable in it's port. A real irritation and pain. Is this a problem with the MBs HDMI port or the CPU. I don't know, but either way it ain't good. Nor did I care much for the overall look of the graphics it provided. Just not quality.I have been using a big screen TV for a monitor my for many years and never had this issue, so I don't think it's the TV. Still the cost of an I7 K vs an I7 KF is negligible so why not go for the one with graphics in case I ever need it. For a short while.", 'Great product.', 'It performs great and with the help of the e-cores, I can browse my website with lower power consumption.', 'I accidentally bought the i7 (this one) vs the i9. Used it in a different setup and worked exactly as expected. No issues with bent pins or a bad processor. If anything changes I’ll be sure to update.', 'It’s a good CPU, but I had the wrong motherboard which meant I also had to get new RAM. I managed to upgrade my PC with about a 500 dollar budget.']

Product: Intel Core i9-12900K Desktop Processor 16 (8P+8E) Cores up to 5.2 GHz Unlocked LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Reviews: ['Se siente mucho la diferencia en el cambio de AMD a Inter, es mucho más estable y más fluido, sus drivers están bien optimizados y corre espectacular, no se calienta, incluso al 100% de uso se mantiene en los 70 grados', 'Are usually go for the best products and it was a mistake for my first PC build I chose this chip and I didn’t know it runs that hot I built my PC I had enough fans but I had a 240 mm radiator I want a Micro Center and had to get a 360 mm cooler from the pool. The temps were at 89 to 92°C after the deep cool AIO under stress, test and bench testing the temp stay under 60°C , other than that I game hard on it and stream and the CPU usage never goes past 30%. It’s pretty overkill but that’s how I like my PC.', 'This thing was so patient with me as I turned it on without a cooler several times because my pump was failing. Sure it shut off when it hit ~102 Celsius but there was no long term damage and now it serves me well with a working pump. We love to see it.', "Bought this CPU on sale, and it runs fast and stays cool. Mine is running at 5.2 ghz with temps in the 40's on AIO on an ASRock Z790m ITX. I am super impressed at this combination of speed and reasonable temps. Have not gamed yet, but I expect killer performance!!", 'This CPU is top quality, it is easy to install and works great for gaming, it stays cool and I have had no problems with it.', 'Läuft super und keine Beanstandungen!', "Bought for a friend's computer I was building. I got it in the Prime sale and it's fantasticly fast", "I purchase this CPU 1 year ago and it cost me 74,000 JPY back then.the price didn't drop much since that time and the performance is satisfying so far.the new generation spec is higher so if you want to buy this CPU don't. instead, you can buy i7 Gen13 as it will have the same spec plus a better cache than the 12 Gen.it might be better to buy the K version in case you have issues with your GPU to troubleshoot.", 'I was going to go for the 13900k but I took this one for half of the price and have to tell u love it thank you', 'Purchased this for my new rig as opposed to an i7 based on price point at time of purchase (this was actually cheaper than the i7).Paired with RTX 4060TI 8GB.NO regrets.This can handle anything I throw at it, without issue (gaming wise) and never goes above 50/55C (not overclocked and cooled with 240MM AIO from Corsair) Idles around 32/33CVery responsive with plenty of clearance if I ever want to OC this guy.Heat was a concern after reading reviews and only having a 240MM radiator (sitting over a 4060Ti), but no issues - heat or performance) at all.Great time to buy with new gen just arriving recently.']

Product: Intel Core i7-10700K Desktop Processor 8 Cores up to 5.1 GHz Unlocked  LGA1200 (Intel 400 Series Chipset) 125W (BX8070110700K)
Reviews: ['Perfect for my 3070 build!', 'Super!!', 'Die CPU läuft und läuft und läuft. Der Einbau ist wie immer bei CPUs sehr einfach.', '(a) Considering its current price and given that its gaming performance (without power limits) is overall identical to the 11700k (without power limits too) and just 3-4% slower overall than the 5800x I would say this cpu is the best choice for gaming. After overclocking it actually beats or matches the 5800x overall even when compared against a PBOed 5800x. By "overall" I mean when comparing these cpus in a large range of games (30+ games) and not just 4-5, (something that some biased reviews do)(b) Productivity is very good too although in heavy multithreaded applications (e.g. tile-based rendering) it does lose by 10-20% to both the 11700k and the 5800x. That said it reduces the deficit to only 3-15% in an overclocked vs overclocked battle, thanks to its higher overclocking potential.(c) It runs pretty cool - I am using a Noctua NH-D15 and is also very silent. Even on stock auto motherboard settings (and with power limits removed) I don\'t get temps above 68-69C even when running Cinebench R23 in a loop and sustaining indefinitely the stock all-core 4.7GHz. Temps reduce further when you manually tune the voltage to a lower value (a practice known as undervolting) or when you apply a better thermal paste or a case with better airflow. You can also undervolt and still overclock. Or overclock more without increasing the voltage above its stock value.(d) I paired it with a fairly high-end Asus Z490 (Strix-E) board instead of a Z590 one.  There is no reason buying a Z590 board for 10th gen cpus as for the same price you typically don\'t get "enthusiast" features (such as postcode, third PCIe x16 slot, PCIe bifurcation, etc). Moreover most of the "goodies" of the Z590 boards (e.g. PCIe4, additional M.2 slot, DMI3x8) are only enabled when using an 11th gen cpu. So buying a Z590 for 10th gen is a bit of a waste.(e) Currently the price of the 11700K +Z590 is around 200 euros higher than that of the 10700K+Z490 combo. If the difference drops to 60-80 euros then I would advise to go for the former instead. But as of now the 10700K+Z490 combo is the wiser choice.', 'Don’t let the 125w TDP fool ya because this chip runs WAY cooler than previous gens. Tested temps using OCCT stress test for about 3 hours, alongside my Noctua NH-D15 cooler. The highest I’ve seen the temp spike up to was 71c. Note that OCCT is a heavy synthetic test that pushes the CPU to the limit. Regular gaming temps will never reach that high. I’ve had the chip for almost two months now and accumulated quite a bit of gaming hours during that time. The games I played included a mix of intensive AAA titles like CoD Warzone and AC: Odyssey to light eSport ones such as Rocket League and Rainbow Six Siege. Highest temps are always in the 50s to mid 60s range. That is a huge difference compared to my old i5 6600k that spiked to over 80c at times! My brother who bought a 9900k last year was also amazed by how much cooler 10th gen runs and even said that he wished he waited a bit longer before upgrading. Note that both the 9900k and 6600k have lower TDPs than the 10700k yet still run warmer. The reason as to why 10th gen runs cooler is because intel made modifications to the IHS of the cpu and upgraded their Thermal Interface Material. Other then the improvement in the temperature department, I’ve also noticed a big difference in gaming performance. Despite having a 2080 super, my PC used to struggle to reach and stay at a consistent 100+fps at 1080p. CPU intensive games like AC Odyssey often dropped to like 50fps. This is a clear indication that there was bottleneck on the CPU side. With this new 10700k, My PC now has no problems reaching and maintaining that sweet consistent 144+ FPS on light competitive eSport titles and 100+FPS on demanding CPU intensive AAA titles. Also, note that I am running the CPU at stock settings right out the box and have not messed with overclocking yet. Nonetheless, I am very satisfied with this CPU and I highly recommend it.', "While a good idea anyway, with many processors now utilizing stock overclocks, you can benefit a performance boost by choosing a better CPU cooler. I went the cheap route, actually, I thought it was middle of the road since the Thermaltake Contac Silent 12 is rated for 150w. I thought I could get away with a $30 cooler since I am not planning on overclocking. That cooler could not even keep up with stock CPU settings. In benchmarks the CPU hit 80-Celsius in seconds and gradually up to 90 where I had it set to throttle. In more practical testing, under basic workloads the temps are more reasonable but the Contac Silent 12 has to ramp up to %100 fan speed frequently to keep that way and it is not quiet at that speed. I know somebody is going to say that's because the default settings on the motherboard are overclocking the CPU beyond Intel's recommended settings. Well, that was one of the first things I checked and that's not the case here. Despite what somebody on YouTube said or didn't say, not all motherboards do that. It is a great processor and complements my workload nicely (no games here). The new cooler is a Reeven Justice, $45 right now. I has the same size 120mm fan however it has six heat pipes instead of four and the tower is about %50 thicker and fins stacked closer together. Temps, while still pretty hot, have come down 8-10 degrees on Cinebench R-20. It still gets up to 80-82 Celsius but instead of hitting 80 right away as it did before, it takes until the render is almost complete and seems to level off there. I feel better about the temps now that It's not riding on the ceiling, especially since all core full load is not a typical workload for me. The fan is much quieter during typical use. I would recommend that cooler for those who are looking for a good compatible cooler.", '中古品が出品されるのは、運だが安く買えるのが嬉しい。今の所安定して使えてます。', "Yeah I know, Ryzens are cheaper, and out perform the Intel chips in everything... except clocks. As a gamer, I want the highest single core speed possible, 16 threads instead of 32? Whatever, I don't need that many for my uses, lol.I don't upgrade often, and until now I was still running my trusty 4790k, which still can hold it's own pretty well, but now with the 10700k, the 1080 isn't bottlenecked by my CPU any more, and it's VERY noticeable in certain games I normally saw slight issues.Should you upgrade 9th gen, or even 8th gen to 10th gen? Honestly, probably not. But if you're say, a few of more generations behind now, it's a worthy upgrade. Yes it's an upgraded 9900k, but that's still really good for ~$400!(pic included just because I find it hilarious how absurdly big the Noctua D15 cooler is)1 MONTH UPDATE:So yeah it's just shy of a month using it and it's been a beast. I haven't messed with clocks at all since the built in boosts do the job fine, especially paired with the D15 keeping it nice and cool. Haven't gone above 60c in full load yet.8 MONTH UPDATE:Still going strong! Was able to snag a 3080 from MicroCenter in September, so my build is now complete, and the 3080/10700k combo is beasting through anything I put in front of it.PC Build:CPU: i7-10700kCPUC: Noctua NH-D15 ChromaxMOBO: MSI Z490-A PRORAM: 32GB (4x8GB) HyperX Fury DDR4 3200GPU: EVGA RTX 3080 XC3 UltraPSU: Seasonic Focus Plus Gold 750wDRIVES: 250GB Samsung 970 EVO Plus M.2, 1TB Seagate SSHD, 2TB Samsung 860 Evo SSD, 4TB WD Black HDD", "Works great, the original one I got from Amazon died on me within 2 weeks it was essentially dead on arrival. This rarely happens but from time to time this can happen.I contacted Intel and asked for a replacement and they agreed as it was under warranty obviously. While I had to pay like $10 to ship it to them which I originally thought was sorta cheap since other companies like MSI cover the shipping costs I can see why Intel doesn't.While I only paid $10 for shipping I assumed it would be ground shipping from Canada to the middle of the USA and figured I'd be without a CPU for up to 2-weeks.Turns out Intel ships via Air and my package was on a Plane and arrived at the facility within 8 hours and I had a new CPU in my computer within 72 hours.I would highly recommend this product even after my issues because Intel was as fast as possible with replacing mine.After using this product for a few months it's worked great and performs perfectly and I've had no issues since getting the original replaced.", 'I waited too long to switch back to the FPS king. This chip is amazing. I missed you Intel.The PC world is weird. Always chasing $50 savings. Too many games have CPU bottlenecks. I debated hard between just buying a 3700x to replace my 2700x versus the hard MB/CPU upgrade to Intel. But AMD had left me frustrated. My 2700x was never maxed out and I couldn’t tell what was bottleknecking me. The 3700x didn’t promise much higher clock speeds so I wasn’t sure if an upgrade would help. I play Rust on 1440p and my GPU and CPU would sit at 60% utilization or less with frames only around 70fps. First test with the 10700k stock and I’m at 135fps, max graphic settings. My GPU is now pumping out 99% utilization and the game feels amazing.This chip runs cool on stock. Idk where all the bad thermal predictions came from, but it didn’t happen. Haven’t even OC’d it yet and honestly I may not need to until I upgrade off of my 2080super. But that’s not happening any time soon. I’m hitting 144fps on 1440p max settings now in every FPS game and that was the goal.Thank you Intel, you nailed this one. The 9th gen had some cost/heat issues and that made me give AMD a try and I’m glad to be back!For anyone choosing a card. The 10700k is the sweet spot for gaming and streaming. If you only game, I think the 10600k is a cheaper but same performance. I don’t see any need for the 10900k.']

Product: Intel Core i5-10600K Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.8 GHz Unlocked  LGA1200 (Intel 400 Series Chipset) 125W
Reviews: ['Prompt delivery and function well', 'calidad', 'nothing to dislike, just does what it is supposed to.', 'A good upgrade for a 10400f, slight speed upgrade and unlocked for overclocking.Used in a 10th gen system with an Arc770.', 'Ottimo processore ,prestazioni al top .ottimo acquisto.', "I bought this to upgrade my sons gaming PC and I have to say this thing is a little workhorse with the overclock feature.
