It has 10 cores that can run like a beast. It has my 2080 Super performing at its best without the sweat and strain my 7700k had to. I had to push that 7700k to 5.2 Ghz, where I could feel it straining, to really see RTX gaming performance at its smoothest above 1080p. This 10850k boosted just from the base BIOS on my mobo to 4.8Ghz on all 10 cores and things are buttery smooth. I play Control at 1440p with maxed settings and get a fairly consistent 90 FPS and my temps and component usage are all nice and ideal levels. I was able to play Half-Life Alyx, and stream it while capturing my webcam footage without any temp issues and honestly hitting my VRAM cap on the GPU before any actual performance issues from bottlenecking.Honestly, I can't be happier with this purchase. I hate reviews without negatives, it feels fake. And I wish I had some, but seriously it is playing games I enjoyed before with far better performance at higher settings. It is handling my crazed multitasking and occasional streaming without a sweat. Ryzen 5000 series may be able to squeeze some better gaming performance overall than this. But at the price I got it, and the issues with availability of a 5800x (which is more expensive too) I couldn't say I'd be happier with that. Especially when the AMD motherboards don't look quite as nice either. My friend has a 5800x, I've played on his machine and heard from him in his own use that its good, but nothing there seemed to blow this 10850k out of the water.", 'Performed above expectations', 'I went from a 5820k to this beast... all I can say is WOW.The research I did indicated that this is basically Intel\'s flagship CPU, but a half of a small step down.One thing I didn\'t know about my 5820k was how much it was holding my entire system back.Passmark Benchmarks increased for EVERY component. My 5 year old RAM is now running in the 99th percentile. My 2070 Super isn\'t bottlenecked. Heck, even my crappy old SSD improved... but then was mercilessly replaced by an younger, sexier, far more modern NVME drive (hey, if you\'re going big, go BIG).Super happy with this. It\'s worth every penny. I\'m still scratching my head as to how I paid less for this than my 5820k, and I bought that when they weren\'t even second gen anymore... and this is first gen hardware... but I supposed I can thank AMD for that... it helps when a "little brother" competitor suddenly outclasses you for less than you are charging... but hey, that works for us Intel fanboys, so we can get our fix for cheaper!!Only con is that under load, it kicks all my fans/cooling into high gear... but still runs butter smooth in most applications. Most of what I do primarily uses the GPU, but having a proper CPU matched to it makes a huge difference in all 3D applications I use. For reference, I\'ve got it hooked up with a Corsair h100i radiator system, which seems to do the job well of cooling it. In this day and age, I can\'t imagine doing anything but liquid cooling on a high end processor.Now, when I can finally get my hands on that one 10GB super-amazing GPU that everyone has been wanting since September, and I\'ve had reserved since then... I\'ll be in VR/Gaming/3D rendering/3D modeling heaven.', 'Lost silicon lottery.Hard to OC over 4.9 on the best Noctua Air cooler. Reapplied thermal paste twice to make sure.  Might leave it back to default C states where a few cores bump too 5.2 for a minute.Damn thing is HOT. 250W was just a number until I owned this..  with all the noctua case fans and air cooler, I should have bought 360mm AIO kraken WATER cooler!Either was the Coy is a best though and I get above 69fos on every game with my ECGA GTX1080.  Can’t wait for rtx 3080 waiting list... in the summer lol.This cou paired with Asus z490-e strix.  16x2GB g.skill 6-9-9-39 I think and that worked without him hitch. No need to OC ram as this is intel not amd.I’ll continue to try and tune but I’ve experimented with different LL cals, VDDIO and VDDSA.Viceroy is set to 1.39 which is higher then I’d like it to be.  Asus defaults are dangerously high and name me uncomfortable, they push above 1.4 which I could do and hit that elusive 5.0 but I want this to run for 5 years.Overall coming from i7-6700k OC was not as big a perf jump as I’d hope but overall it’s fast and snappy.When in same I would recommend over the 10900 due to price for performance.Does not fit into meshify C with dh-15’s big ass 140mm fans and the location of ram sticks.  Only the crucial Ram has low profile enough to accommodate this.  I replaced that one fan with higher SP fan 120mm from noctua so now I can put my side glass case on.  PcpartPicker great but only 95% accurate overall so watch it.Overall happy but sad I lost the lottery of the ever was one on this Bin’ed 10900 ;)', "I have built multiple PC boxes over the years and it has always been a fairly simple process. I source all my parts making sure that they are compatible and then assemble it. The i9 10850K processor was the last component I was waiting for and was pretty excited when it arrived. Fortunate I decided to film the open of the box due to other negative reviews I saw. I open the box and label says LGA 1200 and the correct model number was on the CPU. I figured all was good until I tried to actually put it in the socket. It was too big and the notches on the board were not in the correct location to lock into the socket. I ended damaging one pin in the socket. Went to BestBuy and purchased the exact same processor that drops perfectly into the socket. I have sent it back and requested a refund. I fail to see how something like this could happen accidentally. I'm not sure what they sent but it certainly isn't an i9 10850 for a LGA 1200 socket.Update: My brother did some research and found a picture online from a BestBuy customer who had the same problem. The notches were not in the correct place so it appears that this a a supplier problem and not an Amazon mistake.", "Excellent performance from this CPU - to say that it can cope with anything that's thrown at it is an understatement. More than suitable for a modern gaming PC. This CPU runs hot though compared to my previous build, and in my own opinion, the Noctua NH-U12A air/fan cooler is the perfect companion to keep the CPU as cool as possible. The i9-10850K is highly recommended to others - you will not be disappointed."]

Product: Intel® Pentium Gold G-6400 Desktop Processor 2 Cores 4.0 GHz LGA1200 (Intel® 400 Series chipset) 58W (BX80701G6400)
Reviews: ['The CPU price is incredibly cheap (especially if you buy 2nd hand) the performance is exactly half of the 13-10105F and pair well with any mid-high GPU (say GTX 1660 or RX-580) the performance is comparable to 6th gen i5 but with better memory latency, lower TDP and better PCI lanes.the 58w TDP means you can run the stock cooler for general use, but if used in gaming any cheap tower cooler will keep it nice and fresh regardless of the gaming session.', 'Muy buena pieza', 'excellent for basic home or office computer. fast shipping. excellent price. built in graphics...no need for expensive graphics card. very easy to install! cooling unit and paste included. well packaged.', 'If you know what you are doing this is great but know your LGA sockets first.', "J'ai choisi ce processeur pour l'assemblage d'un NAS DIY sachant qu'il présente à mon avis un des meilleurs rapports performance / prix pour ce type de projet.En définitive il s'avère efficace pour l'utilisation visée, et -qui plus est- silencieux avec son ventirad d'origine sans même chauffer véritablement.Je recommande donc ;-)", 'A good beginner processor', 'I\'m not one that races out to type a CPU review. There is already plenty of information, benchmarks, etc. on the web detailing the performance of this chip and/or chips that are similar. Ultimately, I\'m hoping to present a little clarification regarding what one may expect to receive when purchasing this item.So, if the headline of this review has caught your attention it may have been because you noticed the product description states that it "doesn\'t" come with a thermal solution (AKA:  heat-sink/fan). However, like some other reviewers/commenters have stated, "it does"! (or at least mine did). The item I received was in retail form and included the stock heat-sink and fan (case badge and all). I\'ve come across similar dependencies on other retail sites claiming the same thing. Sad to state, purchasing this item felt like more of a gamble if anything.Does that guarantee the one you purchase will include one...Don\'t know! But it may minimize the reluctance to purchase it seeing that myself, including others, have had the same experience and can confirm that the item received was indeed a retail variant.All in all, if it comes down to it, it is a relativity inexpensive chip. Even though potentially receiving one without a thermal solution may not be all that desirable, many aftermarket solutions can be found on the web and are rather cost effective when dealing with a chip of this type. So, the $10 or less region may not be out of line for an adequate thermal solution. Just think of your possible usage scenarios and buy accordingly (if it would even come to that).I bought this knowing it may not have come with a cooler, so I can\'t state I would\'ve felt burned getting one without one.  "5 Stars" for exceeding my expectations!Best of luck!', "This processor isn't much to write home about. It is a 2 core/4 thread processor near the bottom of the 10th-Gen Intel product stack. I say that not to criticize it, but rather, to ensure I'm setting the proper expectation for someone reading a 5 star review for the cheapest latest-generation processor.As long as this processor is appropriate for what you're buying it for, it's a great choice and a pretty reasonable price. What is it appropriate for? In my case, I used it to build a pfSense router/firewall machine. It works great for this, with 3% to 5% CPU load under heavy usage. It would also be appropriate for a Windows machine that you intend to use for things like web browsing, Netflix or light productivity work (checking email, word processing, or similar). in fact, it's a great choice for those tasks.Where you'll be less happy would be something like gaming. If this is your entry point in to Windows gaming, I highly recommend spending a little more for something like a Core i3 10100. You could comfortably use the same motherboard as this processor, but it has double the cores and higher clock speeds.Additionally, if you're doing something that requires a little extra graphics power, the integrated GPU in this processor won't get you very fine. It's fine for the things I mentioned above.... For example, it will play 4K Netflix or YouTube with no problem... But even the most casual game would bring this to its knees. If you're dead set on a processor with integrated graphics, I'd recommend looking to team red (e.g. Athlon 3000G, Ryzen 3 3200G).One side note: I distinctly remember the product listing indicating this did not come with a heatsink/fan. That is incorrect. The product I received did include a standard Intel in-box cooler.", "To feel good about this purchase, you need to be an informed consumer. I would only buy this for very specific use cases. In my case, I put this in a low power home server more focused on storage and serving media (Plex) than virtualization. I think it would also be perfect for a basic home/office PC that's focused on browsing the internet and using Microsoft Office.This should not be purchased for gaming or other use cases that benefit from lots of CPU horsepower (i.e. Adobe Creative Cloud, etc).For me? The price was low. The power consumption was low. The feature set was right (it's great for transcoding video in hardware via Plex).If you're not sure, I would probably save yourself the potential disappointment and set my low bar at the Intel i3-10100.Recommended.", "I wanted to take this review to directly address those thinking of purchasing for gaming, as I haven't seen too many reviews about this.For the value, this CPU is insanely good, but you must know what kind of games you want to play before you pull the trigger. It is a 2-core, 4-thread CPU which is the equivalent of what older gen i3 CPU's were. It is very snappy for browsing & basic needs, but how does it handle in-game? Here's my experience. I have this paired up with a 4GB R9 380 GPU and 8GB of DDR4 at 2666. Windows 10. Some sample benchmarks:Apex Legends: AVG 65, Low 46 on mix of low/highWitcher III: AVG 71, dips to high 50's in Novigrad, all high with shadows on lowFortnite: AVG 123, Low 76, competitive settingsModern Warfare: 50-60 AVG on mix of settingsNow obviously these are rough samples, and  YMMV depending on your GPU and config. You can probably push higher frame-rates with even just a 10th gen i3. However, if you are on a budget, or you don't care much about having the most consistent frames in the world, this CPU is a killer value. I, for one, learned an important lesson with this CPU. Stop caring about the frames, and just enjoy the games. Even still, the performance this CPU can push on a healthy PC build is beyond acceptable. It is not a AAA game crushing chip, but it will play a lot of games from 2015 onwards perfectly fine."]

Product: Intel Core i9-10900KF Desktop Processor 10 Cores up to 5.3 GHz Unlocked Without Processor Graphics LGA1200 (Intel 400 Series chipset) 125W
Reviews: ['Despite still using an older 14nm architecture, this little beast handles everything you can throw at it with ease. Upgrading from an 8 core 8 thread i7-9700k, where I was seeing high 90% CPU utilisation in multilayer games, a 10 core 20 thread CPU will go a long way towards future titles.Perhaps what I was most presently surprised by was how cool it runs. Under load, the CPU can top out at 80C+ at stock with power limits removed and MCE disabled, but that is only when running AVX-heavy benchmarks like Cinebench R15, with a 30C ambient and an NZXT Kraken X63 280MM AIO inside my NZXT H510 case, which has notoriously poor airflow. When gaming, however, the temperature hardly, if ever, go above 70C, mostly hovering in the high-50s to low-60s range. This gives thermal headroom for some mild overclocking, which I have yet to do, because it already performs so well at stock speeds.', 'The best cpu until the 13th gen', 'Intel is picking up speed with these new cpu\'s after the X-series hit the market, soon enough they\'ll have cpus\'s as good as the X-series at a much better value. I like this CPU a lot it can run through new installations, updates, and any other cpu heavy tasks like no other. Although it uses a lot of power, the extra speed feels worth the extra wattage used. I used this cpu to run console emulation and it does very well, I think it could do ok to run ps4 emulation but I hadn\'t tried it. Most games seem to run a bit faster than usual though, this can be a concern if you play games where you need quick timing/reaction speed like in first person shooters. It may be better to use a standard eight core or six core cpu if game speed is a concern. Overall I"d give this item five stars, I can\'t wait to build a new Rocket Lake computer!', "Considering the shortages on the 5000 series Ryzen's, this is the next best thing that you can actually buy at retail! I managed to get one in the warehouse deals for a cheaper price than full blown retail on an unopened package, but it still works great! You also save a little on this because of the lack of APU in the KF model. Of course there's an issue if you're using this with integrated graphics in the first place so it's more of a non-issue for most people. Performance is spot on easily showing up almost all AMD at single threaded applications. The 10 core's are more than enough for almost anyone. I've got it on a 360mm AIO and temps never go above 70c for any reason, even extended gaming sessions.", 'Easy to overclock and has been super stable and grinds threw games and apps.  Really good deal!!', "To be fair, I upgraded from an i7-8700; this cpu is blazing fast and i've only ever gotten up to 80% usage running 3 intensive games at once. I do have one of those beefy Noctua dual fan coolers to keep temps low and stable ( 27°C idle, in general staying around 60°C), as this heats up fast. Make sure you get a proper cooler, as a standard heatsink single fan cooler was pushing 85°C at 35% usage.", 'Great for upgrading my PC, but I had to buy a new motherboard to support this CPU.', 'Technically the CPU wrote this review so I guess it works.', "Such a powerful CPU. Good luck if you have poor or decent cooling system. My previous AIO wasn't able to cool this beast off, idle temp was 90°c!! So I got the NZXT Kraken x63 and now the idle temp is at 28-30°c. If you are thinking of getting this CPU I highly recommend investing in CPU cooling as well.", 'This chip is an absolute beast.Pro: Everything you do on your PC will be blazing fast when combined with an ssd. For gaming, this cpu has gotten me over 144 FPS in most 1440p games when combined with a 2080 super.Cons: gets very hot when overclocking even slightly, will require a really good watercooler. Dont expect to reach 5.3 without getting lucky.']

Product: AMD Ryzen™ 9 7900X3D 12-Core, 24-Thread Desktop Processor
Reviews: ['I installed this in my Asus ProArt x670e motherboard. I use an Arctic Liquid Freezer II 280 RGB AIO water cooler. I like that it switches between two chiplets  one with higher frequency, the other with a higher cache. So you can have your cake and eat it too depending on if you are doing normal productivity type tasks or gaming. The switching between chiplets is done by Xbox game bar and is generally automatic. Nutshell is if Microsoft thinks you are running a game it switches to the X3D cache otherwise it uses the frequency optimized chiplet. You can check by bringing up the game bar with windows-g then looking at settings. The tdp is quite low at 120 watts, so it’s a very easy load for my water cooler, so my cooler is pretty quiet and it’s easy to keep the cpu well below its TJ Max. I also used the bottleneck calculator at the pc builds website, and per their estimation this CPU is well matched up to a Nvidia rtx 4070ti gpu. this was completely fine for my usage.', "I have to say I love this processor. I made the jump to a totally new platform. It is NOT without it's growing pains (which I can say now have settled at least for me).A lot of YouTubers say get the 7800x3d... if you do need core speed for programs or have games that use core speed this makes alot more sense. I think (my opinion) that once the bios and drivers are more optimized to use the necessary cores that have cache, vs higher clocked cores for performance this will be a amazing buy.Right now, it's a beast!I run it on a ASUS ROG STRIX X670E-E... the bios here was an issue... with all 7000 cpus it seems over volting cpu/mem controller could cause damage to the cpu or motherboard. I was lucky... my pc shut off randomly several times and I had to manually reset the psu. It seems my psu was saving my hardware. I was chasing down a possible PSU, RAM and motherboard or cpu issue. I spent weeks troubleshooting to no avail, all the answers I got from everyone was to RMA... I wanted to narrow it down so I didn't have to wait weeks for the turn around of each part.Finally I saw a new BIOs from ASUS.1410 is the newest I am using but both this version and 1303 claim to limit SOC voltage to 1.3 which should mitigate the shutdowns and possible damage.I really do love this chip and the X3D really is amazing in gaming. Really removes the lower .01 and 1% frame rates.I'm totally happy with the performance and am playing with per core curve optimizer. Now that I have more stability I can play with the chip more.Temps- from my observation the IO die temps at idle are in the 40C range... so that reads as the package temp... when actually the cores are in the 30s and 20s depending at idle. I also run a custom loop with dual 360 rads with the cpu and gpu in the loop. So I'm happy with the temps.All in all a great cpu, if just gaming or want to save some cash can do a 7800x3d, if you can use the higher core speeds of a 7900x3d this cpu is for you.", 'Io ormai sono affezionato alla serie 9 dei rayzen, sono passato dal 5900x a questo 7900x3d.Ho sempre scelto il 9 per la sua duttilità sia per il Gaming che per l ambito lavorativo e video editing.Anche questa volta amd ha fatto un ottimo lavoro.', 'Sono passato da un i9 10900f a questo processore e la differenza in gaming si sente tantissimo.Ho guadagnato parecchi frames sopratutto nei giochi cpu limit e rispetto all’i9 noto che l’utilizzo della mia 4090 è decisamente superiore.Ottimi i consumi e le temperature, considerato che ho tutto questo chiuso in un case mini itx', '90+c for this CPU is fine, and it works as expected. If you want to lower that number, read about "curves" and undervolting.', 'Starting out, if you only play video games on your PC go with the Ryzen 7 7800x3d. It performs better and is cheaper.However, if you do a little bit of everything, this CPU is great.You could probably get away with a beefy air cooling system but it would be recommended to invest into a semi decent liquid cooling system.', "First AMD chip and GPU for my new build. So far everything is working great and very happy with my purchase. Really like AMD's apps and ease of fine tuning. Most importantly, this is my last review before Amazon will tell me a joke for submitting 6 reviews of my recent purchases.", 'Excellent performance for the price, for work and games, really good', "This CPU is great. It works flawlessly with my 4090 but I wish I had waited for the 7800x3d instead.While the CPU has 12 cores, the new 3D Vcache makes the CPU park 6 of those 12 cores since its stacked on one side. The performance is great if you use your PC for both gaming and productivity but if you only game, you are better off getting the cheaper 7800x3d. It only has 8 cores but since the 3D Vcache is on all 8 cores, none of the cores are parked and you get the full use of all 8 cores vs the use of only 6 cores with the 7900x3dI take this as a learning experience and while i have a little buyers remorse i can't say that the 7900x3d doesn't perform well. It's just that the 7800x3d makes the 7900x3d inferior for more money.", "Veloce, silenzioso e non riscalda troppo.Ho notato un grande incremento di frames in game passando dal 5950x.Prezzo che potrebbe essere un pò piu' contenuto ma ottima risposta da parte di questo processore che non necessita di nient'altro che una buona scheda madre e delle ram all'altezza vicino. Consigliato se giochi."]

Product: Intel Core i3-13100 Desktop Processor 4 cores (4 P-cores + 0 E-cores) 12MB Cache, up to 4.5 GHz
Reviews: ['I build PCs for clients daily. The core i3-13100 is absolutely perfect.  6 core 12 thread, nothing can beat it for the money. And the client is very happy with its performance.  Can run many different programs at once.The core i3 has changed alot over the years. Used to be dual core, with HT, then quad core not HT, now 6 core 12 thread. Much better value.  Maybe for the 14th gen core i3 they could include 6 P-cores, 2 E-cores, being the same 12 thread CPU,', 'Pour le prix', "The 13100 isn't the powerhouse that the 13900k is, but it works well for day to day task where a more powerful processor isn't required.", 'El menor de su familia y se defiende muy bien, va perfecto con una RTX 3060 12GB y todo en ULTRA', "All I can say is that I'm very happy with my purchase!", 'If you need more processor, buy more processor.  However, most web surfer and video viewers will never notice this is a budget CPU.  Modern tech makes this little guys speedy as heck.  It runs games just fine as long as your expectations are super high end 4K gaming at a zillion FPS.  Check youtube for videos.  Great little chip.', 'Used it in a fresh build on MSI Mortar wifi and Thermalright assassin x. Temps 3x on idle and 5x on load. Has all needed performance and with integrated graphics is all needed. With Gigabyte Eagle RTX 3060 OC got Fortnite Epic run 130fps @1080p and ~90fps @1440p. Black Mesa ultra @1440p got 100-200fps. Single Con: Could be better priced around 130 though. I decided to have this configuration to have the possibilty to upgrade to 13600k sometime later if needed for Graphics render software.']

Product: AMD Ryzen™ 9 7900 12-Core, 24-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor
Reviews: ["I bought it for work, paired it with EXPO 64 GB 6000 CL30 memory that I found for 22k, not planning on overclocking as I don't need to, if gaming I would suggest 5800x3d as better value for money, but for productivity 12 cores are very good, no complaints yet, driver software is decent. Only use the iGPU at the moment, no graphics card", 'der Lüfter ist extrem leise zumindest in der normalem Belastungsphase, noch habe ich nicht alles eingerichtet, um eine realistische Gaming-Aussage machen zu können', "First off, I enjoy building SFF (small form factor) type builds.The current generation of CPU's were more power hungry, which resulted in more heat to dissipate. Trying to cool a Ryzen 9 7900X on a CPU cooler rated for max 100W is quite difficult, so therefore you have to go towards cases like the NZXT H1 V2.This particular chip allows you to not only have near identical performance to the Ryzen 9 7900X with PBO, but also gives you SFF allowable performance at a lower wattage that still provides you power.So far today using this has been great, and I recommend this chip to anyone that wants a newer generation chip without the abismal power draws that have been required as of late.Edit 1/17:From normal use I have seen no difference between this model and the X model. I had both chips in my NZXT H1 V2, liquid metal as the thermal application, and by far the non X model does much better in this type of SFF build. It still will boost, however if you are like me, work from home, and use this all day long in most cases, you aren't going to want the CPU blasting at full power over the entire work day.Quick note: temps are much better, my fan curve was not changed and the temperature is a lot more tolerable compared to the X version, so my CPU radiator fan does not spool up as much as it did with the X. I let it hover between 50C-65C for daily use and the fans are quiet, with the X the fan was at half or more RPM constantly to keep it at around this temperature and would sometimes hover in the 70's. So, if you are temperature concious then the non-x version is great.With that said I am pleased with the product. I do feel though this model needed to be priced at $399, as we have seen the 7900X is selling at this time around $425 on sale.Again, I will reiterate, the allowances in this chip should have been more prevalent in the X version, as I feel like we were kind of ripped off slightly this generation on CPU's and GPU's.Edit 1/20:This will be my final edit. I am boosting to around 5.5 MHz with the wattage anywhere from 60-90W. My temperatures are sustaining on load no more than 68C on a single 140mm AIO in the NZXT H1 V2. This is great, I am maintaining the frequency, but with a much lower power draw.One item I would recommend is getting an aftermarket chip mounting plate for this chip, weirdly it did make a difference for this chip, around 1-2C lower than the stock MOBO chip mount. I'm using the following mount: Thermalright ASF-Black AM5 CPU Holder, Corrective Anti-Bending Fixing Frame, AM5 Full-fit Fixed Non-Marking Mounter, AM5 Anti-Bending Contact Frame, CPU Cooler Standard, I am also using the following paste: Thermal Grizzly Conductonaut Thermal Grease - 1 Gram Set + 3 Applicators + Pads - Liquid Metal Thermal Paste for Cooling The CPU, GPU Value Pack.So far so good, would recommend, and again this is what the first chip should have been - AMD is trying too much to be intel, sure make your server chips, but we buy AMD for efficiency, not brute power in most cases. Sure, there is threadripper, but most of us are casual users. Regardless, this is the chip we all wanted, it's powerful, efficient, and over-clockable.", 'I like the low TDP of these, only 65W and whopping 49k Passmark benchmark score with 12 cores and 24 threads! Great value for the money, will serve me well for a few years I imagine.', 'I am coming from a third generation i7, so this thing smokes!', "How it Perfoms?To be fair It's 90% of 13700K with PBO on and if youre lucky with Curve Optimizer + PBO will perform 95% of 13700K. Mine works -20 with PBO easliy and got score of 30k in Cinebench R23.You can try overclocking, but i strongly  woudln't suggest it.In comparizon to 7900X3D it's 20% slower in gaming but 10% faster in Productivity tasks and costs 30% less. In Comparizon to 7800X3D it's 20% slower in gaming but 35% faster in Productivity tasks and costs 5% less.So, if u just game then buy X3D chip and forget it.Why You should buy it. Whats it's USP?It's TDP, It will go max 180W to be precise, and will remain under 95'C  under worst of worst condition unlike 13700K which easily touches 100'C and consumes max of 253W.If you want to have a GPU with 450W+ TDP like 4090[Now] or say 5090 [in future :P] you can pair it with a >= 650W Gold PSU with this CPU. Use saved money into ssds or whatever.", "With AMD's Ryzen Master software this CPU can OC to 5500mhz out of the box. I have this installed on a 650M motherboard with 128gb of DDR5 and a RTX 4070 card and it runs nice and cool in a 'mesh' style mATX case. Compared to my  i7-10875H this CPU screams with half the heat produced. I am very impressed and glad I chose it over the 7900x or 7950x", "Very happy with performance.I have this paired with with Gigabyte x670 Aorus elite AX, Gigabyte 3060 geforce, 64Gb corsair 5200 DIMMs (2x32).For cooling used CORSAIR - iCUE H100i ELITE CAPELLIX XT, which works very well.Previously returned a Noctua NH-D15S, which didn't have correct backing plate.With this setup the 7900 idles in mid 30s.  With CPU at 100% (blender rendering, health check and performance tool apps) the max temp I've hit was 62°, so the lower TDP of 65watts, combined with decent liquid cooler, removes overheating worries.I purposely went with qty (2) DIMMs, as this keeps the DIMM clock speeds optimal.  Populating all 4 DIMM slots will reduce DIMM clock speed (to like 3200 Mhz, I think).Thanks in part to 12GB 3060 geforce card, apps like blender, handbrake, do in seconds or minutes what used to take MANY hours on older athlon 8350 system.Compiling large FL studio projects that would take 30-40 minutes, run in just a few seconds now.", 'Using in a Gigabyte Aorus Elite AX motherboard and 64GB of G.Skill Flare X5 @6200 MHz.  Plenty of PBO setting in the BIOS for tweaking.  Runs CPU-Z consistently ~12500 and Cinebench 23 between 29507 and 30162.  Total system power at full load is 378 watts including (2) 27" IPS monitors.  Lots of bang for the buck from a CPU rated at 65 watts.  Included cooler is adequate for every day, but HD use calls for something heftier.  Use for CAD, rendering and Photoshop.', 'Great  !']

Product: Intel Core i7-12700K, 8C+4c/20T, 3.60-5.00GHz, boxed without Kühler
Reviews:
["J'ai récemment fait l'acquisition de ce i7-12700K pour une mise à niveau de mon PC gamer, en quelques points voici ce que j'en pense:----Performance en jeu :---------------Comparé à mon ancien processeur un i7-9eme génération, j'ai constaté une nette amélioration des performances, notamment lors de l'utilisation de logiciels gourmands en ressources comme les logiciels de modélisation 3D ou de montage vidéo ou même en streaming. En jeu il est largement suffisant pour tourner les jeux les plus récents comme cyberpunk ou starfield !-------Polyvalence:----------Grâce à la combinaison de cœurs de performance (P) et d'efficacité (E) = (12 coeurs (dont 8 P-cores et 4 E-core), le processeur gère très bien à la fois les tâches quotidiennes et les applications plus exigeantes.------------Technologies embarquées :---------------Le support de la DDR5, l'overclocking potentiel et d'autres technologies avancées font du 12700K un proc de choix pour ceux qui recherchent un processeur pour le gaming-----------Points à Améliorer :-----------Chauffe : Même si ce n'est pas excessif, j'ai remarqué que le processeur avait tendance à chauffer un peu plus que mon ancien. Cela nécessite donc un système de refroidissement adéquat, j'utilise personnellement un water cooling NZXT qui le maintient à une température acceptable.---------Conclusion :-------------------------------Le Intel Core i7-12700K est un excellent processeur pour ceux qui cherchent à combiner performances en jeu ou en multi tasks (streaming et jeu) et polyvalence. Cependant, assurez-vous d'avoir un bon système de refroidissement et évaluez bien vos besoins avant d'investir, car le prix peut être élevé pour certains budgets.", "Comme à son habitude, Intel fournit des produits de qualité et d'une stabilité à toutes épreuves. Très performant et merci Amazon pour les prix souvent excellents", 'Die Performance ist super! Die Kerne laufen bei Normalbetrieb auf ca. 20 - 30° C (Wasserkühlung 1x Radiator) und unter Last auf ca. 50 - 60° C. Der Prozessor ist im Normalbetrieb (Windows 11 und ein paar Chrome Tabs geöffnet) immer unter 5% Auslastung. Stromverbrauch ungefähr zwischen 65 und 180 Watt je nach Auslastung. In bin absolut zufrieden!', 'Perfect upgrade from an i7 7700', 'The media could not be loaded.
                



\xa0Sem dúvida, um processador que resolve tudo. Faço live em games e não trava nada. Estava em dúvida entre o i7 ou i9 12° geração, optei pelo i7 12700k e estou muito satisfeito.  Recomendo a todos.', 'i7 + 3060ti = 4.2% de bottleneck. Un parfait équilibre pour jouer en 1440p.', 'Cercavo un processore che mi consentisse un aggiornamento sul secondo PC che montava un i7 3700k. Aggiornamento eseguito e velocizzato il PC con programmi di grafica AI dell ultima generazione. Editing video, fotografia AI, il tutto  con elaboraxioni in tempi adeguati. Ho dovuto sostituire il raffreddatore a liquido, con un altro, per la sostituzione della scheda madre. Ottimo rapporto qualità/ prezzo. Credo rimarro un fan di Intel.... prestazioni nel tempo e mai un problema.. Consigliabile', 'No complaints here. It handles everything my gaming PC throws at it. I paired this with the Deepcool AK620.', 'Hij doet het prima en is niet slecht maar bij een nauwelijks identieke computer op de cpu na (ander merk) krijg ik betere performance met dezelfde prijs. Dit kan te maken hebben met dat ik de i7-12700k nog niet heb overclocked dus neem dit met een korrel zout.', 'Lieferzeit war leider etwas sehr lange (ca2.5 Wochen) aber jetzt wo ich habe passt alles er läuft ruhig mit der Kühlung gibt es bisher auch keine Probleme.  Hab ihn aber erst seit ca 1 Woche.Mal schauen ob das so bleibt']

Product: Intel® Core™ i9-11900KF Desktop Processor 8 Cores up to 5.3 GHz Unlocked LGA1200 (Intel® 500 Series & Select 400 Series Chipset) 125W
Reviews: ["Even companies like Intel screw up sometimes.  That's what happened with the 12th and 13th generation Intel CPUs, the ones that followed this 11th generation i9-11900K.  There are detailed explanations for all that, which I won't go into.  The bottom line is, because of chip design, current CPU coolers, and power requirements, it's very difficult and very expensive to get better real world performance from the 12th and 13th generation chips.  This is why Intel is abandoning the LGA-1700 socket after just two years and starting over.  In the meantime, AMD has taken huge chunks of market share, particularly in applications that operate near 100% current load.  The i9-11900K or KF reached the optimal limit of the LGA-1200 socket.  It has an excellent CPU cooling interface and will run all day long at a TDP of 170 watts, completely stable and reliable with 8 cores at 4.8 GHz.  And that's not something the 12s and 13s are able to do.", 'Lo único que no me gusto fueron las fechas de entrega lo pedí para México el 13 de abril y tenía que llegar el 19 de abril y se atrasó la entrega por temas de aduana y me llegaría hasta 2 de mayo y al final me lo entregaron el 24 de abril, pero fuera de eso el producto llegó bien y funciona al 100. OJO CABE RECORDARLES QUE NO PAGUE NINGÚN EXTRA POR ADUANAS', 'fast speeds', 'Came on time and have had no problems.', 'Vino en una caja que no era la original y ya estaba usado tenía restos de pasta térmica por lo demás sí es el producto que dicen es lo que es un I9 11900kf lo tuve que devolver pantallazos azules sin parar cuando le hacías una prueba de extres y recién instalado el Windows 11', '', 'Do not get the Kf model if you are making a video editing workstation.  Programs can utilize the igpu as well as your gpu to work much more efficient.  But they can’t do that with a KF cpu.  Big mistake I learned from.', 'la caja del producto llegó un poco maltratado pero no afecto al producto, producto funcional y operativo', "At release, the reviews for this CPU were brutal.  From the 10-core i9 10900 to an 8-core i9 11900 that only matched and sometimes lagged behind the previous gen (mostly in productivity apps, not gaming) seemed a step backwards.  And at the original price, I agree completely.  But at these current, deeply discounted prices, and factoring in PCIe v4 and NVME 4.0, plus the ability to turbo beyond 5.3 GHz at safe Vcore values, this CPU begins to look like a viable upgrade path from 10th gen.  All-in-all, I'm very satisfied with the performance upgrade and the reasonable price to achieve it.  Still, it's hard to believe this CPU is already two generations behind.  Sigh....", 'After finding out this processor was not the best for the price I was a little bummed. However it was a gamechanger to get it on Amazon used. It overall was a great budget opition and I get good frames paired with a 3090. I recommend this processor when getting a good deal on a motherboard.']

Product: 50PCS Computer CPU Case Tray Packaging Clamshell for Intel LGA775 LGA1150/1151/1155 /1156 i3 i5 i7 CPU Protector Cover (50PCS Transparent)
Reviews: ["I've had issues with some processor clamshells staying shut.  These don't seem to have that issue, I have bought these multiple times and they work very well!", 'These are handy to have around the build area when swapping out cpus', 'Bue. Producto para procesadores intel']

Product: AMD Ryzen 3 3100 Desktop Processor
Reviews: ['It was one of the best budget CPUs at one point in time. The lack of availability made them overpriced. I was lucky enough to get one and was thoroughly impressed by its speed and energy efficiency compared to my R5 2600. There are probably newer better CPUs for the price now.', "AMD indubbiamente con l'uscita dell'architettura Zen 3 sta conquistando il mercato delle CPU guadagnando posizioni di vendita sul concorrente Intel. il processore è prodotto su design AMD da TSMC con processo produttivo a 7nm.Ha un TDP di 65W che riduce non di poco i consumi ma eroga prestazioni notevoli per un processore di fascia bassa, più che sufficienti per la quasi totalità di applicazioni, a parte i giochi più evoluti)Ha di serie la ventola che è più che adatta per un utilizzo normale (no overclocking). Anche stressandolo per mezz'ora con tutti i core in funzione al 100% con Cinelerra (elaborazione video) la temperatura massima è di 70° C stabile.La temperatura durante il normale lavoro di ufficio si attesta sui 34-40 °C anche perché i core vengono sfruttati  con basse percentuali (la maggior parte inferiore al 10%).Non ha un chip grafico integrato per cui richiede una scheda grafica a parte o integrata sulla scheda madre.L'ho montata su una Gigabyte B450M S2H con i soliti dovuti accorgimenti:- non toccare con le dita la pasta termica che è già piazzata sulla base del dissipatore;- non toccare con le dita la superficie della CPU (altrimenti il grasso presente sulle dita riduce la dissipazione. Se succede pulirla con un detergente a base di ammoniaca, ideale solo acqua distillata e ammoniaca, lasciando asciugare il tutto);- stare attenti a come posizionare la ventola: in alcune piastre madri la parte più sporgente della ventola va a interagire nello spazio dove installare la ram, per cui è da piazzare girandola di 180° ovvero tale sporgenza deve essere dalla parte opposta della Ram. inoltre nelle piastre madri, come riportato sulle istruzioni, prima del posizionamento della ventola sono da rimuovere i due supporti laterali per la vecchia serie di CPU AMD. Infine avvitare sempre incrociando, cioè avvitando due viti opposte per alcuni giri e poi facendo lo stesso per le altre due fino a completo serraggio: in tal modo non si ha lo spostamento della pasta durante il serraggio dovuto alla leggera inclinazione del dissipatore causata dal serraggio delle viti prima da un lato e poi dall'altro andando ad inficiare poi le capacità di raffreddamento.", 'Ottimo processore per una build low budget.Associato ad una 1650 super, si gioca tranquillamente a warzone senza temperature elevate o qualsivoglia problema.Consigliato dopo parecchio tempo di utilizzo.', 'Ich betreibe den Ryzen 3 3100 in einem Asus TUF-Gaming B550M mit einem älteren Thermalright-Kühler und 24 GB RAM (DDR4-3000). Die CPU lässt sich problemlos auf 4400 MHz übertakten, wofür ich die Core-Spannung (VID) im Bios auf ca. 1,3 Volt anheben musste. Dabei wurde der Prozessor bei Stress-Tests allerdings mit 76 Grad etwas warm und verbrauchte auch ca. 75 Watt.Ich betreibe ihn daher mit nur 4300 MHz. Bei dieser Taktrate begnügt er sich mit 1,2 Volt Core-Spannung (ich habe dazu die Offset-Spannung im Asus-Bios auf +0,75 V gestellt) und verbraucht unter Last nur ca. 55 Watt.Zum Tempo: Bereits bei 4300 MHz erreicht der Ryzen 3 3100 mit dem Testprogramm Cinebench 15 knapp über 11.000 Punkte. Das ist kaum weniger als der auf 4,9 GHz übertaktete Intel i5-9600KF in meinem Hauptrechner. Grund ist, dass der Ryzen 3 3100 acht Threads hat (4 reale Kerne und 4 simulierte SMT), während die Intel-CPU nur 6 Threads hat (6 reale Kerne, kein Hyperthreading).Im Single-Thread-Modus hat der Ryzen 3 3100 bei 4300 MHz eine Rechenleistung, die rund 12 % unter der Single-Thread-Rechenleistung des Intel 9600KF liegt. Dies gleicht der Ryzen jedoch mit seinen 8 Threads wieder aus, wenn er mit Multithread-Programmen gefordert wird. Es ist daher keine Übertreibung, dass sich der kleine Ryzen mit den rund doppelt so teuren Intel-Boliden aus 2019 messen kann.Ein Nachteil ist, dass der Ryzen 3 3100 bei Übertaktung auf 4300 MHz (dazu hab ich im Bios des obigen Mainboards den Multiplikator auf 43 gestellt) IMMER bei diesem Tempo läuft, und auch die Corespannung wird nicht runtergeregelt. Sprich: "Cool and Quiet" funktioniert in dieser Konstellation nicht. Das führt allerdings zu keinem nennenswerten Mehrverbrauch. Idle ziehen die Kerne zusammen ca. 5 Watt (übertaktet). Unübertaktet sind es ca. 3 Watt. Den meisten Strom verbraucht idle - in beiden Fällen - die SOC-Einheit (ca. 16 Watt, gemessen mit HWInfo64).Fazit: Zum Preis von 95 Euro (Amazon-Preis): Volle Kaufempfehlung. Der "bessere" Ryzen 5 3600 war mir mit 170 Euro aufwärts zu teuer. Da warte ich lieber, bis Zen3 rauskommt und rüste das Mainboard dann nächstes Jahr ggfs. weiter auf. Vielleicht bleibt der Ryzen 3 3100 aber auch "für immer" drin. Er läuft schnell, rund und sparsam. Wer wie ich kein Gamer ist und auch keine Videos rendert, braucht definitiv nicht mehr.', "I bought this CPU for a budget 1080p gaming pc for my nephew. Originally I planned to use the 3300x in the build but they have been unavailable for months. Anyway I built the pc around this with 16gb (2x8gb) 3200mhz corsair vengeance lpx ram, an Asrock B550m Pro 4 mobo, RX 580 8gb Msi Armour gpu, 1TB WD nvme ssd, 2TB Toshiba 7200rpm HDD, 500w Be quiet system 9 psu, GameMax Phantom Gaming Case with tempered glass side panel, all new for £600.I'm really happy with the performance of this rig, as is my nephew. Getting a 4 core 8 threaded cpu for this money is superb (I paid £95), and it is an excellent performer. Even RDR2 chugs along nicely at 60fps with medium to high settings. My I7 7700k cost over £300 3 years ago and the performance isn't far behind it.There are a couple of things to note when building a PC with this chip. It has no onboard gpu so you will need a discreet graphics card otherwise you will not get a display. Secondly I initially had issues getting the new build to post. I turned the power on and the fans powered up but that was it. Luckily have built a few pc's and thought this was a RAM issue. So I pulled out the sticks from slots 1and 3 and tried 2 and 4. Still no luck. I then put a single stick of ram in slot 2 and it posted. I then installed windows, shut the pc down and installed both sticks in their dual config and hey presto all worked fine. I did have a further problem as the I could not get the ram to work at it's designated 3200mhz, I had to settle for 3000mhz, though I'm sure a bios update would solve this.An included cpu cooler is also nice to see, and it works just fine, though if you like to overclock a beefier solution is recommended. It's certainly a lot better than the old intel stock coolers. Anyway a great value cpu, well done AMD.", 'A distanza di due anni tutto ok', 'J\'ai acheté le Ryzen 3100 en tant que solution temporaire sur une carte-mère B550. J\'attendais Zen 3 à la fin de l\'année, mais j\'ai été obligé de sauter le pas avant l\'heure.Je n\'ai pas utilisé le ventirad fourni, j\'ai un Noctua NH-D15s dessus, ce qui est très disproportionné, mais il était à l\'origine destiné à un futur 4900x ! Cela dit la presse spécialisée s\'accorde à dire que le "Wraith Stealth" est très bon aussi.Bref, pour juste 115 €, vous pouvez avoir l\'égal de l\'Intel Core i7 7700k, ce qui est franchement énorme. Le processeur est aussi très facilement overclocké jusqu\'a 4.3/4.4 GHz, même sur le ventirad inclus, bien que je ne l\'ai pas encore fait moi-même.Pour un PC construit soi-même pas cher, je pense qu\'il est assez difficile de trouver mieux dans le segment qui se situe juste un peu en dessous du "milieu de gamme" actuel. CEPENDANT, si vous avez 20 euros en plus, essayez de trouver un 3300x, ou peut-être même de franchir le pas vers un 3600. Le 3300x est physiquement configuré différemment au niveau de ses puces, ce qui augmente sensiblement ses performances dans les applis type jeu vidéo. Quand au 3600 (non-X), c\'est LE processeur le plus imbattable de toute la gamme Zen 2.', "Just got this Ryzen 3 3100 to temporarily use until the Ryzen 4000 CPUs release (paired it with my B550 motherboard and 16GB of 3200 DDR4). Upgraded from an FX-8350. Haven't really tested it much compared to the FX 8350, but I have played a few games on the new CPU and I have got quite a big improvement on some of them. (Still running my RX 480)Fallout 4 as an example, I was currently in another playthrough when I did the upgrade.  I went from getting like 20ish-30 FPS in the worst downtown areas (that's with a lot of settings down to lowest/medium/off) on the FX 8350 build.To getting 60FPS pretty much everywhere (With all max settings, except with Godrays OFF and shadow quality set to high and shadow distance set to 6000 in the .ini which is in-between Medium and High)The worst places for performance loss no longer sent my FPS into the 20s and with the new build the lowest I got was 49fps when it was raining, but it was mainly 55-60 for the worst areas or full 60 everywhere else.So the Ryzen 3 3100 running with 3200mhz DDR4 certainly improved FPS massively in Fallout 4 (happy about that as I mod the game a lot) this was at 1080p with my RX 480 4G.I got improvement in others also, but like I said I haven't really tested it much more.When the Ryzen 4000 CPUs come out I will update the bios when it's released then upgrade to a 8 core Ryzen 7.", 'Good product it’s faster', 'Surprenant...pour le prix...évidement en 2023 il y a de meilleurs options mais...je tenais tout de même à en faire mention...ce cpu jumelé à une bonne vieille RX 580 et Halo infinite et warzone 2.0 sont toujours très jouables!']

Product: Intel Core i9-10900F Desktop Processor 10 Cores up to 5.2 GHz Without Processor Graphics LGA 1200 (Intel 400 Series chipset) 65W
Reviews: ['I build lots of computers for my clients, both AMD and Intel based.  AMD would have you believe that ryzen is some groundbreaking performance monster and if you believe the media ryzen left Intel in the dust years ago.  If you build as many PCs as I have, and work with both platforms on a daily basis you know that\'s not quite the case.  Ryzen is a great platform to be sure, the 3000 and 5000 series perform great typically, however they are often unstable (even without OC) and glitchy and seem to have way more issues than Intel cpus.  I won\'t go into specifics but I\'ll put it this way: I\'ve exchanged probably 1 in 3 AMD ryzen 5000 series cpus I\'ve purchased for builds and not a single Intel chip.  This chip in particular has always proven a stable and extremely well performing example of Intel maturity and stability.  It performs exactly as you\'d expect and the "silicon lottery" always tends to be in your favor with Intel and particularly with this cpu.  Don\'t get me wrong, ryzen is a huge leap forward for amd, and a great platform for high performance and or gaming, but i-series intel just always seems to have a slight advantage (maybe not in benchmarks, but I\'m real day to day usage anyways).  I\'m not an amd fan boy or an Intel purist, I just want a good product to provide my customers in their builds and this is a great cpu by all metrics.', 'Excelente procesador, cumple por mucho todas las expectativas, solo tener una buena gráfica y tienes pc para rato.', 'I didn’t want something I could overclock as I don’t really mess with that stuff anyways. I just wanted something I could drop in and go. I also didn’t need the onboard graphics as I had a GPU already lined up for this install.This was the perfect option for me to get a more modern intel processor without all the extras I wouldn’t use anyways. Coming from an i5-4690 this thing is light years ahead.I can’t speak for the stock cooler as I opted for a AIO cooler instead but even under some lengthy gaming sessions I don’t see temperatures get very high at all.', "Powerful CPU. (if you load it up to 100% good radiator required. box cooler is not enough). The 65W TDP figure is derived from the base frequency, also known as PL1 while the actual TDP (PL2) is much higher. In the case of the Core i9-10900F, the maximum PL1 Power limit is actually 170W and the PL2 power limit is 224W.Compare to 10900k it's super good deal if you buy it on some season sale. Even without sale... small performance difference compare to big price difference.", 'I purchased this I9 because of the AMD shortage  and I needed a boost in performance for my flight sim. Although the processor is considered locked you can still over clock it with BCLK (base clock).  It can also be locked on to keep all cores running at max. My chip clocks at 5.1 Ghz and is very stable. Max power consumption is 320 watts. Max junction temp is 70C with an aircooler.  For me it has been a very good deal.', "it's no 5800x but it's more stable so pros should use it", 'It’s awesome, works great!Make sure you have a good thermal paste!I recommend this. This is my first time doing a core upgrade. I recommend you look up your computer spec upgrade on your computer etc.Super fast and great for gaming!', 'I was worried as I have never bought form Amazon and this was for my first time and it was a big money order. I received my order much earlier than I expected and I am the happiest man on earth. Did I mention that I live in Namibian, Windhoek. Very Well Done Amazon!', "I've used AMD for 15 years and I never thought AMD's new launch would result in me getting an Intel. But here we are. For the first time in my life Intel became the more affordable option, and I'm glad I saved $100 instead of buying the more expensive R7 5800x and waiting several months to receive it.", "Works well.  Easily put together.I built a beast with this one.  I agree it's not as fast as the AMD, but the quality of the motherboards constructed for Intel makes all the difference."]

Product: Intel BX80684I79700F Core i7-9700F Desktop Processor 8 Core 3 GHz speed
Reviews: ['I upgraded from an i5-8400. Saw it was on sale (from an outrageous +$400 initial release last year to just $200 on Black Friday), so this was a no brainer. A lot of the feedback on this card online is negative since they’re referencing the $/efficiency when it first came out. At this price, it’s a bargain.I haven’t seen much of an increase in performance, but XMP now works. I don’t overclock, so the K version wasn’t necessarily on my list. The boost clock speeds are almost identical to the K version, and the base clock means cooler idle temps which are both wins for me.I did have to update bios on my Z370 mobo to get it to work. You HAVE to update your bios if you have a mobo older than the Z390 boards by using an 8th generation coffee lake chip, which in this case, I did have.Temps fluctuate. Apparently it’s from the speedshift technology. It reads changes in processes and temps adjust accordingly within 1/4th of a second, so benchmarks might be a bit alarming for novices. Otherwise, while gaming, the temps were around 53-60 temps. Using an aftermarket cooler. DO NOT USE THE INCLUDED STOCK COOLER. Noctua has amazing coolers.Also, for reference, I’m using a SFF case, so your cooling mileage will vary. These chips can have been told to run hot, so make sure you upgrade your cooler.Did I need this chip? Probably not. But this chip upgrade was the only sensible upgrade I can make before upgrading my mobo.I’m using a 1440p monitor and everything is stunning. I figure I’ll upgrade my GTX1070 to something more recent to pair with the i7 9th gen. For these generation of boards, which are now obsolete, this is the best buy in this scenario.However, if you plan on buying a brand new setup, I would stay away from this chip and the coffee lake/refresh family. By buying this chip, you’ll be trapping yourself, being unable to upgrade your chip in the future (since future chipsets are no longer compatible on these boards). These chips and boards have become obsolete and intel has moved onto more advanced chipsets. This chip is great for those within the Z370/390 family that got left behind or didn’t want to upgrade their motherboards. For those who know, join us.', 'I bought the i7-9700F in March 2022 - today June 13 2022, the processor has stopped working yesterday. I went to official Intel website to claim the 3 years warranty.  It is a valid number recognized by Intel; The processor has been replaced successfully.', "I downgraded from a Ryzen 3rd gen to save money in order to buy a faster GPU. This is a stopgap solution for me, I knew I was getting less performance. At least I saved a few bucks on the motherboard, purchased used. I woudn't recommend this CPU if you are starting from scratch, its clock is too low, overclocking is iffy and you will be using more power to make it work compared to more recent offerings from AMD.", "Installed in gaming machine and got the performance expected. Fully compatible with Windows 11. Together with a decent video card, RAM and SSD, it can be used to play any video game there is. There's always better, but for the price this is the best choice for gaming and software performance.", 'i7 9700F CPU arrived as ordered and was appearance wise in very good condition.  We installed the chip on an ASUS B365M-A Prime (Gaming) motherboard and ran benchmark tests. The CPU performed as expected.', "I upgraded my PC at the right time and I'm glad I did Lol my old gaming PC was so outdated lmfao but anyways I'm not having any issues", "Now that the 10th gen is out, this is an obsolete review.  Go for the 10XXX series.  However, at the time I bought this, it was a pretty good deal for a decent CPU.  Replaced my 9600K, and I have no regarts.  I can say that something was weird for a while after putting this in.  I'm not sure if it was the motherboard, or the network card on the motherboard, but I was getting weird errors in chrome, and random tabs just erroring out.  I updated the BIOS and put in a 10G NIC, and the problem went away.  Going by the errors, I would say the BIOS update fixed it, but as I changed both at the same time, I don't know.  But now I'm left with a nice PC that works well with my RTX 2080 in 4K.  I'm happy.", 'Really enjoyed the processor and have had no issues with it so far running games with ray tracing. Love the CPU and would recommend to a friend!', 'Reçu 3 jours après avoir commander ! Super', "I first purchased i5 9400 hd 6 CORE 2.9ghz at 4.1ghz overclocked. It was good. it was how do you say. A processor you know it processes thangs and such. I have asus z390 plus gaming wifi up to1gbs wifi its like 888gbs with 650w supply. 32gb ddr4 3600mhz silicon hyperx gaming GPU radeon rx 570. High tower musetex case wwwwwooooooo!!!! Beautiful. So When this i7 9400f dropped to $250 from $400 just before black Friday. Everyone everyone look at the pics.👆☝I jumped gun u can see why. everything looks epic and it all by random is x.m.p compatible. 2020 HDR10+ 4K VIZIO 43inch tv. Yeah i will shoot my own eyes out. Old man. That's why I got it!!!😍😨😍😨😍💻🖥😂😂😂😂😎😎😎😎"]
No Reviews

Product: AMD Ryzen™ 9 7950X3D 16-Core, 32-Thread Desktop Processor
Reviews: ["So, first off, I paid $690 for this CPU, replacing an older one so I could play Starfield and upgrade to Windows 11. It claimed to run overclocked at 5.7 ghz. I wanted the fastest best chip. All other CPUs I ever bought from AMD had the overclocking unlocked. This one was not and the software from AMD said it could NOT be unlocked due to the 3D feature. So, it's sold as running at 5.7 ghz, but the software they released says it can't, I couldn't get it to, and my computer shop wasn't able to. I put all that in just for anyone that will say I simply don't know what I'm doing. I called AMD. I wrote them. I read their website and articles. It runs at 4.2, which is barely a little faster than my previous AMD cpu from 2012. 4.2 is much slower than 5.7. They also promised a free Star Wars game with it, but AMD didn't honor the promotion. Within a couple of weeks of selling it to me at the insanely high price, they were discounting it as much as $130. So, I felt stupid for trusting them. I will say, it does run fine. I was able to upgrade to Windows 11 and I do run Starfield with it. Ironically, the only software I had any trouble running came from AMD itself. I'm using it fine with an expensive motherboard, 64GB RAM and an AMD 12GB graphics card. Other than overclocking or getting it to run any faster than 4.2 ghz, I have had no problems with this processor. But since 4.0 processors have been out well over a decade, this is way too much to pay for a 4.2 one. If anyone at AMD or anywhere else actually gets this processor running at 5.7 ghz, I still overpaid, but I'd at least be happier with the purchase. I've got lots of computers and you'd think they'd want happy customers. I've always chosen AMD because of their price, warranty and customer service, but this time it's not broken, so it's not a warranty replacement issue. According to their own software, it can't be unlocked which means it's not designed to EVER really run at 5.7. Too bad nearly every place that sells it still claims that it does, including AMD's website. Like I said, even my overpaid computer techs could not get it to run anywhere near the OC speed. On the other hand that meant it has never overheated, but this could also be because I overpaid for the best water cooling system. There's no game or app my previous cpu liked that isn't better on this one. I hope AMD reads this, gives me the free game, and makes their software and processor work as their website claims. If they do those things, well, it's still too expensive to get all the stars. I was too generous with my money as well as with the stars in this review. But it does run my computer and it does that well. It just doesn't run nearly as fast, isn't running the Star Wars game because they didn't keep their promise and cost way too much. Oh, I also thought the customer service person was rude at AMD, unlike Amazon who are usually super nice. I could give you all the technical details, but others have done that. I told you what matters to me, a nearly lifelong AMD fanboy.", "People bought the overpriced $450 7800X3D and thought it was a good deal, no. That thing has only 8 cores and can't run background task like video exporting, ... while you are video gaming. Also, that one is not great for working. How about spending $100 more for this beast and get both a gaming and working machine with a 16 core monster that are capable of multitasking? I bought this thing for $557 and it came with the Premium edition of Starfield that cost $100. What can I ask for more? The 7950X3D is the best. You can game and open multiple browser tabs, run video editing task in the background without worrying. Just run process lasso when playing video game to move the game to ccd cores. Be sure to equip 64GB memory for it. Why? It has 16 cores, 32 threads. Each thread should have 2GB on paper. Why equip 32GB for a 32 thread chip? Don't listen to people that say 32GB is enough.", 'AMD Ryzen 9 7950X3D è una bestia da 32 core logici, raffreddato con un THERMALRIGHT PEERLESS ASSASSIN 120SE non va mai oltre i 75°, nel bios ho settato comunque il limite a 80° per sicurezza (AI TWEAKER - PRECISION BOOST OVERDRIVE - ENHANCEMENT (THERMAL LIMIT - LEVEL 2 80°C), pasta termica THERMAL GRIZZLY, nessun problema.', "Early on, people were having issues with this chip. Mostly through the motherboard and software since it is new tech. Since then, it has become stable enough. There seems to be a variance with the overclock or undervolt capability from chip to chip. I don't see a real advantage to this chip vs the next highest rated chip. You really just want it because its the newest.there is slighlty better multicore performance, but you really have to need it.The other nice thing about this chip is less power usage and lower max temps. It also has some room for undervolting on the power curve and still getting max speed out of it.I suggest you get a really good aftermarket cooler (AIO) to get the most out of this chip.", "Non mi dilungherò sulle sue caratteristiche, stuoli di esperti lo hanno testato in tutti i modi e con i suoi avversari di sempre, i processori Intel. Al momento in cui l'ho acquistato, considerando che è particolarmente votato al gaming, nei benchmark è avanti di un buon 10% (e oltre in qualche caso), per contro è costoso (sebbene, con un atto coraggioso, il suo prezzo di lancio era lo stesso del suo predecessore, il 5800x3D), consuma ben 100w (103 per l'esattezza, in TBD, anche se credo possa arrivare a 180w e oltre) e come dicevo è l'ideale per il gaming, per altri usi credo siano soldi sprecati.", "The AMD Ryzen 9 7000 7950X3D is a testament to the relentless innovation from AMD. Leveraging the cutting-edge 3D V-cache technology, this processor offers performance levels previously unseen in the consumer CPU market.From a sheer computational perspective, it effortlessly handles intense multi-threaded applications and provides remarkable gaming performance. The added cache delivers a palpable improvement in latency-sensitive tasks, ensuring that users get a snappier and more responsive computing experience.The thermals and power efficiency, aided by the refined architecture, mean that not only is this chip fast, but it also runs cooler and more efficiently than its predecessors. This leads to quieter PC operations, even under load.In the realm of content creation, gaming, and general multitasking, the 7950X3D stands out as a behemoth. The seamless integration with the AM4 platform is a boon for those looking to upgrade without overhauling their entire system.To conclude, the AMD Ryzen 9 7000 7950X3D is a game-changer. It underscores AMD's commitment to pushing the boundaries of what's possible in consumer-grade processors. If you're in the market for uncompromised performance, this CPU is a stellar choice. Highly recommended!", 'Ottimo prodotto, venditore ottimo arrivato prima del previsto.', 'Runs a little on the hotter side while idle (80c), but overall a nice processor. Paired with the 4070ti, it’s fantastic.', 'Paired strix x670 e-e, 7950x3d, G.Skill Neo, h150i with strix 4070 oc... Graphics to the max on most games 95-125 fps. Able to install with ease! Load temps with corsair h150i elite say between 38-40c. These 16 cores can load up multiple +8 accounts of Eve online in under 2 mins! Top notch cpu! Previous cpu fx 9590 black edition. That was a fantastic processor.', "Running this chip with a DeepCool LT720 360mm rad with an ElecGear Carbon fiber contact frame with kingpin KPX thermal compound. In a lighter gaming workload, I didn't see temps get above 55C on the hottest sensor from hwinfo in the recommended config from AMD. I don't think high temperatures will be a problem for this particular chip, at least not outside what the rest of the 7000 series family can hit.I personally haven't had any stability concerns with this processor in the 3 weeks that I have ran it in place of my 7700x, even with EXPO enabled. In terms of average framerate, this chip feels like a 7700x subjectively, as I have no issues getting frames to a 4090 that I can tell. The 3d cache helps with 1%/.1% lows, to the point that the majority of the micro stutters I had gotten from my 7700x are largely gone in gameplay. There may be a small stutter when swapping from a game to a non game on another screen if using AMD's recommended config, but not enough to be a bother.Overall, if you want to mess around with extra cores later on (streaming, encode, etc.) but want the 3dcache for games now AND your budget allows for it, the 7950X3D is a pretty solid pick in my book for the enthusiast who wants the best without heading into server CPU territory.PC specs relevant to review:Asus ROG Crosshair x670E Extreme (with ElecGear contact frame, BIOS 1415)Gskill Trident Z5 Neo 32gb ddr5 6000 CL30 (EXPO)DeepCool Lt720 360mm radiatior (stock fans with unit, KPX compound)Gigabyte RTX 4090 gaming OC"]

Product: Intel Core i9-13900F Desktop Processor 24 cores (8 P-cores + 16 E-cores) 36MB Cache, up to 5.6 GHz
Reviews: ['I bought this admittedly excessive CPU for a new build in a Shuttle barebones computer. I keep systems for a long time and they run 24X7 so reliability and future-proofing is important to me. This processor supports 24 threads via 4 performance cores and 16 efficiency cores. All of my computers run shared scientific jobs under the BOINC model so all machines are pushed pretty hard. I\'m glad to say that these CPU\'s cores run relatively coolly with 16 efficiency cores running at 100% saturation full time and the temperatures are in the 70-80C range which is fantastic given that the efficient Shuttle cooling system does it all via a little 3" fan, some fancy heat pipes and heat exchanger and does so quite quietly. I\'m not a gamer but I suspect that the CPU would handle almost anything thrown at it on the 4 performance cores and 8 threads although some heavier cooling might be called for if the performance cores were at 100% but I\'ll probably never know. Despite the eye-watering price I\'m quite satisfied with the purchase.', "Beware when upgrading, things get funny.  First, make sure to update the bios if you have a 600 series mobo.  Even then, there were issues with booting.  I had to use an old SSD on a USB to boot into safe mode, and only then was I able to reboot into safe mode with my NMVe OS drive.  Seems there's some sort of CPU encryption/associating that goes on and the new CPU will not recognize your old OS drive.  Anyway, I did get it to work and the chip performs as expected - amazing!  I can't give 5 stars because it was such a hassle to install.  Great CPU and price.  I highly recommend it for new builds.  32cores!", "Fast.Gets hot, but probably not as hot as the other 13900 models.280 FPS in Warzone 2's benchmark (w/ 4080 GPU and 7000 mhz DDR5))I upgraded from a 3950x with 3733 Mhz DDR 4 w/ the same GPU.Previously the max FPS I received in Warzone 2's benchmark was about 110.In CS GO I went from like 260 FPS in Dust 2, to 500 FPS."]

Product: Intel Core i3-13100F Desktop Processor 4 cores (4 P-cores + 0 E-cores) 12MB Cache, up to 4.5 GHz (BX8071513100F)
Reviews: ['El producto llegó antes de la fecha establecida, el embalaje venía muy bien logrado para protejer el producto, es la primera compra que hago a Dicotech pero he quedado completamente satisfecho.', 'ゲームはやらないので、日常の使用には十分です。久しぶりの自作だったのですが、ピンのが図の変化に驚かされました。', 'Excellent price and performance', 'Es un procesador interesante con 4 núcleos y 8 hilos, tiene un rendimiento excepcional.', '', "When this thing is on sale I will buy a few. Every time I do a build with this cpu or the 12100f it sells quickly! match this with a b660 mobo and you have a cheap combo that can run anything you throw at it. If you're looking to get into pc gaming then give this cpu a good hard look. You won't be disappointed...", 'Terrible for gaming, lots of micro-stuttering.', 'muy bueno', "this bad boy can run at full utlization at the maximum 4.30GHz constantly and never exceed 80 celsius with just the included intel cooler! despite having only 4 cores and 8 threads, this baby out-performs nearly every other cpus (yes, that includes those 16-core amd cpus). not to mention the crazy low price for such high performance! you'd have to be insane to not buy this!! 11/10, completely recommend."]

Product: Intel Core i9-13900 Desktop Processor 24 cores (8 P-cores + 16 E-cores) 36MB Cache, up to 5.6 GHz
Reviews: ['Installed fine. My MSI motherboard wants to run it at the power levels it would for a K processor. And it actually works fine, just gets hot really fast. As seen under HWMonitor, it will hit the 100 degree thermal throttle limit when any significant benchmark program is run.  I worked around this by changing the cooler profile in the MSI bios from "liquid" to either "tower air" or "box".  "Box" profile  changes the automatic PL1 and PL2 settings to run as the i9-13900 non-K spec limits.  For a little overclocking performance, I set "tower air cooling" mode in the bios and experimented with slightly lower PL1 and PL2 settings as well as lowering the throttle limit from 100 to 95 degrees.  Works great now.', 'Got exactly what I ordered the intel i9 13900 no K model or 12900k. So for those who didn’t order due to the incorrect description I took the risk for you.', 'There seems to be some discrepancy between the Model # and the item itself. Rest assured, you will indeed get the i9-13900. See the attached for some rather impressive benchmarks. I did not think there would be that much difference between Normal and Turbo modes, but boy, was i wrong. Intel was quite helpful by providing link to their own diag tools:1. Intel® System Support Utility (Intel® SSU Report)2. Intel® Processor Diagnostic Tool3. Intel® Extreme Tuning Utility (Intel® XTU).4. Intel® Processor Identification Utility']

Product: Intel Core i9-13900KS Desktop Processor 24 cores (8 P-cores + 16 E-cores) 36MB Cache, up to 6.0 GHz, (BX8071513900KS)
Reviews: ['Previously I had the AMD 7950x and it was pretty fast, don’t get me wrong. However, this 13900ks is a lot snappier even browsing around in windows 11. Programs launch faster and games are buttery smooth @ 4k ultra details, when paired with an Nvidia 4090. I also love the fact that the ks is a “binned” CPU, which overclocks more easily and typically handles faster DDR5 memory in the range of 7800-8400Mhz depending on how good the memory controller is in your 13900ks sample. Regardless, you will probably be able to hit 7800-8000 at the least. This purchase is actually my 2nd 13900ks and I ended up getting a better binned version this time. With an overal(Asus) SP of 113, P Cores 123, e cores 93, and memory controller was 83. Im currently running a G.Skill 32GB(2x16GB) 7800mhz DDR5 kit with XMP turned on in the BIOS. I have been able to bump it up to a stable 8000mhz by bumping up the Memory Controller voltage to 1.4v and the VDD/VDDQ voltage to 1.5v using the same timings that were on my 7800 XMP kit CL36. With the CPU and a Corsair h170i 420mm AIO with 6 fans in a push pull configuration, I was able to get a stable CPU overclock of 60/60/58/58/58/58/58/58 on the (8) P cores, but I’m pretty sure I can bump the 1-3 core workloads higher. It’s when using a workload that requires all 8 P cores that I run into some stability issues with my current cooling trying to push it past 5.8Ghz using all 8 p cores. I leave my E cores all synced at 4.3Ghz stock to help give me more P core Overclock headroom. Another overclock method that works really well, is easy and stable, is to turn on the Asus AiOverclock. Given that I have used both an MSI and Asus Z790 motherboard, I highly recommend the Asus ROG brand line for a Z790 compatible motherboard for this 13900ks. They update their BIOS version frequently and there quality is typically very good on there products that are produced in higher numbers. The absolute ideal motherboard for Overclocking and using the fastest DDR5 ram would be the Asus ROG Maximus Z790 APEX(2-DIMM) motherboard. If you just can’t get your hands on one maybe go with the (4-DIMM) Asus ROG Maximus Z790 Hero motherboard. You should be able to reach up to 7600mhz DDR5 on it. Whatever you do don’t settle on a motherboard, because it’s the center of the system and can be upgraded later. I started with an MSI Meg Z790 Ace and wish I had started with an Asus. The MSI ran a lot hotter with the same clock speeds and only supported up to 7200mhz DDR5 using 2x16GB sticks. The motherboard attached in the review photo is the Asus ROG Maximus Z790 APEX, a thermal Grizzly 12/13th gen contact frame to make the cpu more level for the heatsink cooler that goes on top and of course the 13900ks that’s a little dirty from previously applied thermal paste I just wiped off. Sorry for the long winded review, but this has been my favorite CPU that I’ve owned.  It’s super fast and you can tinker with it for an easy overclock for fun.', 'Very fast for any application and gaming.With liquid 3 fan cooling system, never gets above 50 deg C in my setup.Get over 250 fps in WOT at 4k res with all graphics settings at max', 'At the time of this review, this is the top of the line for gaming CPU’s. The first ever chip to hit 6.0Ghz out of the box. It’s amazing. I have no trouble with anything running or processing on this. Paired with 128GB of ram and a 4090, you can conquer any game or task that the average person could ever need. If you can get one, do it! Just avoid the inflated prices though.', 'No regrets on picking this cpu - it ROCKS, go team blue !', "Works just fine, really fast, lots of cores.  With all the cores running, they will run up to 100 C and throttle back on clock speed with pretty much any standard CPU cooler.  The consensus seems to be that this is limited by the thermal connection inside the CPU case between the actual chip and the upper surface which contacts your cooling block.  In other words, the cores can overheat even if your cooling system can maintain the upper surface of the CPU at room temperature.  You don't want the cores running hot at 99 C for any length of time, and so you really need to tune the CPU clock speed and the voltages with a motherboard that permits overclock tuning.  With a good standard CPU cooler, I found it's possible to run continuously with a 4.7 GHz clock on all 24 cores and keep the core temperatures below 85 C.", "Even with a premium water cooling AIO utilizing 2 of the most powerful 140mm fans on the market (Noctua NF-A14 ippc 3000RPM PWM) cooling my radiator, this CPU hits 100C (thermal throttling) in about 2 seconds at full load on all 32 threads in Cinebench R23.  While my AIO does allow it to run at 5700MHz at 100C, the CPU is using over 330 Watts at that speed & delivering an impressive Cinebench score of 41697.  Basically it's too much CPU for any cooler on the market.  Even manually clocking the CPU at 4500MHz cap sees temps at 92C with fans on 100% speed.To get a decent daily use speed that doesn't drive the fans at freight train noise levels, I have to manually down-clock the CPU to 3500MHz which still gives great gaming performance, but keeps the fans down to about 60% fan speed.While the CPU is great for video editing, I don't think that it's worth the premium price over the 3GHz 13900K processor.  Wish I had saved some $$$ instead of going for the higher clock rate.....", 'I have this chip installed on an Asus z790 Hero. It runs like a dream and I am very pleased with the performance. Coming from an AMD 5950x system - the Intel z790 system and this chip just feel noticeably more snappy and run everything smooth as butter. I got lucky with a 113SP rating and the chip easily holds up to 6.3ghz on multiple cores at once. You pay to play for this one, but that is why its the KING of both gaming and professional workloads.', 'really awesome speeds i can get out of this. arctic II 420mm cools this really really nicely.', 'Expensive but powerful.', "But you're going to pay for it"]
